<title level="1" pfs="">[Bleachling Survivor](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3636)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

It is almost unheard of for gnomes to survive the horrendous sickness known as the Bleaching, but those few who do are permanently altered. Having lived through the worst disease known to their kind, bleachling survivors often emerge jaded and reckless, traveling to seek out mind-bending experiences and heady thrills that will awaken something in them again. Though their experiences may toughen them, they are not unfriendly. Most try to help others they meet during their travels who might not be as unshakable.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 18

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 16

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 13
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Bleachling_Survivor.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 2">[Bleachling Survivor](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3636)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=721" />
<trait label="Small" />
<trait label="Gnome" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=617" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=628" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 182

**Perception** +8; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Fey](/Languages.aspx?ID=119), [Gnomish](/Languages.aspx?ID=5)

**Skills**
[Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +7, [Medicine](/Skills.aspx?ID=42) +8, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44) +7, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +8

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +1

**Dex** +1

**Con** +3

**Int** +1

**Wis** +3

**Cha** +1
</row>

**Unflappable** When the bleachling survivor rolls a critical failure on a check with the [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=590) trait, they get a failure instead.

**Items**
[Dagger](/Weapons.aspx?ID=3), [Longbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=76) (20 arrows)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 17 

**Fort** +5 

**Ref** +8 

**Will** +12 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 34

</row>

**Flinch Back** <actions string="Reaction" /> **Trigger** An enemy moves into an adjacent space; **Effect** The bleachling survivor Steps up to 10 feet. They must end this movement in a space that is not adjacent to an enemy.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
dagger +9 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)),
**Damage** 1d4+1 piercing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fist +9 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)),
**Damage** 1d4+1 bludgeoning

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
longbow +9 ([deadly d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [range increment 100 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [volley 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=201), [reload 0](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)),
**Damage** 1d8 piercing

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
dagger +9 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [thrown 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)),
**Damage** 1d4+1 piercing

**Sneak Attack**   The bleachling survivor deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) creatures.

</column>

name: Bleachling Survivor

<title level="1" pfs="">[Gnome Daredevil](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3637)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

These nimble warriors capitalize on their slight stature and dexterous movements to evade and overtake their foes on the battlefield. Their unmatched skill with the gnome flickmace allows a daredevil to strike from a short distance and twirl away unscathed, sometimes hitting hard enough to topple their foes.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 16

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 14

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 11
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

</traits>

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +8, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +7, [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=45) +8, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=50) +7

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +3

**Dex** +4

**Con** +1

**Int** +1

**Wis** +1

**Cha** +3
</row>

**Items**

**Melee**

**Damage** 1d6+3 piercing

**Daredevil Strike** <actions string="Two Actions" />  **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The gnome daredevil Strides up to their Speed, makes a melee Strike, then Steps.

</column>

<title level="1" pfs="">[Razzle Dazzler](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3638)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

The razzle dazzler is a particularly beguiling sort of entertainer who specializes in delighting with illusions and showy displays. Whether with their illusory double or some well-timed fireworks, they are exceptionally good at keeping their audiences focused on one display to distract from the secrets that make their magic possible.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 20

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 18

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 15
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Razzle_Dazzler.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 5">[Razzle Dazzler](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3638)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Small" />
<trait label="Gnome" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=617" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=628" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 183

**Perception** +12; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Elven](/Languages.aspx?ID=4), [Fey](/Languages.aspx?ID=119), [Gnomish](/Languages.aspx?ID=5)

**Skills**
[Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35) +10, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +14, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) +14, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +12, [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=45) +14, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=50) +12

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +1

**Dex** +3

**Con** +1

**Int** +2

**Wis** +1

**Cha** +4
</row>

**Items**
[Dagger](/Weapons.aspx?ID=3), [Dueling Cape](/Equipment.aspx?ID=680), [Hand Crossbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=69) (20 bolts)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 20 

**Fort** +9 

**Ref** +12 

**Will** +15 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 78

</row>

**Daunting Charisma** <actions string="Free Action" /> **Trigger** The razzle dazzler rolls initiative using [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) or [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=45); **Effect** The razzle dazzler can attempt to [Demoralize](/Actions.aspx?ID=2395) one creature they can see.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
dagger +13 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)),
**Damage** 1d4+3 piercing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fist +13 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)),
**Damage** 1d4+3 bludgeoning

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
hand crossbow +13 ([range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 1](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)),
**Damage** 1d6+2 piercing

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
dagger +13 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [thrown 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)),
**Damage** 1d4+3 piercing

**Arcane Spontaneous Spells** DC 22, attack +15
- **Cantrips (3rd)**
[Figment](/Spells.aspx?ID=1528), [Light](/Spells.aspx?ID=171), [Prestidigitation](/Spells.aspx?ID=229), [Telekinetic Hand](/Spells.aspx?ID=1715), [Telekinetic Projectile](/Spells.aspx?ID=334)
- **1st**
[Dizzying Colors](/Spells.aspx?ID=1500), [Illusory Disguise](/Spells.aspx?ID=159), [Illusory Object](/Spells.aspx?ID=160), [Ventriloquism](/Spells.aspx?ID=356) (4 slots)
- **2nd**
[Illusory Creature](/Spells.aspx?ID=158), [Illusory Object](/Spells.aspx?ID=160), [Laughing Fit](/Spells.aspx?ID=1583), [Revealing Light](/Spells.aspx?ID=1653) (4 slots)
- **3rd**
[Enthrall](/Spells.aspx?ID=104), [Hypnotize](/Spells.aspx?ID=1564), [Illusory Disguise](/Spells.aspx?ID=159) (3 slots)

**Dazzling Duplicate** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=11), [Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92), [Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) The razzle dazzler creates an illusory duplicate of themself in their space that lasts for 1 round. A creature who attacks the razzle dazzler must first attempt a DC 11 flat check. On a failure, the attack misses the razzle dazzler and destroys the illusion instead, ending this effect.

</column>

<title level="1" pfs="">[Gnome Conservationist](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3639)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

The natural world boasts unsurpassed beauty and countless variety, and the gnome conservationist is devoted to experiencing and protecting as many examples of this grandeur as they possibly can. These gnomes are stalwart allies to animals and plants, and they find it exceptionally easy to build an outstanding rapport with almost all creatures they encounter on their travels.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 22

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 20

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Gnome_Conservationist.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 6">[Gnome Conservationist](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3639)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Small" />
<trait label="Gnome" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=617" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=628" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 184

**Perception** +17; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Gnomish](/Languages.aspx?ID=5)

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +13, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=37) +11, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +15, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +15

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +2

**Dex** +1

**Con** +1

**Int** +2

**Wis** +4

**Cha** +2
</row>

**Animal Elocutionist** The conservationist can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) skill with [animals](/Traits.aspx?ID=531).

**Items**
seeds (functions as [sling bullets](/Weapons.aspx?ID=430)), _+1 [sling](/Weapons.aspx?ID=430)_, trowel (functions as a [sickle](/Weapons.aspx?ID=364))

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 23 

**Fort** +17 

**Ref** +11 

**Will** +14 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 100

</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
trowel +14 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196)),
**Damage** 1d4+8 slashing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fist +14 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)),
**Damage** 1d4+8 bludgeoning

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
_sling_ +16 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Propulsive](/Traits.aspx?ID=191), [range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 1](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)),
**Damage** 1d6+7 bludgeoning

**Primal Prepared Spells** DC 24, attack +17
- **Cantrips (3rd)**
[Detect Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=66), [Gouging Claw](/Spells.aspx?ID=920), [Know the Way](/Spells.aspx?ID=1582), [Light](/Spells.aspx?ID=171), [Tangle Vine](/Spells.aspx?ID=1713)
- **1st**
[Charm](/Spells.aspx?ID=34), [Gentle Landing](/Spells.aspx?ID=1542), [Runic Body](/Spells.aspx?ID=1657), [Spider Sting](/Spells.aspx?ID=300)
- **2nd**
[Animal Messenger](/Spells.aspx?ID=11), [Darkvision](/Spells.aspx?ID=60), [Entangling Flora](/Spells.aspx?ID=1515), [Oaken Resilience](/Spells.aspx?ID=1617)
- **3rd**
[Grease](/Spells.aspx?ID=140), [Mad Monkeys](/Spells.aspx?ID=702), [Safe Passage](/Spells.aspx?ID=712)

**Wild Leadership** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) With a primal incantation, the gnome conservationist inspires a willing animal. The animal becomes [quickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=89) for 1 round. It can use this additional action only to [Climb](/Actions.aspx?ID=2374), [Burrow](/Actions.aspx?ID=2310), [Fly](/Actions.aspx?ID=2312), Stride, or Strike.

</column>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-421" />
name: Gnome Conservationist

Goblins eat almost anything. Though they'll survive on raw or little-cooked meat, some prefer searing or frying their food first—or better yet, pickling it! A goblin chef can make anything edible (at least to a goblin). **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 15 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 13 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 10 [Goblin Chef](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3640) **Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 186 **Perception** +7; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Goblin](/Languages.aspx?ID=6) **Skills** [Cooking Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +10, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +7, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47) +4, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +6, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +7 **Str** +1 **Dex** +1 **Con** +3 **Int** +2 **Wis** +2 **Cha** +0 **Good Enough to Eat** The goblin chef can turn otherwise inedible items into meals for others. They can provide food for any number of creatures without using the [Subsist](/Actions.aspx?ID=2368) downtime activity as long as garbage is readily available. A non-[goblin](/Traits.aspx?ID=618) who eats the goblin chef's food must attempt a DC 14 Fortitude save. On a failure, they suffer an upset stomach for 1 day; if they attempt to willingly ingest anything else during that period, they must first succeed at a DC 4 flat check or the action is [disrupted](/Rules.aspx?ID=2342).
**Kitchen Specialist** For encounters involving cooking, a goblin chef is a 3rd-level challenge. **Items** cleaver (functions as [dogslicer](/Weapons.aspx?ID=405)), leather apron (functions as [leather armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=41)), pickles (6) --- **AC** 16 **Fort** +10 **Ref** +6 **Will** +5 +2 circumstance bonus against [ingested](/Traits.aspx?ID=633) [poisons](/Traits.aspx?ID=669) **HP** 24 **Immunities** [sickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91) --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** jaws +7 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)), **Damage** 1d6+1 piercing **Melee** cleaver +7 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Backstabber](/Traits.aspx?ID=172), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179)), **Damage** 1d4+1 slashing **Eat a Pickle** **Effect** The goblin chef draws a pickle and eats it or feeds it to an adjacent ally. The chef or ally gains 4 temporary Hit Points and ignores any penalties from [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=590) effects or [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=73) for 1 round.
name: Goblin Chef
search_markdown:

markdown:
Many goblins scavenge materials, shiny objects, and anything else they can get their hands on, but a goblin scavenger is the best at finding such useful items. More importantly, they're great at making use of them without killing themselves. Most of the time. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 19 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 14 [Goblin Scavenger](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3641) **Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 186 **Perception** +14; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Goblin](/Languages.aspx?ID=6) **Skills** [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=37) +12, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47) +8, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +11, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +10, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=50) +9 **Str** +1 **Dex** +3 **Con** +2 **Int** +2 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +0 **Items** [Big Boom Gun](/Weapons.aspx?ID=226) (10 rounds), bundle of fireworks, [dogslicer](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1675), [Leather Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=4) --- **AC** 21 **Fort** +9 **Ref** +11 **Will** +13 **HP** 70 **Finders Keepers** **Trigger** A creature within 15 feet drops an item; **Requirements** The goblin scavenger has a hand free; **Effect** The goblin scavenger Strides up to their speed to an adjacent square and Interacts to pick up the item. The movement triggers reactions as normal, but the Interact action to pick up the item does not. --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** dogslicer +12 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Backstabber](/Traits.aspx?ID=172), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179)), **Damage** 2d6+3 slashing **Melee** jaws +12 ([Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)), **Damage** 1d8+3 piercing **Ranged** big boom gun +14 ([cobbled; fatal d12; modular B](/Traits.aspx?ID=178), [or S; range 20 feet; reload 1](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 2d6+2 modular **Fireworks Barrage** ([Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) **Requirement** The goblin scavenger has a free hand; **Effect** The goblin scavenger draws a bundle of fireworks and launches them toward a point within 60 feet, where they explode, dealing 1d10 fire damage and 1d10 sonic damage in a 10-foot burst. Every creature in the area must attempt a DC 21 Reflex save.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected. The goblin scavenger realizes that's because a firework fell at their feet and takes 2 fire damage when it explodes in their face.
**Success** The creature takes half damage.
**Failure** The creature takes full damage and is [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=65) and [deafened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=66) for 1 round.
**Critical Failure** As failure, except the creature is also [stunned 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=93). **One Person's Junk** The goblin scavenger intuitively knows how to make use of junk. When they use a weapon with the [goblin](/Traits.aspx?ID=618) trait or an improvised weapon, they do an additional die of damage (already included in the Strikes above).
name: Goblin Scavenger

There is little more terrifying than a goblin raiding party out to take from its neighbors. A swarming mix of commandos, pyros, and war chanters armed with dogslicers, horsechoppers, burning torches, and sharp teeth, this troop enjoys pillaging unprepared communities. Their song is an unsettling counterpart to the screams of their victims. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 20 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 18 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 15 [Goblin Get Gang](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3642) **Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 187 **Perception** +12; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Goblin](/Languages.aspx?ID=6) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +12, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +13, [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=45) +13, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +10 **Str** +3 **Dex** +2 **Con** +3 **Int** +0 **Wis** -1 **Cha** +4 --- **AC** 21 **Fort** +13 **Ref** +14 **Will** +9 **HP** 90 (4 segments) **Weaknesses** area damage 5, [splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=699) damage 5 **Goblins Chant and Goblins Sing!** ([auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=541), [aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542)) 30 feet. The goblin get gang's disharmonious chorus of disturbing lyrics makes it difficult to concentrate. Any creature performing a [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561) action in the area must succeed at a DC 19 Will save or the action is lost. On a critical success, the creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute.
**[Troop Defenses](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=44)** --- **Speed** 25 feet; [troop movement](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=85) **Goblins Bound and Goblins Swing!** Goblins have difficulty staying in formation, especially during combat. The goblin get gang can take a [move](/Traits.aspx?ID=658) action only if it has used at least one action to Goblins Slash and Goblins Scar! this turn or if there are no conscious enemies adjacent to it. **Goblins Burn and Goblins Char!** The troop's members throw a barrage of burning torches. Each creature in a 10-foot burst within 30 feet of the troop takes 2d8 fire damage with a DC 20 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. When the troop is reduced to 2 or fewer segments, this area decreases to a 5-foot burst. **Goblins Slash and Goblins Scar!** Frequency once per round; Effect The goblin get gang uses dogslicers, horsechoppers, and burning torches to attack each enemy in a 5-foot emanation, with a DC 20 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. The damage depends on the number of actions.
1d6 slashing damage and 1d6 fire damage
1d6+6 slashing damage and 1d6 fire damage
1d6+9 slashing damage and 1d6 fire damage.
name: Goblin Get Gang

creature_ability: Stab it! Stab it! Stab it!
markdown:
Big boss goblins order members of their band around and deal with any longshanks they come across—sometimes via violence or diplomacy, and sometimes by ordering another goblin to deal with them (in ways that the big boss goblin approves of if they work or claims were awful ideas they never would have tried if they don't). These goblin leaders often insist on impressive titles or sobriquets like “The Exceedingly Incendiary,” “Snake Singer,” or “Most Gluttonest,” though these can often be exaggerated by several degrees for dramatic effect or even change at the big boss goblin's whim (often to one-up a rival). **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 22 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 20 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17 [Big Boss Goblin](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3643) **Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 188 **Perception** +16; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Goblin](/Languages.aspx?ID=6) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +15, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) +13, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +15, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +11 **Str** +3 **Dex** +1 **Con** +3 **Int** +1 **Wis** +1 **Cha** +3 **Items** battered crown (or other symbol of authority), [Hide Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=7), _+1 [horsechopper](/Weapons.aspx?ID=409)_, [Shortbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=77) (20 arrows) --- **AC** 22 **Fort** +17 **Ref** +11 **Will** +14 **HP** 100 **[Reactive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=48)**
**Not Me!** ([manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=645)) **Trigger** The big boss goblin is targeted with an attack, and a [goblin](/Traits.aspx?ID=618) is adjacent to them; **Effect** The big boss goblin yanks the goblin in front of the attack to face the consequences in their stead. The big boss goblin gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their AC against the triggering attack. If it hits, the big boss goblin takes half damage, and the other goblin takes the remaining half. --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** _horsechopper_ +17 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196), [versatile P](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 1d8+5 slashing **Melee** jaws +15 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)), **Damage** 1d6+5 piercing **Ranged** shortbow +14 ([deadly 1d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 0](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)), **Damage** 1d6+2 piercing **No Fight Fair** A big boss goblin fights dirty, slashing at a foe's hamstrings. Whenever the big boss goblin hits an [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) foe, the creature takes a –5-foot status penalty to its speed (–10-foot on a critical hit) until the creature regains any amount of Hit Points. As with all penalties to Speed, this can't reduce a creature's Speed below 5 feet. **Stab it! Stab it! Stab it!** The big boss goblin picks a target they can see within 30 feet and orders any allied goblins to attack. A single [goblin](/Traits.aspx?ID=618) with a lower level than the big boss goblin that is adjacent to the target can immediately use their reaction to Strike the target. In addition, until the start of the big boss goblin's next turn, their attacks against that target deal 1 additional damage dice as the big boss goblin leads them.
name: Big Boss Goblin

markdown:
Renowned for their culinary expertise, halfling head chefs navigate the complex world of high cuisine with flavorful creations and fiery tempers. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 16 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 14 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 11 [Halfling Head Chef](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3644) **Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 190 **Perception** +7; (15 to smell and taste) keen eyes, [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=74) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 30 feet **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Halfling](/Languages.aspx?ID=7) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +7, [Baking Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +15, [Cooking Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +17, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +7, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47) +6 **Str** +1 **Dex** +3 **Con** +2 **Int** +2 **Wis** +1 **Cha** +1 **Culinary Specialist** For encounters involving cooking and taste, the head chef is a 7th-level challenge.
**Keen Eyes** The halfling gains a +2 circumstance bonus when using the [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=2301) action to find [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=79) or [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=96) creatures within 30 feet of them. Whenever the halfling targets a creature that is [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=62) or hidden from them, reduce the DC of the flat check to 3 for a concealed target or 9 for a hidden one. **Items** chef's hat, [Filcher's Fork](/Weapons.aspx?ID=51), [Frying Pan](/Weapons.aspx?ID=286), herbs and spices --- **AC** 17 **Fort** +8 **Ref** +7 **Will** +7 **HP** 36 **Dash of Spice** **Trigger** The head chef is targeted with a melee attack by an adjacent attacker they can see; **Effect** The head chef uses Spice Mix against the attacker. --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** hot frying pan +9 ([fatal d8](/Traits.aspx?ID=178)), **Damage** 1d4+3 bludgeoning plus 1d4 fire **Melee** filcher's fork +9 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Backstabber](/Traits.aspx?ID=172), [deadly d6](/Traits.aspx?ID=174)), **Damage** 1d4+3 piercing **Melee** fist +9 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)), **Damage** 1d4+3 bludgeoning **Ranged** filcher's fork +9 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Backstabber](/Traits.aspx?ID=172), [deadly d6](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [thrown 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)), **Damage** 1d4+3 piercing **Angry Rant** ([Auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Linguistic](/Traits.aspx?ID=101), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The chef shouts a flurry of insults and criticisms at either an ally or enemy within 30 feet with the following effects:
**Ally** The chef's assistant is shaken by the barrage of criticism but is determined to work faster and harder. The target becomes [quickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=89) for 1 round but is also [frightened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=76). They can use the extra action to Interact, Step, or Stride, or as part of an action or activity to prepare, cook, or serve food.
**Enemy** The target must succeed a DC 18 Will save or take 1d6 mental damage and become frightened 1 (or 2d6 mental damage and frightened 2 on a critical failure). **Spice Mix** The head chef throws a mixture of irritating spices into an adjacent creature's eyes, causing the creature to be [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=65) until it Interacts to clear its vision.
Chef's Menu A halfling head chef crafts exquisite dishes that tantalize the taste buds. Delights like honeyblossom pudding (honey, cream, and flower petals), stuffed burrow rolls (meat and vegetables wrapped in flaky pastry), sunberry glazed roast (meat marinated in sunberry sauce), and root medley gratin (layers of root vegetables and cheese) showcase their prowess.
name: Halfling Head Chef

Boisterous collectives of thrill-seeking halflings join in bill-bands to engage in spirited competitions and lively sports. They foster a sense of camaraderie among their members while leaving a trail of chaos in their wake. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 20 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 18 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 15 [Bill-Band](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3645) **Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 190 **Perception** +10; keen eyes **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Halfling](/Languages.aspx?ID=7) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +12, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +13, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +13, [Sports Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +11 **Str** +4 **Dex** +3 **Con** +4 **Int** +0 **Wis** -1 **Cha** +2 **Keen Eyes** The halfling gains a +2 circumstance bonus when using the [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=2301) action to find [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=79) or [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=96) creatures within 30 feet of them. Whenever the halfling targets a creature that is [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=62) or hidden from them, reduce the DC of the flat check to 3 for a concealed target or 9 for a hidden one. --- **AC** 20 **Fort** +13 **Ref** +12 **Will** +8 +3 status vs. [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) checks **HP** 90 (4 segments) **Weaknesses** area damage 5, [splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=699) damage 5 **[Troop Defenses](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=44)** --- **Speed** 25 feet; overwhelming scrum, [troop movement](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=85) **Down to Our Level** **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The bill-band deliberately gets under the feet of their opponents, proving they are greater than the sum of their parts. The bill-band attempts to [Trip](/Actions.aspx?ID=2382) all creatures in or adjacent to their space. They roll one [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) check and compare the result to the Reflex DC of each target. **Firecracker Salvo** **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The bill-band launches a barrage of lit firecrackers that, upon impact, burst into light and sound. Each creature in a 10-foot burst within 60 feet takes 1d12 sonic damage with a DC 19 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. A creature that fails its save is also [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=65) for 1 round. When the bill-band is reduced to 2 or fewer segments, this area decreases to a 5-foot burst. **Overwhelming Scrum** The bill-band swarms in and around other creatures. They can move into other creatures' spaces, and other creatures can move into their spaces. The bill-band's spaces are [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) to other creatures. **Stick It to 'Em!** **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The bill-band swings barely coordinated fists and feet at each enemy in their space and in a 5-foot emanation, with a DC 19 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. The damage depends on the number of actions.
1d6 bludgeoning damage
2d6+4 bludgeoning damage
3d6+6 bludgeoning damage.
name: Bill-Band

Halfling smugglers are sought out for their ability to deftly navigate the shadowy underworld to move illicit goods and information. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 22 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 20 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17 [Halfling Smuggler](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3646) **Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 191 **Perception** +13; keen eyes **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Halfling](/Languages.aspx?ID=7) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +14, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +11, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +14, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +14, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47) +10, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +15, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=50) +16, [Underworld Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +14 **Str** +3 **Dex** +4 **Con** +2 **Int** +0 **Wis** +1 **Cha** +2 **Grease Some Palms** A smuggler is adept at navigating official channels and makes network contacts in order to keep their goods moving. They gain a +2 circumstance bonus to [Make an Impression](/Actions.aspx?ID=2392) and [Request](/Actions.aspx?ID=2393) with members of the local bureaucracy.
**Keen Eyes** The halfling gains a +2 circumstance bonus when using the [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=2301) action to find [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=79) or [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=96) creatures within 30 feet of them. Whenever the halfling targets a creature that is [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=62) or hidden from them, reduce the DC of the flat check to 3 for a concealed target or 9 for a hidden one. **Items** [Arsenic](/Equipment.aspx?ID=104), [Disguise Kit](/Equipment.aspx?ID=19), [lesser elixir of life](/Equipment.aspx?ID=91), _+1 [filcher's fork](/Weapons.aspx?ID=407)_, [fine clothes](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2715), [Leather Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=4), [Sling](/Weapons.aspx?ID=72), [lesser smoke ball](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3360), [Thieves' Toolkit](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2758) --- **AC** 23 **Fort** +12 **Ref** +16 **Will** +13 **HP** 95 --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** _filcher's fork_ +17 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Backstabber](/Traits.aspx?ID=172), [deadly d6](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 1d4+9 piercing **Melee** fist +16 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)), **Damage** 1d4+9 bludgeoning **Ranged** _filcher's fork_ +17 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Backstabber](/Traits.aspx?ID=172), [deadly d6](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [thrown 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)), **Damage** 1d4+9 piercing **Ranged** sling +16 ([Propulsive](/Traits.aspx?ID=191), [range increment 50 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 1](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)), **Damage** 1d4+7 bludgeoning **Distracting Escape** **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** Smugglers succeed by making a move only after they've diverted others' attention. The smuggler [Creates a Diversion](/Actions.aspx?ID=2387). If the smuggler became hidden to at least one creature, the smuggler can then [Sneak](/Actions.aspx?ID=2405). **Hidden Pockets** **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The smuggler Interacts to draw an item of light Bulk concealed in one of their hidden pockets. The pockets can store up to four objects of light Bulk. For most smugglers, these items are [arsenic](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3322), a [lesser elixir of life](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3308), a [lesser smoke ball](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3360), and a [thieves' toolkit](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2758). The smuggler can refill the pockets over the course of 1 minute. **Sneak Attack** The smuggler deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) creatures.
name: Halfling Smuggler

Yarnspinners weave captivating tales that entertain, educate, and preserve the rich heritage of the halfling people across generations. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 23 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 21 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 18 [Halfling Yarnspinner](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3647) **Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 192 **Perception** +14; keen eyes **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Halfling](/Languages.aspx?ID=7) **Skills** [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35) +16, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +16, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) +16, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +14, [History Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +19, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44) +17, [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=45) +19, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46) +15, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47) +15 **Str** -1 **Dex** +4 **Con** +0 **Int** +4 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +5 **Keen Eyes** The halfling gains a +2 circumstance bonus when using the [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=2301) action to find [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=79) or [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=96) creatures within 30 feet of them. Whenever the halfling targets a creature that is [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=62) or hidden from them, reduce the DC of the flat check to 3 for a concealed target or 9 for a hidden one.
**Tale Specialist** For encounters involving storytelling, local history, or lore, the yarnspinner is a 10th-level challenge. **Items** book of fables, [Chain Shirt](/Armor.aspx?ID=6), _+1 [halfling sling staff](/Weapons.aspx?ID=438)_ (20 bullets), _+1 [shortsword](/Weapons.aspx?ID=398)_ --- **AC** 24 **Fort** +11 **Ref** +15 **Will** +18 **HP** 110 **Guidance Through Tales** ([auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=541), [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561), [linguistic](/Traits.aspx?ID=642), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647)) **Trigger** An ally the yarnspinner can see fails a skill check; **Effect** The yarnspinner offers a brief reminder about a legendary hero, granting their ally a +2 circumstance bonus to the triggering skill check, potentially turning the failure into a success. --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** _shortsword_ +16 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 1d6+3 piercing plus resonant weapons **Melee** fist +15 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)), **Damage** 1d4+3 bludgeoning **Ranged** _halfling sling staff_ +16 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Propulsive](/Traits.aspx?ID=191), [range increment 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 1](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)), **Damage** 1d10+3 bludgeoning plus resonant weapons **Occult Spontaneous Spells** DC 26, attack +18 - **Cantrips (4th)** [Daze](/Spells.aspx?ID=61), [Detect Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=66), [Figment](/Spells.aspx?ID=1528), [Light](/Spells.aspx?ID=171), [Read Aura](/Spells.aspx?ID=246) - **1st** [Illusory Disguise](/Spells.aspx?ID=159), [Illusory Object](/Spells.aspx?ID=160), [Mindlink](/Spells.aspx?ID=195), [Ventriloquism](/Spells.aspx?ID=356) (4 slots) - **2nd** [Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=164), [Laughing Fit](/Spells.aspx?ID=1583), [Revealing Light](/Spells.aspx?ID=1653), [Soothe](/Spells.aspx?ID=291) (4 slots) - **3rd** [Haste](/Spells.aspx?ID=147), [Heroism](/Spells.aspx?ID=149), [Ring of Truth](/Spells.aspx?ID=1656), [Soothe](/Spells.aspx?ID=291) (4 slots) - **4th** [Confusion](/Spells.aspx?ID=48), [Honeyed Words](/Spells.aspx?ID=1558), [Translocate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1724) (3 slots) **Mesmerizing Tale** ([Auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [Aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Linguistic](/Traits.aspx?ID=101), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) The yarnspinner weaves a long-winded but captivating narrative that enchants those nearby. Any creature that's in a 20-foot emanation or starts its turn in the aura must attempt a DC 24 Will save. The Mesmerizing Tale lasts until the end of the yarnspinner's next turn, but can be Sustained. The first time the yarnspinner Sustains the aura on subsequent rounds, the aura expands by 10 feet, to a maximum of 60 feet.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected, and is temporarily immune for 24 hours.
**Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Failure** The creature becomes [fascinated](/Conditions.aspx?ID=72) with the yarnspinner until the start of its next turn, and must spend all its actions to move closer to the yarnspinner and listen to the tale. **Resonant Weapons** ([Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [Sonic](/Traits.aspx?ID=147)) If the yarnspinner's Mesmerizing Tale aura is active or they have cast a spell within the last round, their Strikes with magic weapons deal an additional 2d10 sonic damage.
name: Halfling Yarnspinner

<title level="1" pfs="">[Hobgoblin Spellbreaker](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3648)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Largely due to an ancestral grudge against all things [elven](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=414), many hobgoblins have an inherent distrust for magic, particularly the “elf magic” of the arcane tradition. Most hobgoblin armies maintain a contingent of special “spellbreaker” forces trained to assassinate high-value spellcasting targets prior to military engagement or quickly identify and terminate enemy battle mages.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 18

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 16

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 13
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 3">[Hobgoblin Spellbreaker](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3648)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Hobgoblin" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=757" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=628" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 194

**Perception** +9; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), arcane magic sense ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 60 feet

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Goblin](/Languages.aspx?ID=6)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +9, [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35) +10, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +10, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +9, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +9

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +3

**Dex** +1

**Con** +1

**Int** +3

**Wis** +1

**Cha** +1
</row>

**Arcane Magic Sense** The hobgoblin spellbreaker can detect the source of any [arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=534) magic within range as an [imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412) sense.

**Items**
[Breaching Pike](/Weapons.aspx?ID=274), [Crossbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=67) (10 bolts), [Scale Mail](/Armor.aspx?ID=8), [Shortsword](/Weapons.aspx?ID=43)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 18 

**Fort** +12 

**Ref** +6 

**Will** +9 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 50

</row>

**Spellbreaking Reactive Strike** <actions string="Reaction" /> As [Reactive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=48), but if it was triggered by a creature casting an [arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=534) spell, the target must succeed at a DC 11 flat check or the spell is [disrupted](/Rules.aspx?ID=2312). If the Strike was a critical hit, the spell is disrupted automatically.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
breaching pike +12 ([Razing](/Traits.aspx?ID=488), [Reach](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 1d6+6 piercing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
shortsword +12 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)),
**Damage** 1d6+6 piercing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fist +12 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)),
**Damage** 1d4+6 bludgeoning

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
crossbow +10 ([range increment 120 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 1](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)),
**Damage** 1d8+3 piercing

**Shatter Spell** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The hobgoblin spellbreaker attempts a melee Strike against a creature under the effects of a beneficial [arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=534) spell. If the Strike hits and deals damage, the hobgoblin spellbreaker can attempt to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) a single arcane spell or arcane magical effect on the target (counteract rank 2, counteract modifier +10). If it fails, the hobgoblin spellbreaker can't attempt to counteract the same effect for 1 hour.

</column>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-430" />
name: Hobgoblin Spellbreaker

A hobgoblin battalion is usually composed of multiple soldiers and archers commanded by a single captain, although every battalion also has its own internal hierarchy that clearly defines the chain of command should the current captain fall in battle. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 22 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 20 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17 [Hobgoblin Battalion](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3649) **Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 194 **Perception** +15; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Goblin](/Languages.aspx?ID=6) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +15, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +14, [Warfare Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +12 **Str** +5 **Dex** +0 **Con** +3 **Int** +0 **Wis** +2 **Cha** +2 --- **AC** 23 **Fort** +15 **Ref** +12 **Will** +14 **HP** 90 (4 segments) **Weaknesses** area damage 8, [splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=699) damage 8 **[Reactive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=48)**
**[Troop Defenses](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=44)** --- **Speed** 25 feet; [troop movement](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=85) **Coordinated Strikes** **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The battalion thrusts their spears at each enemy in a 5-foot emanation with a DC 21 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. The damage depends on the number of actions.
1d6+2 slashing damage
2d6+5 slashing damage
3d12+7 slashing damage **Focused Volley** The hobgoblin battalion's archers draw or reload their crossbows, then launch a ranged attack in the form of a volley. This volley is a 10-foot burst within 120 feet that deals 2d8 piercing damage with a DC 21 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. When the hobgoblin battalion is reduced to 2 or fewer segments, this area is reduced to a 5-foot burst. **Perfect Formation** The battalion raises a perfect guard against explosions. It gains a +2 item bonus to AC and a +2 status bonus to Reflex saves until the start of its next turn.
name: Hobgoblin Battalion

<title level="1" pfs="">[Hobgoblin Vanguard](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3650)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Though there are times for precision and discipline, every hobgoblin general also understands the value of demoralizing the enemy with a show of overwhelming force. No military unit is better suited to this purpose than the vanguard, a heavily armed and armored elite unit that inspires their fellow soldiers to action while breaking the enemy's lines and morale with terrifying explosive weapons.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 24

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 22

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 19
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Hobgoblin_Vanguard.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<trait label="Hobgoblin" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=757" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=628" />

[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +18, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=37) +17, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +16, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +16

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +5

**Dex** +2

**Con** +3

**Int** +2

**Wis** +1

**Cha** +1
</row>

**Items**
alchemical grenades, [Alchemist's Toolkit](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2702), [Full Plate](/Armor.aspx?ID=13), _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2829) [maul](/Weapons.aspx?ID=388)_

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 27 

**Fort** +19 

**Ref** +13 

**Will** +16 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 150

</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Melee**

_maul_ +19 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Shove](/Traits.aspx?ID=193)),
**Damage** 2d12+8 bludgeoning plus [Knockdown](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=46)

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fist +19 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)),
**Damage** 1d4+8 bludgeoning

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
alchemical grenade +16 ([range increment 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [Splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=150)),
**Damage** 2d8 acid, cold, electricity, or fire plus 2 [persistent damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) and 2 [splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=699) damage of the same type

**Shock and Awe** <actions string="Reaction" /> ([Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163)) **Trigger** The hobgoblin vanguard critically hits a creature with an alchemical grenade Strike; **Effect** The hobgoblin vanguard attempts to [Demoralize](/Actions.aspx?ID=2395) the creature with a mere look. If the target creature was reduced to 0 Hit Points by the triggering Strike, the hobgoblin vanguard can instead attempt to Demoralize all opponents within 30 feet, rolling once and comparing the result to each target's Will DC.

</column>

markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="">[Bone Scavenger](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3651)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Kholos have a strong connection to their ancestors, often using their bones as art and weapons to further honor them. Bone scavengers are sent to the fields after a battle to collect the bones of their fellow allies. They often eschew the pack hunting techniques of other kholos, spreading out among their foes when encountered in groups.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 14

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 12

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 9
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Bone_Scavenger.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 0">[Bone Scavenger](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3651)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Small" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=628" />
<trait label="Kholo" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=758" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 196

**Perception** +6; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Kholo](/Languages.aspx?ID=122)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +5, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +2, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +4, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +6, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +4

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +2

**Dex** +3

**Con** +1

**Int** -1

**Wis** +1

**Cha** +0
</row>

**Items**
[Dagger](/Weapons.aspx?ID=3) (2)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 16 

**Fort** +3 

**Ref** +6 

**Will** +3 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 16

</row>

**Bone Armor** <actions string="Reaction" /> **Trigger** The bone scavenger takes bludgeoning damage; **Effect** The bone scavenger angles their makeshift armor to absorb some of the blow, causing shards of bone to splinter outward. All adjacent creatures take 2d4 piercing damage (DC 16 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save).

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
dagger +6 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)),
**Damage** 1d4+2 piercing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
jaws +5,
**Damage** 1d6+2 piercing

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
dagger +6 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [thrown 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)),
**Damage** 1d4+2 piercing

**Rugged Travel**   A kholo ignores the first square of [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) they move into each time they Step or Stride.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="">Ant Kholos</title>

The bone scavenger belongs to the ant kholo heritage, smaller and with larger ears than other kholos. You can change this NPC to a different kholo heritage by making it Medium, and you can conversely change a different kholo NPC to an ant kholo by making their size Small.
</aside>

<title level="1" pfs="">[Kholo Pragmatist](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3652)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Due to their aggressive lifestyle, kholo warriors rarely live to an old age. When a kholo pragmatist enters a fight, they would prefer to see another battle, so they use any possible advantage they can get to survive. They keep foes at a distance with their longspears have developed techniques to better block attacks with the weapon. If the tide of battle turns against them, kholo pragmatists will run or surrender if it's the most practical option.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 15

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 13

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 10
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 1">[Kholo Pragmatist](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3652)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=628" />
<trait label="Kholo" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=758" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 196

**Perception** +7; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Kholo](/Languages.aspx?ID=122)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +6, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +6, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47) +4, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +7, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +7

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +2

**Dex** +2

**Con** +1

**Int** +2

**Wis** +2

**Cha** +0
</row>

**Items**
[Leather Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=4), [Longspear](/Weapons.aspx?ID=6), [Sling](/Weapons.aspx?ID=72) (20 bullets)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 16 

**Fort** +4 

**Ref** +6 

**Will** +8 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 22

</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
longspear +7 ([Reach](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 1d8+2 piercing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
jaws +7,
**Damage** 1d6+2 piercing

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
sling +7 ([Propulsive](/Traits.aspx?ID=191), [range increment 50 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 1](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)),
**Damage** 1d6+1 bludgeoning

**Pack Attack**   A kholo pragmatist deals 1d4 extra damage to any creature that's within reach of at least two of the kholo pragmatist's allies.

**Pragmatic Aid** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163)) **Requirements** The kholo pragmatist is adjacent to a foe; **Effect** The kholo pragmatist sets up an advantageous avenue of attack for an ally within 10 feet of the same foe and then Steps away from that foe. The foe is [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) to the kholo pragmatist's ally's next attack.

**Rugged Travel**   A kholo ignores the first square of [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) they move into each time they Step or Stride.

**Spear Parry** <actions string="Single Action" />  **Requirements** The kholo pragmatist is wielding a longspear; **Effect** The kholo pragmatist positions their spear defensively, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of their next turn.

</column>

<title level="1" pfs="">[Kholo Outrider](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3653)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Many kholo packs are semi-nomadic, staying in one place until they're pushed out by others, or the local resources begin to grow sparse. Before moving the pack elsewhere, the leaders send out a single kholo to blaze a trail and ensure a safe route to their next destination. These outriders are masters of the wilderness and fight better when they're alone.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 23

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 21

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 18
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Kholo_Outrider.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 7">[Kholo Outrider](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3653)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=628" />
<trait label="Kholo" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=758" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 197

**Perception** +18; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Kholo](/Languages.aspx?ID=122)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +13, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +18, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +13, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +15, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +18

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +4

**Dex** +3

**Con** +2

**Int** +1

**Wis** +3

**Cha** +0
</row>

**Items**
_+1 [composite shortbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=435)_ (20 arrows), _+1 [hatchet](/Weapons.aspx?ID=382)_ (2), [Hide Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=7)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 25 

**Fort** +14 

**Ref** +18 

**Will** +13 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 120

</row>

**[Reactive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=48)** <actions string="Reaction" /> 

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 30 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
_hatchet_ +19 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Sweep](/Traits.aspx?ID=194)),
**Damage** 1d6+7 slashing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
jaws +18,
**Damage** 1d6+7 piercing

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
_hatchet_ +17 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Sweep](/Traits.aspx?ID=194), [thrown 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)),
**Damage** 1d6+7 slashing

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
_composite shortbow_ +17 ([deadly d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Propulsive](/Traits.aspx?ID=191), [range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 0](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)),
**Damage** 1d6+5 piercing

**Bloody Flurry** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The kholo outrider Strikes, Steps, then Strikes again. If the kholo outrider hits the same enemy with both Strikes, that enemy takes an additional 1d6 [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29).

**Rugged Travel**   A kholo ignores the first square of [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) they move into each time they Step or Stride.

**Solo Hunter**   A kholo outrider deals 1d6 extra damage while adjacent to at least 2 enemies and no allies.

</column>

<title level="1" pfs="">[Kobold Trapper](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3654)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Kobolds are skillful artisans, always inventing new traps and snares to defend their territory and ambush enemies. Kobold trappers enjoy showing off their crafting prowess on the battlefield.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 16

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 14

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 11
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Kobold_Trapper.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 2">[Kobold Trapper](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3654)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Small" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=628" />
<trait label="Kobold" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=759" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 198

**Perception** +7; (9 to [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=2301) for [traps](/Traits.aspx?ID=715)) [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Sakvroth](/Languages.aspx?ID=118)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +5, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=37) +8, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +7, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +7

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +1

**Dex** +3

**Con** +1

**Int** +3

**Wis** +2

**Cha** +0
</row>

**Booby-Trapped** A kobold trapper protects items in their backpack with a booby trap. This booby trap requires a successful DC 18 Perception check to notice, and two successful DC 15 [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=50) checks to disable. Accessing the backpack without disabling the trap destroys its contents, and splinters explode in a 10-foot burst centered on the backpack, dealing 3d6 piercing damage (DC 15 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save).

**Items**
[Backpack](/Equipment.aspx?ID=4), [Crossbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=67) (20 bolts), formula book (containing formulas for three 1st- or 2nd-level [snares](/Traits.aspx?ID=809)), [Leather Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=4), [Light Hammer](/Weapons.aspx?ID=384)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 18 

**Fort** +5 

**Ref** +11 

**Will** +8 

+1 circumstance to all defenses vs. [traps](/Traits.aspx?ID=715)
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 32

</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
light hammer +7 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)),
**Damage** 1d6+1 bludgeoning

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
claw +7 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)),
**Damage** 1d4+1 slashing

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
crossbow +9 ([range increment 120 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 1](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)),
**Damage** 1d8 piercing

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
light hammer +9 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [thrown 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)),
**Damage** 1d6+1 bludgeoning

**Construct Trap** <actions string="Three Actions" /> ([Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) The kobold trapper creates a rudimentary trap on a surface in an adjacent square. The trap activates the next time a creature moves adjacent to it. The creature takes 2d6 bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (determined by the trapper when the trap is constructed) with a DC 18 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. On a failure, the creature also takes a –5 status penalty to all Speeds for 1 minute. The trap is destroyed when activated or after 8 hours, whichever comes first. A trapper typically carries enough raw materials to make six traps each day.

</column>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-435" />
name: Kobold Trapper

<title level="1" pfs="">[Kobold Egg Guardian](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3655)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Kobold egg guardians are some of the best warriors in a tribe, tasked with protecting the next generation. They pledge to give their lives to protect the tribe's eggs, though not before exhausting all their tricks.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 18

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 16

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 13
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Kobold_Egg_Guardian.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 3">[Kobold Egg Guardian](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3655)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Small" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=628" />
<trait label="Kobold" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=759" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 198

**Perception** +9; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Sakvroth](/Languages.aspx?ID=118)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +9, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +11, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +9, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) +9

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +3

**Dex** +3

**Con** +1

**Int** +0

**Wis** +0

**Cha** +3
</row>

**Items**
[Crossbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=67) (20 bolts), [Leather Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=4), [Longspear](/Weapons.aspx?ID=6)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 19 

**Fort** +9 

**Ref** +12 

**Will** +6 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 48

</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
longspear +12 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 1d8+5 piercing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
claw +12 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)),
**Damage** 1d4+5 slashing

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
crossbow +12 ([range increment 120 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 1](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)),
**Damage** 1d8+2 piercing

**Immobilizing Thrust** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The kobold egg guardian makes a longspear Strike. If the Strike hits, the target must attempt a DC 20 Reflex save. On a failure, the creature is [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=81) until the kobold egg guardian moves, attacks with the longspear, or is no longer wielding the longspear.

**Luring Retreat** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163)) The kobold egg guardian screams and Strides up to their Speed. Each enemy who sees or hears the kobold egg guardian must succeed at a DC 17 Will save or be [fascinated](/Conditions.aspx?ID=72) by the egg guardian for 1 round. On the creature's turn, it must use at least 1 action (or 2 actions on a critical failure) to move closer to the kobold egg guardian (while avoiding obvious dangers). Regardless of the result of the save, targets are then immune to Luring Retreat for 24 hours.

</column>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-435" />
name: Kobold Egg Guardian

<title level="1" pfs="">[Root Leshy Groundskeeper](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3656)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Hardy root leshies have the strength and stamina to dig furrows for planting seeds over long hours. Though they're humble even among leshies, they can be extremely stubborn even against powerful adversaries.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Plant](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 13

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 11

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 8
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Root_Leshy_Groundskeeper.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature -1">[Root Leshy Groundskeeper](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3656)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Small" />
<trait label="Leshy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=639" />
<trait label="Plant" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=668" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 200

**Perception** +5; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Fey](/Languages.aspx?ID=119); [_speak with plants_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1681) (root vegetables only)

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +5, [Labor Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +2, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +5, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +4, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +5

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +3

**Dex** +0

**Con** +3

**Int** -1

**Wis** +2

**Cha** +0
</row>

**Items**
shovel (functions as [pick](/Weapons.aspx?ID=389))

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 14 

**Fort** +8 

**Ref** +2 

**Will** +5 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 9

</row>

**Verdant Burst** ([healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=623), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676), [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509)) When the root leshy groundskeeper dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from their body, restoring 1d4 Hit Points to each plant creature in a 30-foot emanation. This area immediately fills with roots and vines, becoming [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453). If the terrain is not a viable environment for these plants, they wither after 24 hours.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
shovel +5 ([fatal d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=178)),
**Damage** 1d6+3 piercing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fist +5 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)),
**Damage** 1d4+3 bludgeoning

**Primal Innate Spells** DC 13
- **Constant (3rd)**
[Speak with Plants](/Spells.aspx?ID=294) (root vegetables only)

**[Change Shape](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=55)** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) The root leshy groundskeeper transforms into a Small root vegetable. This ability otherwise uses the effects of [_one with plants_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1618).

**Root in Place** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) The root leshy groundskeeper roots themself into the ground, reducing their Speed to 0 and granting them a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and 2 temporary Hit Points until the start of their next turn.

</column>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-437" />
name: Root Leshy Groundskeeper

markdown:
A tumbleweed leshy's ability to move quickly across long distances with ease allows them to act as messengers and go-betweens. [Druids](/Classes.aspx?ID=6) often entrust these couriers with delivering important messages to their home druid circles or other druids they're acquainted with. Some even induct the couriers into the circle to teach them [Wildsong](/Languages.aspx?ID=116) for secure communication and basic magic for self-defense. **[Recall Knowledge - Plant](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 18 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 16 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 13 [Tumbleweed Leshy Courier](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3657) **Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 200 **Perception** +12; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Fey](/Languages.aspx?ID=119); [_speak with plants_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1681) (tumbleweeds and scrubland brush only) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +11, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) +8, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +10, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47) +7, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +9, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +10 **Str** +1 **Dex** +4 **Con** +1 **Int** +0 **Wis** +2 **Cha** +2 **Tumbling Traveler** The tumbleweed leshy courier gains a +10-foot circumstance bonus to Speed while traveling during exploration mode. **Items** [Crossbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=67) (20 bolts), [Dagger](/Weapons.aspx?ID=3) --- **AC** 19 **Fort** +6 **Ref** +12 **Will** +9 **HP** 35 **Spiny Burst** ([healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=623), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676), [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509)) When the tumbleweed leshy courier dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from their body, restoring 2d8 Hit Points to each plant creature in a 30-foot emanation. This area immediately fills with brambles and thistles, becoming [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453). Any creature that moves through the area takes 1 piercing damage per square traversed. If the terrain is not a viable environment for these plants, they wither after 24 hours.
**Nimble Dodge** **Trigger** The tumbleweed leshy courier is targeted with an attack by an attacker they can see; **Effect** The leshy gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. --- **Speed** 30 feet **Melee** dagger +11 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 1d4+5 piercing **Melee** fist +11 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)), **Damage** 1d4+5 bludgeoning **Ranged** crossbow +12 ([range increment 120 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 1](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)), **Damage** 1d8+2 piercing **Primal Innate Spells** DC 17 - **Constant (3rd)** [Speak with Plants](/Spells.aspx?ID=294) (tumbleweeds and scrubland brush only) **[Change Shape](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=55)** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) The tumbleweed leshy courier transforms into a Small tumbleweed. This ability otherwise uses the effects of [_one with plants_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1618). Additionally, when the leshy uses their Change Shape ability, they still have a Speed of 10 feet for the purpose of travel during exploration mode.
name: Tumbleweed Leshy Courier

markdown:
A thick forest or flourishing farm sometimes sees an explosion of primal magic leading to the creation of a multitude of leshies. When still young, these spirits might band together with their crop-mates for protection or to achieve a mutual goal. Used to growing in rows, many corn leshies can form a sizable legion. **[Recall Knowledge - Plant](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 19 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 14 [Corn Leshy Throng](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3658) **Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 201 **Perception** +10; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Fey](/Languages.aspx?ID=119); [_speak with plants_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1681) (corn only) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +11, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +10, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +12 **Str** +2 **Dex** +3 **Con** +2 **Int** +0 **Wis** +2 **Cha** +2 --- **AC** 21 **Fort** +8 **Ref** +13 **Will** +10 **HP** 54 (4 segments) **Weaknesses** area damage 5, splash damage 5 **Encircling Maze** A corn leshy throng is arranged in rows of stalks to envelop foes, stretching upward to block their vision. It can move into other creatures' spaces, and other creatures can move into its squares.
When a Medium or smaller creature attempts to enter any of the corn leshy throng's spaces, it must attempt a DC 20 [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) check. If the creature fails, it gets turned around—all the throng's squares are [greater difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) for it until the end of this turn. A creature needs to attempt this check only the first time in a round it attempts to enter one of the throng's squares.
**[Troop Defenses](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=44)**
**Verdant Burst** ([healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=623), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676), [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509)) When the corn leshy throng dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from their body, restoring 3d8 Hit Points to each plant creature in a 30-foot emanation. This area immediately fills with stalks of corn, becoming [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453). If the terrain is not a viable environment for these plants, they wither after 24 hours. --- **Speed** 25 feet; [troop movement](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=85) **Boxing Ears** **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The corn leshy throng lashes out with hardened ears of corn to attack each enemy in its space and in a 5-foot emanation, with a DC 18 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. The damage depends on the number of actions.
1d6 bludgeoning damage
2d6+4 bludgeoning damage
2d6+8 bludgeoning damage **Kernel Barrage** The throng's members fling a bombardment of corn kernels. Each creature in a 30-foot cone takes 2d6 bludgeoning damage with a DC 18 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. When the throng is reduced to 2 or fewer segments, this area decreases to a 15-foot cone.
name: Corn Leshy Throng

<title level="1" pfs="">[Gourd Leshy Witch](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3659)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Some spooky leshies learn the ways of occult spellcasting from strange spirits of nature that lurk just out of sight or under cover of darkness. These witches treat their brooms as their familiars, imbuing the wood and straw with a sliver of sentience.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Plant](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 22

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 20

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Gourd_Leshy_Witch.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 6">[Gourd Leshy Witch](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3659)</title>

<row gap="medium">

**Cha** +1

**Verdant Burst** ([healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=623), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676), [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509)) When the gourd leshy witch dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from their body, restoring 4d8 Hit Points to each plant creature in a 30-foot emanation. This area immediately sprouts gourds, becoming [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453). If the terrain is not a viable environment for these plants, they wither after 24 hours.

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
dagger +12 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)),

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fist +12 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)),
**Damage** 1d4+6 bludgeoning plus 1d6 void

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
dagger +12 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [thrown 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)),
**Damage** 1d4+6 piercing plus 1d6 void

**Occult Prepared Spells** DC 24, attack +16
- **Cantrips (3rd)**
[Daze](/Spells.aspx?ID=61), [Detect Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=66), [Figment](/Spells.aspx?ID=1528), [Shield](/Spells.aspx?ID=280), [Void Warp](/Spells.aspx?ID=1745)
- **1st**
[Fear](/Spells.aspx?ID=110) (×2), [Ill Omen](/Spells.aspx?ID=696)
- **2nd**
[Force Barrage](/Spells.aspx?ID=1536), [Grim Tendrils](/Spells.aspx?ID=141), [Paranoia](/Spells.aspx?ID=214)
- **3rd**
[Force Barrage](/Spells.aspx?ID=1536), [Slow](/Spells.aspx?ID=289), [Vampiric Feast](/Spells.aspx?ID=1736)
