- **3rd**
[Wilding Word](/Spells.aspx?ID=809)

**Primal Innate Spells** DC 24
- **Constant (3rd)**
[Speak with Plants](/Spells.aspx?ID=294) (gourds only)

**[Change Shape](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=55)** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127), [primal The gourd leshy witch transforms into a Small gourd. This ability otherwise uses the effects of [_one with plants_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1618).](/Traits.aspx?ID=125)) 

**Short Flight** <actions string="Single Action to Two Actions" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) **Frequency** once per round; **Requirements** The gourd leshy witch is wielding a broom; **Effect** The gourd leshy hops on their broom, which briefly takes flight. The witch [Flies](/Actions.aspx?ID=2312) 20 feet (or 40 feet if they spend 2 actions), though they must end this movement on solid ground or fall at the end of their turn.

**Sweeping Spell** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [Spellshape](/Traits.aspx?ID=513)) **Requirements** The gourd leshy witch is wielding their broom; **Effect** If the next action the gourd leshy witch uses is to cast a non-[cantrip](/Traits.aspx?ID=550) spell that deals damage to a single target, the witch's broom flies out and attempts to [Shove](/Actions.aspx?ID=2380) that creature with an [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) modifier of +16. On a critical success, the target is also knocked [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=88). The broom immediately returns to the gourd leshy witch's hand.

</column>

markdown:
Iruxi tidewater guards are capable fighters skilled at amphibious attacks and overpowering vessels along any shore. Because lizardfolk settlements are typically constructed partially underwater and partially above, they have need of defenders who can guard from attacks in both environments. The special spaulders tidewater guards wear set them apart from other lizardfolk warriors. These protect their shoulders from cutlass and axe strikes, and might be constructed of dragon scales, turtle or giant chiton shells, lacquered wood, or even sea urchin tests. The recipe for the special resin iruxi armorers apply to harden these spaulders is a closely guarded secret, and each iruxi community's supply of the resin is small, precious, and closely guarded. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 19 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 14 [Tidewater Guard](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3660) **Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 204 **Perception** +10 **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Iruxi](/Languages.aspx?ID=32) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +11, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +12, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +10, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +11, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +10 **Str** +4 **Dex** +3 **Con** +1 **Int** -1 **Wis** +2 **Cha** +0 **Deep Breath** A tidewater guard can [hold their breath](/Rules.aspx?ID=2436) for 20 minutes.
**Tethered Tridents** The tidewater guard's tridents are specially prepared to be aquadynamic and tethered by ropes. They have the [tethered](/Traits.aspx?ID=804) trait, meaning that a wielder who has a free hand can Interact to pull the weapon back into their grasp after they have thrown it as a ranged attack or after it has been disarmed (unless it is being held by another creature). **Items** [Studded Leather Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=5), [trident with 50 feet of line](/Weapons.aspx?ID=45) (2) --- **AC** 21 **Fort** +11 **Ref** +11 **Will** +10 **HP** 60 **[Reactive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=48)** --- **Speed** 25 feet, swim 25 feet **Melee** trident +14 ([Tethered](/Traits.aspx?ID=252)), **Damage** 1d8+7 piercing **Melee** claw +14 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)), **Damage** 1d6+7 piercing **Ranged** trident +13 ([Tethered](/Traits.aspx?ID=252), [thrown 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)), **Damage** 1d8+7 piercing **Reel In** The tidewater guard makes a ranged Strike with their trident. If the Strike hits, the guard can haul on the attached line, [moving](/Rules.aspx?ID=451) the target up to 30 feet in a straight line toward the iruxi. **Terrain Advantage** Non-[lizardfolk](/Traits.aspx?ID=760) creatures that are in [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) or are in water and lack a swim Speed are [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) to the tidewater guard.
name: Tidewater Guard

markdown:
Iruxi masked mummers bring lizardfolk myths to life, donning elaborate costumes and bone masks to enact stories featuring their ancestors, the gods, legendary dragons and dinosaurs, and nature spirits of all kinds. The most talented mummers claim their ritual dances invite these spirits inside them, suffusing their bodies with starlight and lending them primal power uniquely tied to the luminaries their masks represent. This magic can be seen even by those without magical ability, as they can see glowing motes shaped like distant stars seeming to float under the skin of the mummer. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 26 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 24 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 21 [Iruxi Masked Mummer](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3661) **Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 205 **Perception** +18 **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Iruxi](/Languages.aspx?ID=32), [Thalassic](/Languages.aspx?ID=113) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +17, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +17, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +19, [Iruxi Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +20, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +18, [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=45) +20, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47) +16, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +18 **Str** +2 **Dex** +4 **Con** +0 **Int** +1 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +4 **Deep Breath** A masked mummer can [hold their breath](/Rules.aspx?ID=2436) for 20 minutes. **Items** [ceremonial skull mask](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1397), _+1 striking [handwraps of mighty blows](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3086)_, mummer's costume, [lesser maestro instrument](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3026) (hand drum) --- **AC** 27 **Fort** +15 **Ref** +19 **Will** +18 **HP** 155 --- **Speed** 25 feet, swim 20 feet **Melee** tail +20 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Sweep](/Traits.aspx?ID=194)), **Damage** 2d6+8 bludgeoning **Melee** claws +20 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [versatile P](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 2d4+8 slashing **Ranged** spectral roar +19 ([Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [range 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [Sonic](/Traits.aspx?ID=147)), **Damage** 3d10 sonic **Don Mask** ([Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) **Frequency** once per 10 minutes; **Effect** The mummer dons a ceremonial skull mask, calling an ancestral spirit to come to their aid. The spirit answers with a spell the mummer can cast as a primal innate spell (5th rank, DC 27) as part of the Don Mask activity. The mummer also gains a primal boon that lasts for 1 minute. After the minute is over or the mask is removed, the spell and boon end if either is still active, and the mummer is [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=73). The most common legendary spirits the masks can invoke are:
  • **Fiery Akkarok** (tyrannosaurus mask); **Spell** [_blazing bolt_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1450) (3-action version); **Boon** The mummer's melee Strikes deal an additional 2d6 fire damage.
  • **Hazi Zephyr-Borne** (griffon or iruxi mask); **Spell** [_wall of wind_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1753); **Boon** The mummer gains a fly Speed of 20 feet.
  • **King of Storms** (roc or horned dragon mask); Spell [_howling blizzard_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1559); **Boon** The mummer gains the [Reactive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=48) reaction that can be used only with their tail.
  • **Nessek, the Wave Dancer** (mosasaur mask); **Spell** [_slither_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1676); **Boon** The mummer's claw Strikes deal an additional 2d4 [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29).
  • **Zalok, Who was Called to Black Harbor** (naga or spinosaurus mask); **Spell** [_hydraulic torrent_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1562); **Boon** The mummer gains a +10-foot status bonus to their land Speed and swim Speed.
**Starry Presence** ([Aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [Illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92), [Light](/Traits.aspx?ID=100), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) 30 feet. With a quick dance, the iruxi masked mummer surrounds themself with a starlight image resembling a figure from legend. The image lasts until the start of the mummer's next turn. An enemy that enters or starts its turn in the aura must succeed at a DC 25 Will save or become [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=65) until the start of its next turn.
name: Iruxi Masked Mummer

<title level="1" pfs="">[Orc Agriculturalist](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3662)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

In the severe lands orcs occupy, there are no lush fields blooming with crops. An orc farmer must be tough and just as adept at foraging as planting and harvesting.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 15

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 13

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 10
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 1">[Orc Agriculturalist](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3662)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=628" />
<trait label="Orc" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=666" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 206

**Perception** +7; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Orcish](/Languages.aspx?ID=9)

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +5, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=37) +3, [Farming Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +13, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +11, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +7

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +2

**Dex** +1

**Con** +2

**Int** +0

**Wis** +4

**Cha** +0
</row>

**Farming Specialist** For encounters involving farming, harvesting, or identifying plants, the agriculturalist is a 5th-level challenge.

**Items**
[Blowgun](/Weapons.aspx?ID=66) (20 darts), pitchfork (as [longspear](/Weapons.aspx?ID=361)), poisonous herb (5), [Sickle](/Weapons.aspx?ID=9)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 14 

**Fort** +9 

**Ref** +6 

**Will** +7 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 25

</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
pitchfork +7 ([Reach](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 1d8+2 piercing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
sickle +7 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196)),
**Damage** 1d4+2 slashing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fist +7 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)),
**Damage** 1d4+2 bludgeoning

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
blowgun +6 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [range increment 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 1](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)),
**Damage** 1 piercing

**Herbal Poison** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104), [Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) The agriculturalist quickly turns some of their supplies of poisonous herbs into an herbal poison, then applies it to a melee weapon or piece of ammunition in their possession. The next successful attack with a weapon poisoned this way deals an additional 1d6 poison damage. The applied poison fades after its damage is applied to an attack or 1 minute passes, whichever happens first.

**Poison Detector** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The orc agriculturalist attempts a [Farming Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) or [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) check to determine whether an object is [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669) or has been poisoned. The DC is the poison's DC (if any), or the standard DC of the poison's level. On a critical success, they also learn the number and types of poison involved.

</column>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-454" />
name: Orc Agriculturalist

<title level="1" pfs="">[Orc Gamekeeper](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3663)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Gamekeepers live on the outskirts of the hold, usually remaining solitary and tending to animals they've captured. Every part of a trapped animal can be useful for making supplies or trading.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 19

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 14
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Orc_Gamekeeper.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 4">[Orc Gamekeeper](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3663)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=628" />
<trait label="Orc" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=666" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 206

**Perception** +13; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Orcish](/Languages.aspx?ID=9)

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +13, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) +9, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +13, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +12, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +11

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +3

**Dex** +4

**Con** +0

**Int** +0

**Wis** +3

**Cha** +1
</row>

**Insistent Command** When the gamekeeper rolls a success to [Command an Animal](/Actions.aspx?ID=2400), they get a critical success instead; if they roll a critical failure, they get a failure instead.

**Items**
[Bola](/Weapons.aspx?ID=92) (4), [hampering snare](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3374) (2), [Net](/Equipment.aspx?ID=681), [Whip](/Weapons.aspx?ID=48)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 20 

**Fort** +10 

**Ref** +12 

**Will** +9 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 65

</row>

**Play Chicken** <actions string="Reaction" /> **Trigger** An adjacent enemy misses the gamekeeper with a melee attack; **Effect** The gamekeeper attempts to capture the flailing assailant. They attempt an [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) check to [Grapple](/Actions.aspx?ID=2376) the attacker.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
whip +14 ([Disarm](/Traits.aspx?ID=175), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Reach](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196)),
**Damage** 1d4+9 slashing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fist +14 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)),
**Damage** 1d4+9 bludgeoning

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
bola +14 ([Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Ranged Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=251), [thrown 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)),
**Damage** 1d6+9 bludgeoning

**Animal Tandem** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The orc gamekeeper makes a Strike against a creature adjacent to one of the gamekeeper's animal allies. If it hits, the animal ally deals one die of damage to the target, using the highest damage die among its unarmed attacks.

</column>

<title level="1" pfs="">[Dromaar Lorekeeper](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3664)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Lorekeepers are meticulous keepers of the colorful and often misunderstood history of orcs and dromaar. They're jovial wanderers, telling their stories to anyone who will listen.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 20

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 18

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 15
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<traits>
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Dromaar" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=516" />
<trait label="Human" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=627" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=628" />
<trait label="Orc" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=666" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 207

**Perception** +10; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Orcish](/Languages.aspx?ID=9)

**Skills**
[Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) +12, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44) +11, [Orc Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +15, [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=45) +12, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47) +13

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +1

**Dex** +3

**Con** +0

**Int** +2

**Wis** +2

**Cha** +3
</row>

**Spotlight Ready** When performing for crowds of 10 or more, the dromaar lorekeeper gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=45) checks.

**Items**
[Dagger](/Weapons.aspx?ID=3), [lute](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2737)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 21 

**Fort** +9 

**Ref** +12 

**Will** +13 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 70

</row>

**Final Tale** ([auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=541), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647), [occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=662)) When the lorekeeper dies, they utter a brief but poignant final story that shakes those nearby to their core. Each creature in a 10-foot emanation must succeed at a DC 20 Will save or be [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85) for 1 round.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
dagger +14 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)),
**Damage** 1d4+4 piercing plus 1d10 sonic

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fist +14 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)),
**Damage** 1d4+4 piercing plus 1d10 sonic

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
dagger +14 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [thrown 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)),
**Damage** 1d4+4 piercing plus 1d10 sonic

**Occult Spontaneous Spells** DC 22, attack +14
- **Cantrips (3rd)**
[Daze](/Spells.aspx?ID=61), [Figment](/Spells.aspx?ID=1528), [Message](/Spells.aspx?ID=190), [Summon Instrument](/Spells.aspx?ID=721), [Telekinetic Projectile](/Spells.aspx?ID=334)
- **1st**
[Bless](/Spells.aspx?ID=25), [Phantasmal Minion](/Spells.aspx?ID=1631), [Ventriloquism](/Spells.aspx?ID=356) (3 slots)
- **2nd**
[Laughing Fit](/Spells.aspx?ID=1583), [Noise Blast](/Spells.aspx?ID=1616), [Translate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1723) (3 slots)
- **3rd**
[Enthrall](/Spells.aspx?ID=104), [Heroism](/Spells.aspx?ID=149) (2 slots)

**a**   

</column>

Orc warriors search for more effective weapons and tactics—most physical, but some magical. As they fought back against the undead on their borders, they formed bands of skullcrushers to crush hordes of skeletons. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 23 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 21 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 18 [Orc Skullcrushers](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3665) **Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 207 **Perception** +15; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Orcish](/Languages.aspx?ID=9) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +17, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +15, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +16, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +13 **Str** +4 **Dex** +3 **Con** +4 **Int** +0 **Wis** +2 **Cha** +0 --- **AC** 24 **Fort** +17 **Ref** +16 **Will** +13 **HP** 120 (4 segments) **Resistances** void 8 **Weaknesses** area damage 8, [splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=699) damage 8 **[Troop Defenses](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=44)** --- **Speed** 25 feet; [troop movement](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=85) **Chant of Dominance** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517), [Spirit](/Traits.aspx?ID=149)) **Effect** Orc war drummers lead the other skullcrushers in a holy chant extolling their superiority in battle. Any creature damaged by the skullcrushers this turn also takes 1d6 [persistent spirit damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29). **Crush Skulls** **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The skullcrushers smash their mauls and clubs against each enemy in a 5-foot emanation, with a DC 22 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. The damage depends on the number of actions.
1d12 bludgeoning damage
1d12+8 bludgeoning damage
2d12+8 bludgeoning damage **Sacred Salvo** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509)) The skullcrushers fling a fusillade of sling bullets enchanted with life energy intended to destroy undead. This barrage is a 10-foot burst within 50 feet that deals 3d6 bludgeoning damage plus 1d6 vitality damage to [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=722), with a DC 22 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. When the troop is reduced to 2 or fewer segments, this area decreases to a 5-foot burst.
name: Orc Skullcrushers

markdown:
While the sword and shield are reliable and proven in battle, the veteran master is the weapon. They have been hardened by decades of fighting, but they still manage to find peace within themselves to gain a physical advantage. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 27 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 25 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 22 [Orc Veteran Master](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3666) **Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 208 **Perception** +20; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Orcish](/Languages.aspx?ID=9) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +20, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +23, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) +15, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +20, [Warfare Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +18, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +20 **Str** +5 **Dex** +4 **Con** +3 **Int** +0 **Wis** +2 **Cha** +1 **Items** _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2829) [bo staff](/Weapons.aspx?ID=372)_, _+1 [breastplate](/Armor.aspx?ID=47)_, _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2829) [composite longbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=434)_ (20 arrows) --- **AC** 30 **Fort** +19 **Ref** +20 **Will** +18 **HP** 175 **Fly Through Battle** The veteran master gains an additional reaction each round that can be used only to make a Reactive Pursuit.
**Reactive Pursuit** **Trigger** An enemy within reach attempts to move away; **Effect** The veteran master Strides up to their Speed, following the enemy and keeping it in reach throughout its movement until it stops moving or the master has moved their full Speed.
**[Reactive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=48)** --- **Speed** 30 feet **Melee** _bo staff_ +24 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Parry](/Traits.aspx?ID=190), [Reach](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196)), **Damage** 2d8+13 bludgeoning **Melee** fist +24 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)), **Damage** 2d4+13 bludgeoning **Ranged** _composite longbow_ +23 ([deadly d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Propulsive](/Traits.aspx?ID=191), [range increment 100 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 0](/Traits.aspx?ID=254), [volley 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=201)), **Damage** 2d8+10 piercing **Staff Swipe** The veteran master extends their reach to smash multiple creatures with their bo. They attempt a bo staff Strike against each enemy in a 15-foot cone. This counts as two attacks toward their multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks. **Reshape the Battle** The veteran master attempts a bo staff Strike. If it hits a creature of the master's size or smaller, the master can automatically [Reposition](/Actions.aspx?ID=2379) it to any space within the bo staff's reach.
name: Orc Veteran Master

<title level="1" pfs="">[Tunnel Viper](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3667)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

There is no better way for a ysoki to distinguish themself than to defend the warren, with many proving themselves by venturing out and challenging monsters they come across. Those who return triumphant from such tests find themselves among the ranks of ysoki warriors, able to wear their accomplishments as a badge of pride. They often venture out again once established and experienced to attain more notoriety as warriors.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**

ranseur +8 ([Disarm](/Traits.aspx?ID=175), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 1d10+3 piercing

**Damage** 1d10 piercing

**Running Reload** <actions string="Single Action" />  The tunnel viper Strides, Steps, or [Sneaks](/Actions.aspx?ID=2405), then Interacts to reload.

**Swarming**   A tunnel viper can end their movement in the same square as an ally that also has this ability. Only two such creatures can share the same space.

**Tunnel Fighter**   The tunnel viper deals an additional 1d6 precision damage to creatures that are [Squeeze](/Actions.aspx?ID=2372) or in [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) due to narrow spaces.

**Tunnel Travel**   Narrow spaces aren't [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) for the tunnel viper, and the viper can [Squeeze](/Actions.aspx?ID=2372) at 5 feet per round (or 10 feet on a critical success).

</column>

<title level="1" pfs="">[Swarm Voice](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3668)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

The swarm voice is the secular leader of a ysoki warren or one family in a larger warren. If there is a dispute, the swarm voice resolves it. If there is a negotiation, they orchestrate it. If war is about to break out, they declare it. The swarm voice is the welcoming hand and the iron fist of their colony.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 18

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 16

Each ratfolk from the same warren in a 15-foot emanation can spend a reaction to Step, Stride, or [Take Cover](/Actions.aspx?ID=2307).

**Chittering Terror** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) The swarm voice chitters, creating a terrifying din, and encourages their allies to join in. Each enemy within 30 feet must succeed at a DC 19 Will save or be [frightened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=76) (or frightened 2 on a critical failure). An enemy takes a –2 circumstance penalty to its save if it's adjacent to one or more [ratfolk](/Traits.aspx?ID=769) allied with the swarm voice. Regardless of the result of a creature's save, it's then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

**Swarming**   A ysoki can end their movement in the same square as an ally that also has this ability. Only two such creatures can share the same space.

<title level="1" pfs="">[Bone Mother](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3669)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

The bone mother—a warren's oracle—cuts an imposing figure. Bone mothers can be any gender despite the name, wearing the skull of a giant rat and covering their clothing in dangling bones. When a member of the warren dies, they gift a bone (usually a finger bone) to the oracle, who exists as both a physical repository of those who came before and a living history of their warren.

<title level="1" pfs="">[Gambling Companion](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3670)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

A reputation for protecting against bad luck, combined with skill and knowledge, establish these tengu as ideal gambling companions. Their role includes providing local knowledge of establishments as well as the various games available. Refined skills of observation and an ability to read other players increases the value of their services. The example provided is for a companion who frequents the finer establishments. For some areas, a patron would look for a companion with greater fighting skills to also fill the role of bodyguard.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 18

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 16

<title level="1" pfs="">[Jinx Eater](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3671)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Whether kidnapped, conscripted, or having entered voluntary service, a tengu in the role of jinx eater on a ship's crew is tasked with keeping the crew free of misfortune. Those with the necessary skill to do so often achieve a respected and privileged position on board.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 19

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 14
</column>

</column>

</column>

</row>

<trait label="Tengu" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=776" />
</traits>

**Perception** +12; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Tengu](/Languages.aspx?ID=47); plus two others

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +13, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +9, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +12, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +12, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44) +10, [Sailing Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +12

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +2

**Dex** +4

**Con** +1

**Int** +1

**Wis** +1

**Cha** +2
</row>

bottle, [Leather Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=4), [Tengu Gale Blade](/Weapons.aspx?ID=479)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 21 

**Fort** +8 

**Ref** +14 

**Will** +11 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 65

</row>

**Eat Fortune** <actions string="Reaction" /> ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=579)) **Frequency** once per day; **Trigger** A creature within 60 feet uses a [fortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=612) or [misfortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=654) effect; **Effect** The tengu negates the attempt to manipulate fate and fortune. Eat Fortune gains the opposing trait, and the triggering effect is [disrupted](/Rules.aspx?ID=2342).

</column>

---

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />

beak +13 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179)),
**Damage** 1d6+4 piercing

**Jinxed Call** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) The jinx eater gives an eerie croak. Each non-[tengu](/Traits.aspx?ID=776) in a 30-foot emanation must succeed at a DC 21 Will save or be [clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=61) for 1 round (or 1 minute on a critical failure). Regardless of the results, each creature is then temporarily immune to Jinxed Call for 1 minute.

**Sneak Attack**   The jinx eater deals 1d6 extra precision damage to [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) creatures.

</column>

On a hit, the target is [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) and takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds. On a critical hit, the creature is [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=90) instead. The DC to [Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=2296) the net is 16. A creature adjacent to the target can Interact with the net to remove it.

**Forest Passage**   The scout ignores [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) caused by plants, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth.

Camoufleurs, masters of natural camouflage, not only disguise their village scouts and warriors before they embark, but also create and maintain the village-wide concealment needed to keep their community hidden and safe. Just as others rely on engineers to build walls, tripkees rely on camoufleurs to protect their homes. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 16 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 14 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 11 [Tripkee Camoufleur](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3674) **Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 214 **Perception** +10; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Tripkee](/Languages.aspx?ID=178) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +8, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +5, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=37) +7, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +7, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +11, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +7 **Str** +1 **Dex** +4 **Con** +1 **Int** +1 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +0 **Camouflage Specialist** For encounters involving avoiding detection or hiding an object or creature, the camoufleur is a 5th-level challenge.
**Natural Disguise** The camoufleur can use their [disguise kit](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2720) to disguise a creature or object as natural flora. A creature gains a +2 item bonus to [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) checks while in a natural environment until its next daily preparations or until its disguise is ruined, whichever comes first. An object in a natural environment can be found only by actively searching (using the [Search](/Actions.aspx?ID=2630) activity while exploring or the [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=2301) action in an encounter) and uses the camoufleur's Stealth DC. **Items** [darts](/Weapons.aspx?ID=68) (5), [Disguise Kit](/Equipment.aspx?ID=19), [Hand Adze](/Weapons.aspx?ID=144), [Leather Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=4) --- **AC** 18 **Fort** +5 **Ref** +11 **Will** +8 **HP** 30 --- **Speed** 25 feet, climb 20 feet; forest passage **Melee** hand adze +10 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Sweep](/Traits.aspx?ID=194)), **Damage** 1d4+3 slashing **Melee** fist +10 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188)), **Damage** 1d4+3 bludgeoning **Ranged** dart +10 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [thrown 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)), **Damage** 1d4+3 piercing **Ranged** hand adze +10 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Sweep](/Traits.aspx?ID=194), [thrown 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)), **Damage** 1d4+3 slashing **Forest Passage** The tripkee ignores [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) caused by plants, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth.
name: Tripkee Camoufleur

<title level="1" pfs="">[Tripkee Fiend Keeper](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3675)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Tripkees have a technique for dealing with unholy threats that has been passed down through the generations. A fiend keeper can absorb unholy spirits into their body before those entities can cause trouble for their kin. Though they can tap into this power when necessary, tripkee fiend keepers try to cleanse themselves of its evil influence by undertaking good deeds.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 23

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 21

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 18
</column>

</column>

<trait label="Tripkee" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=793" />

**Fort** +12

**Will** +18

**HP** 125

</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet, climb 20 feet; forest passage

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
_cruuk_ +14 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Shove](/Traits.aspx?ID=193)),
**Damage** 1d6+5 bludgeoning

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fist +16 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188)),
**Damage** 1d4+5 bludgeoning

<actions string="Single Action" />
cruuk +17 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [thrown 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)),
**Damage** 1d6+5 bludgeoning

**Bounce Cruuk** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The tripkee fiend keeper makes a ranged Strike with their cruuk against a target within 30 feet. Once the Strike is complete, the cruuk ricochets back into the tripkee fiend keeper's hand. If their hands are full when the cruuk returns, it falls to the ground in their space.

**Harness Wickedness** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)) **Requirements** The tripkee fiend keeper isn't [stupefied](/Conditions.aspx?ID=94); **Effect** The tripkee fiend keeper allows a portion of the fiendish power they have absorbed to flow through their body. For the next minute, the tripkee fiend keeper's Strikes deal an additional die of damage and gain the [unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521) trait. The tripkee fiend keeper also gains 10 temporary Hit Points, a +5- foot status bonus to Speed for the duration, and weakness 5 to [holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517). At the end of the duration, the tripkee fiend keeper is stupefied 1 for 1 hour.

**Hunter of Virtue**   Whenever the tripkee fiend keeper critically hits an [unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521) creature, they reduce the value of their stupefied condition by 1.

**Forest Passage**   The tripkee ignores [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) caused by plants, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth.

</column>

A veteran war horse has not only been extensively trained but has also experienced battle several times. They have grown used to the chaos of war and fearlessly strides forward, striking fear into their enemies. A veteran war horse could accompany a [champion](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3446), [champion of Rovagug](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3613), [captain of the guard](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3560), [deific champion](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3450), [equestrian constable](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3557), or [orc gamekeeper](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3663). **[Recall Knowledge - Animal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 20 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 18 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 15 [Veteran War Horse](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3677) **Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 218 **Perception** +10; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69), [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=74) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 30 feet **Languages** **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +12, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +15, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +12 **Str** +6 **Dex** +3 **Con** +4 **Int** -4 **Wis** +2 **Cha** -2 --- **AC** 21 **Fort** +12 **Ref** +11 **Will** +10 **HP** 90 **[Buck](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=54)** DC 21
 --- **Speed** 40 feet **Melee** hoof +13, **Damage** 2d6+6 bludgeoning **Gallop** The veteran war horse Strides twice. It has a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed during these Strides. **Into the Fray** The veteran war horse Strides then [Demoralizes](/Actions.aspx?ID=2395) an adjacent Medium or smaller creature. When it does, Demoralize loses the [auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=541) trait and gains the [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=727) trait, and it doesn't take a penalty for the veteran war horse not speaking a language.
name: Veteran War Horse

The experienced hound can then Step away from the target; if the target is [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=77) by the hound, it is moved into the hound's previous square and remains grabbed.

**Humane Bite**   The experienced hound doesn't take a penalty to make a [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=661) attack with its jaws.

**Pack Attack**   The hound's Strikes deal 2d6 extra damage to creatures within the reach of at least two of the hound's allies.

</column>
name: Experienced Hound

Kobold earth divers study the geology of the areas near their communities. The mystical influence of their community's patron or years of extensive training at digging or earth magic allow them to swiftly burrow through the ground and to feel movements in the ground beneath their feet. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 19 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 14 [Kobold Earth Diver](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3680) **Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 199 **Perception** +13; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=82) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=371)) 10 feet **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Petran](/Languages.aspx?ID=109), [Sakvroth](/Languages.aspx?ID=118) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +10, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +12, [Geology Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +11, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +10, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +10, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +8 **Str** +4 **Dex** +3 **Con** +0 **Int** +1 **Wis** +2 **Cha** +0 **Items** [Crossbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=67) (20 bolts), [Map](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3585) (depicting landmarks above and below ground in 1 square mile), [Leather Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=4), [Pick](/Weapons.aspx?ID=34) --- **AC** 20 **Fort** +8 **Ref** +14 **Will** +11 **HP** 60 --- **Speed** 25 feet, burrow 10 feet **Melee** pick +14 ([fatal d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=178)), **Damage** 1d6+10 piercing **Melee** claw +14 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)), **Damage** 1d4+10 slashing **Ranged** crossbow +13 ([range increment 120 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 1](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)), **Damage** 1d8+6 piercing **Pick Smash** The kobold earth diver smashes their pick into the ground, sending debris exploding in a 5-foot emanation. All creatures and unattended objects in range take 3d6 bludgeoning damage with a DC 20 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. A creature that is [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=90) by an earth diver's Sinkhole takes an additional 1d6 bludgeoning damage. **Sinkhole** **Requirements** The earth diver is burrowed beneath a Medium or smaller creature aboveground; **Effect** The earth diver creates a small sinkhole under the creature, who must attempt a DC 20 Reflex save. Regardless of the result, the target's space becomes [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453).
**Failure** The creature falls into the sinkhole and is [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=90) until it [Escapes](/Actions.aspx?ID=2296) (DC 18).
**Critical Failure** As failure, and the creature takes 2d8 bludgeoning damage.
name: Kobold Earth Diver

_Nethys Note: This is a part of the April Fool's content from Paizo's blogs._ Dust bunnies in particular are prone to swarming. This can occur when a large number are left alone for a long period of time and are then disturbed by adventurers or a returning wizard. Other times, a singular dust bunny familiar grows in such numbers (and they will rapidly reproduce!) that a wizard cannot hope to keep them all placated with food and attention. In this situation, they will unionize in rebellion against their master. It is paramount that you do not allow a dust bunny to multiply, for once a swarm has formed, they are nigh impossible to get rid of. While relatively easy to disperse and unlikely to kill anyone, they will re-form within the week unless the area is immaculately cleaned. **[Recall Knowledge - Construct](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35), [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=37)): DC 20 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 18 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 15 [Dust Bunny Swarm](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3681) **Source** [Foolish Housekeeping and Other Articles](/Sources.aspx?ID=239) **Perception** +7 **Languages** **Skills** [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35) +3, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +3, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +7 **Str** +0 **Dex** +2 **Con** +0 **Int** -4 **Wis** +0 **Cha** +2 --- **AC** 13 **Fort** +7 **Ref** +5 **Will** +3 **HP** 16 **Immunities** bleed, [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [doomed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=67), [drained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=68), [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=73), [grappled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=77), [healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=623), [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=661) attacks, [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), precision, [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=88), [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=90), [sickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91), [spirit](/Traits.aspx?ID=737), [swarm mind](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=78), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95), [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509), [void](/Traits.aspx?ID=510) **Resistances** physical 6 (except bludgeoning) **Weaknesses** area damage 4, [splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=699) damage 4 **Cloud of Allergens** **Trigger** The swarm rolls initiative; **Effect** The dust bunnies stir, kicking up a cloud in a 15-foot burst centered on the swarm that lasts for 1 minute. Creatures who enter or start their turn in this cloud must attempt a DC 16 Fortitude save or take a –1 circumstance penalty to skill checks that have the [concentration](/Traits.aspx?ID=561) trait and all Perception checks as their sensory organs become impaired.
**Dust to Dust** When a dust bunny swarm is destroyed, it re-forms after 2d4 days in the area in which it was destroyed unless the location has been significantly cleaned of all dust and debris. --- **Speed** 30 feet **Pummeling Dust** Each enemy in the swarm's space takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage with a DC 16 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. A creature that fails its save cannot use reactions for 1 round as they sneeze uncontrollably.
name: Dust Bunny Swarm

_Nethys Note: This is a part of the April Fool's content from Paizo's blogs._ The rt5rrmn is a catlike creature that loves to purr at those they encounter, convincing others to pamper them instead of fight. It would rather be friends than enemies, but if spooked it will viciously attack whoever is in its sights. If they aren't able to make friends, the rt5rrmn will quickly grow defensive, and leap to attack. **[Recall Knowledge - Animal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 34 **[Recall Knowledge - Fey](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 34 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 32 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 29 [Rt5rrmn](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3682) **Source** [Foolish Housekeeping and Other Articles](/Sources.aspx?ID=239) **Perception** +20; [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=74) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 60 feet **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1); (can't speak any language) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +20, [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +22, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +17 **Str** +5 **Dex** +3 **Con** +4 **Int** +1 **Wis** +1 **Cha** +6 --- **AC** 36 **Fort** +15 **Ref** +35 **Will** +22 **HP** 172 **But I'm Adorable** **Trigger** An enemy targets the rt5rrmn with a melee attack; **Effect** The rt5rrmn erkijs, the vibrating sound convincing the enemy to stop hurting it. The target must attempt a DC 26 Will save.
**Critical Success** The target is unaffected, ignoring the seduction of the erkij.
**Success** The target is [fascinated](/Conditions.aspx?ID=72) by the rt5rrmn's erkij until the end of the rt5rrmn's next turn.
**Failure** As success, and the target is [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=92) as it focuses on the rt5rrmn's erkij.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but the target is slowed 2.
**Extra Reverberation** If the rt5rrmn is targeted with an ability that restores Hit Points, it gains an additional use of But I'm Adorable that lasts until the end of its next turn. --- **Speed** 35 feet **Melee** b9000 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=602)), **Damage** 3d8+12 piercing plus [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=66) **Melee** g7ujik ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=526), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=602)), **Damage** 3d6+12 slashing, plus rt5rrmn yyumn **Pay Attention to Me** The rt5rrmn erkijs again at a creature that is affected by But I'm Adorable. The target must attempt a DC 26 Will save.
**Success** The target is unaffected.
**Failure** The target creature drops all of its held weapons.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but the target must also spend the first action of its next turn petting the rt5rrmn. **Yidsfh** The rt5rrmn Strides and then makes two g7ujik Strikes at a single target. Both count toward its multiple attack penalty, but the penalty increases only after both attacks are made. The rt5rrmn must be able to move at least half its Speed to yidsfh. **Rt5rrmn Yyumn** ([Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46)) **Saving Throw** Fortitude DC 24; **Maximum Duration** 1 week; **Stage 1** [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91) (1 hour); **Stage 2** sickened 1 and the creature can't reduce its sickened value below 1 (1 day); **Stage 3** sickened 2 and the creature can't reduce its sickened value below 1 (1 day)
name: Rt5rrmn

This volley is a 10-foot burst within 120 feet that deals 3d6 slashing damage (DC 18 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). When the crew is reduced to 8 or fewer squares, this area decreases to a 5-foot burst. **Tandem Chop** **Frequency** once per round; Effect The loggers engage in a coordinated axe attack against each enemy within 10 feet, with a DC 19 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. The damage depends on the number of actions expended.
1d10 slashing damage
3d6+7 slashing damage
3d6+10 slashing damage **Troop Movement** Whenever the loggers Stride, they first Form Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then move up to their Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square of the logging crew enters [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453), the extra movement cost applies to all the loggers.
name: Besieged Logging Crew

**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 19 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 14 [Hateful Loggers](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3688) **Source** [Pathfinder #201: Pactbreaker](/Sources.aspx?ID=241) pg. 41 **Perception** +11 **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +12, [Forest Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +12, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +10, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +10 **Str** +4 **Dex** +2 **Con** +4 **Int** +1 **Wis** +0 **Cha** +1 **Items** [Climbing Kit](/Equipment.aspx?ID=14), [Hatchet](/Weapons.aspx?ID=27), [Padded Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=3) --- **AC** 20 **Fort** +14 **Ref** +12 **Will** +8 **HP** 70 **Weaknesses** [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=661) 5 **Exhausted** Though their minds are suffused with hatred and rage, the loggers have not slept for several days and are ready to drop. They take a –2 status penalty to saving throws against effects with the [sleep](/Traits.aspx?ID=696) trait. --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** fist +14 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188)), **Damage** 1d4+8 bludgeoning **Melee** bite +14, **Damage** 1d6+8 piercing **Vitriol** ([Curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=38), [Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) The hateful bear vomits a stream of caustic black sludge at a single foe it can detect within 15 feet. The bear and the target each gain a +1 circumstance bonus on all attack rolls made against each other until the bear chooses a different target for its Vitriol. The target must attempt a DC 19 Will save, with the following effects. The bear cannot use Vitriol again for 1d4 rounds.
**Critical Success** No effect.
**Success** The target's mind is clouded by feelings of rage and hate, causing it to be [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) against the bear's next attack. It can't use actions with the [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561) trait unless they also have the [rage](/Traits.aspx?ID=680) trait.
**Failure** As success, but the target is off-guard until the end of the bear's next turn. While off-guard, it is unable to use actions with the concentrate trait unless they also have the rage trait.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but the target is off-guard until the bear chooses a different target for its Vitriol. **Sneak Attack** The logger deals 1d6 extra precision damage to creatures who are [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58)
name: Hateful Loggers

**[Recall Knowledge - Fey](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 34 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 32 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 29 [Lloyd The Leaper](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3689) **Source** [Pathfinder #201: Pactbreaker](/Sources.aspx?ID=241) pg. 50 **Perception** +17; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Fey](/Languages.aspx?ID=119) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +16, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +18, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +18, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +15, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +19, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=50) +16 **Str** +4 **Dex** +6 **Con** +3 **Int** +2 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +4 **Items** _Sally Sharp-tongue_ (_+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2829) [wounding](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2854) [war razor](/Weapons.aspx?ID=525)_), _[unmemorable mantle](/Equipment.aspx?ID=513)_ --- **AC** 26 **Fort** +13 **Ref** +20 **Will** +15 **HP** 135 **Ghastly Visage** ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561), [curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=566), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=590), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=598), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676), [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=727)) Lloyd the Leaper locks eyes with a creature he can see within 30 feet. The target must immediately attempt a DC 23 Will save or become [frightened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=76) (frightened 2 on a critical failure), and it can't reduce its frightened condition below 1 for 24 hours or until this curse is removed. After attempting its save, the creature is temporarily immune to this ability for 24 hours.
**[Reactive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=48)** --- **Speed** 40 feet **Melee** _Sally Sharp-tongue_ +18 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Backstabber](/Traits.aspx?ID=172), [deadly d8](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 3d4+7 slashing plus 1d6 [bleed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) **Primal Innate Spells** DC 26 - **1st** [Gentle Landing](/Spells.aspx?ID=1542) (at will) - **2nd** [Calm](/Spells.aspx?ID=1458) - **5th** [Magic Passage](/Spells.aspx?ID=1591) - **Constant (2nd)** [Vanishing Tracks](/Spells.aspx?ID=1737) **Haze of Dreams** ([Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [Sleep](/Traits.aspx?ID=145)) Lloyd exhales a cloud of clammy gray fog. Each creature in the area must attempt a DC 23 Fortitude save.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune for 24 hours.
**Success** The creature is [stupefied 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=94) for 1 round.
**Failure** The creature falls [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95). It wakes up automatically if it's still unconscious after 1 minute.
**Critical Failure** The creature falls unconscious. It wakes up automatically if it's still unconscious after 1 hour. **[Change Shape](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=55)** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) Lloyd takes on the appearance of a Small or Medium [humanoid](/Traits.aspx?ID=628) dressed in exquisite finery. This doesn't change his Speed or his attack and damage modifiers with his Strikes. When in this form, Lloyd gains a Diplomacy modifier equal to his Intimidation modifier. **Vanishing Leap** ([Illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) **Trigger** Lloyd uses Vault; **Effect** Lloyd becomes [invisible](/Conditions.aspx?ID=83) for 1 round. **Vault** ([Move](/Traits.aspx?ID=114)) Lloyd jumps up to 20 feet in any direction, including vertically. This movement doesn't trigger reactions based on movement.
name: Lloyd The Leaper

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Young arboreals often appear lanky and uncoordinated. Their awkwardness belies their burgeoning strength and decades of natural studies.

**Axe Vulnerability** An arboreal sapling takes 5 additional damage from [axes](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=1).

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 20 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fist +11,
**Damage** 1d10+4 bludgeoning

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
branch +10 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 1d8+4 piercing

**Timber!** <actions string="Reaction" />  **Trigger** An arboreal sapling that is not [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=88) either becomes prone or is reduced to 0 HP; **Effect** The arboreal sapling topples over, dealing 2d6 bludgeoning damage to itself and to creatures in a 10-foot line (DC 16 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex). Creatures that critically fail the saving throw are also knocked prone.

**Shaky Footing**   When an arboreal sapling critically fails an attack roll or Reflex saving throw, it becomes [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=88) unless it succeeds at a DC 11 flat check.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Always Growing</title>

An arboreal sapling gradually grows into a more powerful form, such as an arboreal warden, filling whatever niche suits its interests and environment. However, even centuries later, an arboreal can slowly reshape itself to fill a new role, such as a warden transforming into an arboreal regent after their predecessor's retirement.
</aside>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-364" />
name: Arboreal Sapling

markdown:
Shepherds develop an eccentric fascination with local fauna. These shepherds eagerly bear fruit to feed their friends, provide roosts for bats, and invite beasts to gnaw nesting niches directly into their trunks. **[Recall Knowledge - Plant](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 20 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 18 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 15 [Arboreal Shepherd](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3691) **Source** [Pathfinder #201: Pactbreaker](/Sources.aspx?ID=241) pg. 82 **Perception** +15; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69) **Languages** [Arboreal](/Languages.aspx?ID=26), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Fey](/Languages.aspx?ID=119); [_speak with animals_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1680) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +11, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) +12, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +14, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +8 **Str** +4 **Dex** +1 **Con** +3 **Int** +2 **Wis** +5 **Cha** +3 --- **AC** 22 **Fort** +12 **Ref** +10 **Will** +14 **HP** 80 **Resistances** bludgeoning 5, piercing 5 **Weaknesses** axe vulnerability, fire 5 **Axe Vulnerability** An arboreal shepherd takes 5 additional damage from [axes](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=1).
**Defend the Friends** **Trigger** An animal within the arboreal shepherd's reach takes area damage or splash damage from an effect; **Effect** The arboreal shepherd partly shields the creature. Reduce the damage dealt to the animal by an amount equal to 1d10 + the animal's weakness to the effect, if any. The arboreal shepherd takes an equal amount of damage. --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** branch +15 ([reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d8+6 bludgeoning **Primal Innate Spells** DC 22 - **2nd** [Animal Messenger](/Spells.aspx?ID=11) - **3rd** [Animal Allies](/Spells.aspx?ID=863) (×2) - **Constant (2nd)** [Speak with Animals](/Spells.aspx?ID=293) **Exalt the Little Ones** ([Auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [Linguistic](/Traits.aspx?ID=101), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) The arboreal shepherd encourages its friends to overcome titanic odds. For 1 round, allies with the [animal](/Traits.aspx?ID=531) trait in a 50-foot radius gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and saving throws. If the animals have the [swarm](/Domains.aspx?ID=120) trait, the saving throw DCs to resist their damaging actions gain a +1 status bonus. This bonus increases to +2 for allies whose level is 2 or lower. **Healing Haven** ([Healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=89), [Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) **Frequency** Once per hour; **Effect** The arboreal shepherd scoops up a willing Medium or smaller [animal](/Traits.aspx?ID=531) (or animal with the [swarm](/Domains.aspx?ID=120) trait) within its reach, sequestering the animal into a recess in the arboreal's trunk. While sequestered, the animal cannot act, gains [greater cover](/Rules.aspx?ID=459), and gains [fast healing 5](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=62). At the beginning of its turn after regaining Hit Points, the animal can choose to exit by reappearing in any space adjacent to the arboreal as a free action.
Occult Nutrients While drawing water, nutrients, and trace primal energy from the soil, an arboreal sometimes absorbs psychic impressions that shape its growth. Taking root in haunted landscapes or abandoned fairgrounds can result in truly sinister or frolicsome arboreals.
name: Arboreal Shepherd

Some coniferous arboreals develop viscous sap that they use to trap trespassers. Dozens of half-hardened rivulets drip from their bark, ready to ensnare weapons or even capture airborne particles. Sapstrikers act as bounty hunters who delight in tracking down and punishing loggers. **[Recall Knowledge - Plant](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 22 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 20 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17 [Arboreal Sapstriker](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3692) **Source** [Pathfinder #201: Pactbreaker](/Sources.aspx?ID=241) pg. 83 **Perception** +17; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69), [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=74) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 60 feet **Languages** [Arboreal](/Languages.aspx?ID=26), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Fey](/Languages.aspx?ID=119) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +13, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +11, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +11, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +15 **Str** +4 **Dex** +3 **Con** +5 **Int** +2 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +1 --- **AC** 23 **Fort** +17 **Ref** +11 **Will** +16 **HP** 115 **Resistances** bludgeoning 5, piercing 5 **Weaknesses** axe vulnerability Axe Vulnerability An arboreal sapstriker takes 5 additional damage from [axes](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=1).
**Primal Sink** **Trigger** An arboreal sapstriker succeeds or critically succeeds at a saving throw against a [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676) effect; **Effect** The sapstriker gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, saving throws, skill checks, and sap saving throw DC for 1d4 rounds. --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** branch +17, **Damage** 2d8+6 bludgeoning plus sap **Melee** sap +17 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [range increment 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 2d6+6 bludgeoning plus sap **Amber Tomb** **Trigger** A foe critically succeeds at a Strike against the arboreal sapstriker with a weapon that deals piercing or slashing damage, or a foe deals damage to an arboreal sapstriker with an axe; **Effect** The arboreal sapstriker attempts to [Disarm](/Actions.aspx?ID=2383) the triggering foe's weapon, using its Fortitude modifier in place of its [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) modifier. If it critically succeeds, the weapon is lodged into the sapstriker rather than falling to the ground. A creature can retrieve a lodged weapon by Disarming the sapstriker as if it were wielding the weapon. **Sap** A creature that takes damage from an arboreal sapstriker's branch or sap Strike must succeed at a DC 23 Reflex save or take 1d8 [persistent acid damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29). While taking the persistent damage, a creature takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speeds.
name: Arboreal Sapstriker

<title level="1" pfs="">[Azhana](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3693)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Resembling pale [halflings](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=5), azhanas are gregarious fey who tend the wilderness as if it were a giant garden. Their outgoing charm isn't just for their own entertainment; by engaging with flora and fauna alike, they coax local organisms to interact with each other, whether that's teaching animals how to forage together or introducing vines to new surfaces they can climb. This extends even to travelers and foresters. After all, a lumberjack offered salutations is less likely to scuffle with wildlife and knows someone's watching to ensure they don't overharvest a forest's bounty.

 Azhanas perform some of this gardening themselves. They carry hefty shears, clipping back invasive species and trimming branches to afford new sprouts a taste of sunlight. Likewise, they occasionally visit rural settlements, offering to teach wilderness skills that help civilization and nature coexist peacefully. Those who respond kindly earn an azhana's generosity. Those who threaten nature or fey instead earn the azhana's ire, usually involving magical misfortunes as small animals steal food, tools melt into useless shapes, and roots suddenly shift to send a trespasser tumbling down a ravine.

 Azhanas sometimes gather into small groups called sisterhoods, even if they include rare, non-female azhanas. These groups provide camaraderie and aid in resolving difficult obstacles. Less often, they form organically when an azhana adopts and mentors newborn azhanas. These creatures are never children; instead, they emerge fully formed from mature trees, accompanied by nearby trees thrumming softly in a celebratory chorus. Though any mature tree might suffice, most often an azhana's parent tree stands in some place of primal power or divine significance, such as where a nature deity performed a miracle.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

This ability functions like [_speak with stones_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1682). Flowing water can generally speak about events happening upstream (even distantly upstream), but not events happening downstream.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Arboreal Friends</title>

Azhanas are friends and tenders to the massive [arboreals](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=364), and are found in the same locations—wooded stands of trees in places of primal power. These two beings don't necessarily live among each other continually, but many azhanas count at least a couple of arboreals among their friend group and visit the living trees to share stories, groom them, or engage in friendly games.
</aside>

According to legend, the forest hermit Vernon Vestha was once little more than a simple beekeeper, tending to his hives somewhere among the forests and townships of northeastern Andoran. Precisely how he started down the sinister path that made him what he is today remains unknown, but it is generally understood that Vernon came to a strange revelation one day: he saw in his bees the ability to divine the future beyond that of any mortal magic and became convinced that if only he could teach himself to hear the messages in their buzzing and interpret the patterns in their swarms, that power could be his as well. His curiosity became an obsession, and obsession quickly spiraled into madness, culminating in the fateful day that he sacrificed his humanity in some inscrutable honeyed rite to become fully one with his beloved bees. To this day, they say, the Bee-Man still haunts the woods outside Bellis, waiting for someone to call him by speaking his name aloud. He often appears to those who seek his aid, although he seldom if ever grants it without exacting some terrible price in return. **[Recall Knowledge - Aberration](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44)): DC 36 **[Recall Knowledge - Animal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 36 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 34 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 31 [The Bee-Man Of Bellis](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3694) **Source** [Pathfinder #201: Pactbreaker](/Sources.aspx?ID=241) pg. 85 **Perception** +21 **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Wildsong](/Languages.aspx?ID=116); [_speak with animals_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1680) (insects only) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +23, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +20, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +20, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +12 **Str** +3 **Dex** +7 **Con** +6 **Int** +4 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +6 **Apian Emissaries** The Bee-Man can use bees to duplicate the effects of [_vigilant eye_](/Spells.aspx?ID=536) or [_message_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1598) at will, with a maximum range of 13 miles. A successful DC 20 Perception check identifies the presence of the bees acting as the sensors for these spells, but a DC 24 (expert) [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) check is required to realize they are behaving under outside influence.
**Taboo Name** Whenever the Bee-Man's full name (Vernon Vestha) is spoken aloud by a creature within 13 miles, he hears it and immediately knows the speaker's direction and distance from him. --- **AC** 27 **Fort** +15 **Ref** +21 **Will** +18 **HP** 155 **Immunities** [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), precision, [sleep](/Traits.aspx?ID=696), [stunned](/Conditions.aspx?ID=93), [swarm mind](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=78) **Resistances** bludgeoning 10, piercing 10, slashing 5 **Weaknesses** area damage 10, smoke susceptibility, [splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=699) damage 10 **Smoke Susceptibility** The Bee-Man is [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=92) for 1 round if he starts his turn in heavy smoke. --- **Speed** 25 feet, fly 50 feet **Melee** slam +19, **Damage** 2d6+9 piercing plus apitoxin **Primal Innate Spells** DC 25, attack +17 - **1st** [Illusory Disguise](/Spells.aspx?ID=159) (at will; male human only) - **2nd** [Augury](/Spells.aspx?ID=15) (at will) - **4th** [Honeyed Words](/Spells.aspx?ID=1558) (×3) - **5th** [Summon Animal](/Spells.aspx?ID=316) (×3; bee swarms only; treat as wasp swarms) - **Constant (2nd)** [Speak with Animals](/Spells.aspx?ID=293) (insects only) **Rituals** DC 25 - **3rd** [Geas](/Rituals.aspx?ID=12), [Reincarnate](/Rituals.aspx?ID=35) - **6th** [Commune](/Rituals.aspx?ID=6) **Apitoxin** ([Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Saving Throw** DC 25 Fortitude; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** 2d6 poison damage, [enfeebled 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=71) (1 round); **Stage 2** 3d6 poison damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round); **Stage 3** 3d6 poison damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round) **Evasive Swarm** **Trigger** The Bee-Man moves at least 5 feet; **Effect** The Bee-Man gains [concealment](/Conditions.aspx?ID=62) against ranged attacks until the start of his next turn or until he makes an [attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=540) action, whichever comes first
Swarm Dispersion If the Bee-Man is reduced to 0 Hit Points, his physical body dissolves into a cloud of live bees, which immediately scatter in all directions. Legends vary on the length of time that must pass before the Bee-Man can return, as well as on whether it's possible to permanently destroy him by killing every one of the bees before they can escape.
name: The Bee-Man Of Bellis

<title level="1" pfs="">[Chetamog](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3695)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

In the pockets of old growth that form the most primeval and untamed regions of the Verduran Forest, there are trees of truly staggering size. The upper reaches of these gargantuan trees are the natural domain of the chetamog: a horse-sized arboreal rodent with a bulk belied by the preternatural grace with which it leaps through the canopy. Their speed and agility, as well as a natural intelligence and aptitude for training, have made chetamogs highly sought-after animal companions for those whose travels take them into the depths of the forest, a demand that has been recognized by enterprising ranchers who breed and raise the creatures for precisely this purpose.

 A fully grown chetamog resembles an enormous squirrel, roughly 9 feet long and 5 feet high at the shoulder. Properly trained chetamogs are capable of serving as combat mounts. Few sights can match the glory of chetamog cavalry gliding effortlessly through thick ground cover and striking down a legion of earthbound foes before vanishing back into the treetops with ease.

**Forest Passage**   A chetamog ignores [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) and greater difficult terrain from non-magical foliage.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Natural Hoarders</title>

Chetamogs have a well-documented proclivity for stealing items and burying them in hidden caches throughout the forest, a majority of which are promptly forgotten and never recovered by the chetamog responsible. Although food items are generally preferred, chetamogs are also fascinated by brightly colored, shiny, and particularly fragrant items of any kind, and numerous tales persist of all manner of strange and valuable treasures being discovered in unexpected locations by fortunate explorers while traveling through chetamog territory.
</aside>
name: Chetamog

<title level="1" pfs="">[Cythnophorian](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3696)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

In its natural state, a fully grown cythnophorian resembles a wriggling mass of tendrils and fibrous growths approximately the size of a house cat. Although fully capable of locomotion in this form, a cythnophorian is rarely encountered outside a host, typically a humanoid or animal corpse, which the creature burrows into and animates from within like a grisly flesh puppet. Once so ensconced, the cythnophorian seeks out new victims to infect with its noxious spores, seizing control of their bodies for its own ends until they succumb to the deadly toxin and become incubators for new cythnophorians.

 A Medium-sized corpse is typically sufficient to sustain a cythnophorian for two weeks before it must seek out a fresh one. If unable to locate a new host in that time, the creature enters a dormant state, withdrawing into an unremarkable seed pod roughly the size of a child's fist, where it can lie in wait for years until a suitable victim presents itself.

**Weaknesses**
[fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 5

**Horrifying Display** <actions string="Free Action" /> ([emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=590), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=598), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647), [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=727)) **Trigger** The cythnophorian uses Fungal Possession; **Effect** All creatures in a 10- foot emanation must attempt a DC 26 Will save or become [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91), or sickened 2 on a critical failure. Affected creatures are [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) for as long as they're sickened. Once a creature attempts this save, it's temporarily immune for 1 minute.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 15 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
tendril +18,
**Damage** 2d10+10 piercing plus creeping death and Fungal Possession

**Creeping Death**  ([Contact](/Traits.aspx?ID=37), [Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Saving Throw** DC 22 Fortitude; **Onset** 1 round; **Stage 1** 2d6 poison damage and [stunned 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=93) (1 round); **Stage 2** 4d6 poison damage and [stupefied 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=94) (1 round); **Stage 3** 6d6 poison damage and [confused](/Conditions.aspx?ID=63) (1 round); **Stage 4** 6d6 poison damage and [controlled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=64) (1 round). A creature that dies while infected with creeping death immediately releases a burst of spores as if using the cythnophorian's Spore Cloud ability. If the corpse is not burned, it rises as the host of a new cythnophorian 12 hours later.

**Fungal Possession** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104), [Move](/Traits.aspx?ID=114), [Possession](/Traits.aspx?ID=129)) **Requirements** The cythnophorian's last action was a Strike that killed a target of size Medium or smaller; **Effect** The cythnophorian rips itself out of its current host and burrows its way into the corpse of its latest victim, regaining 3d4 Hit Points and taking control of the corpse as its new host. The cythnophorian enters the space of its new host, and its former host's corpse falls to the ground in its previous space. Moving to a new host doesn't change the cythnophorian's abilities or movement Speeds.

**Spore Cloud** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) The cythnophorian emits a cloud of toxic spores, exposing all creatures within a 15-foot emanation to creeping death. The cythnophorian can't use Spore Cloud again for 1d4 rounds.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Unknown Origins</title>

Opinions vary as to the exact nature of these creatures, with many scholars citing their similarities to the fungal parasites known as cythnigots as evidence of some qlippoth connection. Still others theorize that they began as a natural form of plant life that gradually became twisted and corrupted, deliberately or otherwise, by prolonged exposure to the foul energies of Cyth-V'sug, demon lord of fungus and rot.
</aside>
name: Cythnophorian
