**[Recall Knowledge - Construct](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35), [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=37)): DC 35 **[Recall Knowledge - Plant](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 35 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 33 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 30 [Primal Warden of Zibik](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3720) **Source** [Pathfinder #203 Shepherd of Decay](/Sources.aspx?ID=243) pg. 27 **Perception** +20; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Arboreal](/Languages.aspx?ID=26), [Muan](/Languages.aspx?ID=108); (can't speak any language) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +20 **Str** +7 **Dex** +2 **Con** +6 **Int** -1 **Wis** +2 **Cha** -5 --- **AC** 33 **Fort** +26 **Ref** +20 **Will** +18 **HP** 195 **Immunities** bleed, [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [doomed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=67), [drained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=68), [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=73), [healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=623), [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=661) attacks, [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), [sickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95) **Resistances** physical 10 (except [adamantine](/Equipment.aspx?ID=374)) **Aura of Decay** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676)) 30 feet. Plant objects and creatures in the emanation can't regain Hit Points unless the effect that attempts to heal them [counteracts](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) the aura, which has a counteract rank of 6 and a counteract DC of 32. A primal warden of Zibik can spend 1 action to reverse this aura; it becomes an aura of renewal with the [healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=623) trait, instead doubling the number of Hit Points of any healing effect received by a [plant](/Traits.aspx?ID=668) creature in the emanation.
**Rotten Burst** ([primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676)) **Trigger** The primal warden of Zibik takes physical damage; **Effect** A chunk of rotten bark bursts from the warden's body at its attacker. The warden makes a rotten bark Strike against an adjacent creature without triggering reactions.
**Primal Destruction** ([primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676), [void](/Traits.aspx?ID=510)) When the primal warden of Zibik is reduced to 0 Hit Points, it erupts with primal energy in a 30-foot emanation, dealing 12d6 void damage. Each creature in the area must attempt a DC 32 Will save with the following outcomes.
**Critical Success** The creature takes half damage.
**Success** The creature takes full damage.
**Failure** The creature takes full damage and becomes temporarily cursed by Zibik to be [enfeebled 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=71) and stupefied 1 for 1 day; this is a [curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=566) effect with a [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) DC of 32.
**Critical Failure** As failure, except the creature becomes enfeebled 2 and [stupefied 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=94). --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** flourishing fist +26 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [range increment 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 3d10+13 bludgeoning plus flourishing growth **Ranged** rotten bark +21 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [range increment 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 3d8+13 bludgeoning plus fractal rot **Primal Innate Spells** DC 32, attack +24 - **2nd** [Speak with Animals](/Spells.aspx?ID=293) (at will Cantrips), [Tangle Vine](/Spells.aspx?ID=1713) - **3rd** [Wall of Thorns](/Spells.aspx?ID=366) - **4th** [Speak with Plants](/Spells.aspx?ID=294) (at will), [Vital Beacon](/Spells.aspx?ID=359) - **5th** [Nature's Pathway](/Spells.aspx?ID=1613) (at will), [Toxic Cloud](/Spells.aspx?ID=1722) - **6th** [Field of Life](/Spells.aspx?ID=114), [Tangling Creepers](/Spells.aspx?ID=331) - **Constant (4th)** [Unfettered Movement](/Spells.aspx?ID=1732) **Flourishing Growth** ([Plant](/Traits.aspx?ID=125), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) The first time each round a creature takes damage from the warden's fists, the target must attempt a DC 32 Fortitude save. On a failure, tiny sprouts burst from the creature's flesh, and it becomes [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=92) for 1 round. **Fractal Rot** ([Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) The first time each round a creature takes damage from the warden's rotten bark, the target becomes [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91) as the flesh where it was struck momentarily twists and rots, causing considerable pain.
name: Primal Warden of Zibik

**[Recall Knowledge - Animal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 40 **[Recall Knowledge - Plant](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 40 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 38 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 35 [Old Thornbarker](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3722) **Source** [Pathfinder #203 Shepherd of Decay](/Sources.aspx?ID=243) pg. 42 **Perception** +25; [all-around vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=49), [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69), [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=82) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 60 feet **Languages** [Arboreal](/Languages.aspx?ID=26), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Fey](/Languages.aspx?ID=119), [Muan](/Languages.aspx?ID=108); [_speak with plants_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1681) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +23, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +22, [Cradle of Knot Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +28, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +22, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +25, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +19 **Str** +7 **Dex** +0 **Con** +5 **Int** +4 **Wis** +5 **Cha** +7 --- **AC** 33 **Fort** +23 **Ref** +18 **Will** +25 **HP** 230 **Resistances** bludgeoning 10, piercing 10 **Weaknesses** [axes](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=1) 10, [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 15 **Abeyance Rift** If Old Thornbarker dies unexpectedly before passing on their knowledge in a succession ritual, the amassed lore within his roots and boughs explodes out in a shock wave that deals 8d10 mental damage to creatures within 30 feet (DC 32 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Will save) before dissipating; those who fail also fall [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=88).
**Sycophantic Scamps** See below. --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** branch +25 ([reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d10+10 bludgeoning plus [Improved Knockdown](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=66) **Ranged** scamp +22 ([Splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=150), [thrown 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)), **Damage** 4d6+10 piercing plus 4 [persistent piercing damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) and 4 poison [splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=699) damage **Primal Innate Spells** DC 32, attack +24 - **2nd** [Entangling Flora](/Spells.aspx?ID=1515) - **3rd** [Earthbind](/Spells.aspx?ID=94) (at will) - **6th** [Tangling Creepers](/Spells.aspx?ID=331) - **Constant (4th)** [Speak with Plants](/Spells.aspx?ID=294) **Memory Maelstrom** ([Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) Old Thornbarker tries to overwhelm foes with a surge of information he has absorbed over his long life. This surge deals 5d6 mental damage to each enemy within 40 feet, who must attempt a DC 32 Will save.
**Critical Success** The creature maintains its composure, takes no damage, and is temporarily immune to Memory Maelstrom for 1 minute.
**Success** The creature is [stunned 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=93) and takes half damage.
**Failure** The creature takes full damage and is stunned 3.
**Critical Failure** The creature takes double damage, is [confused](/Conditions.aspx?ID=63) for 2d4 rounds, and is stunned 3. **Sycophantic Scamps** Dozens of [wood scamps](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2670) clamber on, nest in, and flit around Old Thornbarker, feeding him their observations and gossip. The arboreal can grab a nearby scamp as if drawing a weapon, using it as a [thrown](/Traits.aspx?ID=711) weapon. The unlucky scamp impacts with a clatter of spines and toxic pollen, after which the dazed elemental scampers away to regain its senses.
If Old Thornbarker takes 40 or more damage from an area effect, the scamps scatter and seek cover for 1d6 rounds, during which time Old Thornbarker can't make scamp Strikes and loses [all-around vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=49).
name: Old Thornbarker

**Corrupting Gaze** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The ghost stares at a creature it can see within 30 feet. The target takes 6d6 void damage with a DC 30 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Will save. A creature that fails its save is also [stupefied 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=94) for 1 minute.

**Phantom Blight**  ([Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Saving Throw** Fortitude DC 30; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** 3d6 mental damage and [clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=61) (1 round); **Stage 2** 4d6 mental damage and clumsy 1 (1 round); **Stage 3** 5d6 mental damage and clumsy 1, plus the creature takes a –2 penalty to saving throws against Ayrzul's Blight for 24 hours (1 round)

**Damage** 2d10+13 void

**Primal Innate Spells** DC 33, attack +25
- **Cantrips (7th)**
[Detect Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=66), [Tangle Vine](/Spells.aspx?ID=1713), [Timber](/Spells.aspx?ID=1412)
- **5th**
[Life-Draining Roots](/Spells.aspx?ID=1403), [Toxic Cloud](/Spells.aspx?ID=1722)

**Frightful Moan** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) The ghost laments its fate, forcing each living creature within 30 feet to attempt a DC 33 Will save. On a failure, a creature becomes [frightened 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=76) (or frightened 3 on a critical failure). On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to this ghost's Frightful Moan for 1 minute.

**Memory of Leaves** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Plant](/Traits.aspx?ID=125), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [Wood](/Traits.aspx?ID=508)) The ghost mourns its verdant birthplace, creating a swirling cloud of phantom leaves as a 20-foot emanation until the end of its next turn. All creatures within the emanation become [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=62), and all creatures outside the emanation become concealed to creatures within it. Creatures with the [plant](/Traits.aspx?ID=668) or [wood](/Traits.aspx?ID=508) traits ignore this concealment. The ghost can't use Memory of Leaves again for 1d4 rounds.

</column>

<title level="2" right="Creature 12">[Bonebleacher Bugbear](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3725)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=683" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Bugbear" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=744" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=628" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Pathfinder #203 Shepherd of Decay](/Sources.aspx?ID=243) pg. 54

**Perception** +25; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=74) (30 feet)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Fey](/Languages.aspx?ID=119), [Goblin](/Languages.aspx?ID=6)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +22, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +25, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=37) +21, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +25, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +27, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +22

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +6

**Dex** +4

**Con** +4

**Int** +2

**Wis** +2

**Cha** +0
</row>

**Items**
_+1 [resilient](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2786) [explorer's clothing](/Armor.aspx?ID=39)_, _+2 [flaming](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2838) [battle axe](/Weapons.aspx?ID=371)_, bogeyman's breath, [hatchets](/Weapons.aspx?ID=27) (3), [Reaper's Shadow](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3620) (2 doses), [plague mask](/Domains.aspx?ID=115)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 31 

**Fort** +25 

**Ref** +23 

**Will** +19 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 220

</row>

**Blighted Cloak** <actions string="Reaction" /> **Trigger** A creature adjacent to the Bonebleacher bugbear hits them with a melee Strike; **Effect** The triggering creature is exposed to [Ayrzul's Blight](/Diseases.aspx?ID=41). The bugbear can't use Blighted Cloak again until they spend 10 minutes applying blighted plant matter to their cloak.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
_battle axe_ +26 ([Sweep](/Traits.aspx?ID=194)),
**Damage** 1d8+12 slashing plus 1d6 fire

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
hatchet +24 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Sweep](/Traits.aspx?ID=194)),
**Damage** 1d6+12 slashing

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
hatchet +22 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Sweep](/Traits.aspx?ID=194), [thrown 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)),
**Damage** 1d6+12 slashing

**Pinpoint Poisoner**   When the Bonebleacher bugbear successfully Strikes an [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) creature with a poisoned weapon or exposes an off-guard creature to an [inhaled](/Traits.aspx?ID=634) poison, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to its initial save against that poison.

**Poison Spray** <actions string="Single Action" />  **Requirements** The Bonebleacher bugbear is holding a [contact](/Traits.aspx?ID=565) or [injury](/Traits.aspx?ID=635) poison; **Effect** The Bonebleacher bugbear attaches the poison container to a nozzle on their mask, which then sprays the poison from the mask in a 15-foot cone. The bugbear isn't exposed to the poison. All creatures in the cone are immediately exposed to the poison, and each creature must attempt a Fortitude save against the poison.

**Sneak Attack**   The Bonebleacher bugbear deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) creatures.

**Twin Feint** <actions string="Two Actions" />  **Requirements** The Bonebleacher bugbear is wielding two melee weapons, each in a different hand; **Effect** The Bonebleacher bugbear makes a dazzling series of attacks with two weapons, using the first attack to throw their foe [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) against a second attack at a different angle. They make one Strike with each of their two melee weapons, both against the same target. The target is automatically off-guard against the second attack. Apply the bugbear's multiple attack penalty to the Strikes normally.

</column>
name: Bonebleacher Bugbear

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +25, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +23

<row gap="medium">

**Will** +17 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 120

</row>

**Immunities**
[mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647)

**Resistances**
[acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=524) 10, [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669) 10

**Weaknesses**
[fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 10

**Quick Capture** <actions string="Reaction" /> **Trigger** A creature hits or touches the reborn devotee; **Effect** The reborn devotee makes a stalk Strike against the triggering creature. If it hits, the creature is [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=77) in that stalk.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
stalk +25 ([reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 2d8+9 piercing plus 2d6 acid and [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=66)

**Focused Assault** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The reborn devotee attacks a single target with four stalks, making one stalk Strike. On a success, the reborn devotee deals the damage from one  stalk Strike plus an additional 1d8 damage for every stalk beyond the first. On a failure, the reborn devotee deals the damage from one stalk Strike, but it can't use [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=66). It deals no damage on a critical failure. This counts toward the reborn devotee's multiple attack penalty as a number of attacks equal to the number of stalks the devotee has.

**Hungry Flurry** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The reborn devotee makes four stalk Strikes at a –2 penalty, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the reborn devotee's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all its attacks.

Caustic fluid seeps out from the scales of these sluglike cones, which spawn in unsuspecting hosts until they're mature enough to seek a place to root. Moving in writhing swarms that seek a habitat flush with prey, creeping cones spread [Ayrzul's Blight](/Diseases.aspx?ID=41) when destroyed, but leaving them to grow unchecked poses a great risk to other creatures. **[Recall Knowledge - Elemental](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35), [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 27 **[Recall Knowledge - Plant](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 27 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 25 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 22 [Creeping Cone Swarm](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3728) **Source** [Pathfinder #203 Shepherd of Decay](/Sources.aspx?ID=243) pg. 80 **Perception** +18; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=82) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 60 feet **Languages** **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +22 **Str** +6 **Dex** +5 **Con** +6 **Int** -4 **Wis** +2 **Cha** -1 --- **AC** 29 **Fort** +22 **Ref** +19 **Will** +16 **HP** 135 **Immunities** [acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=524), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), precision, [swarm mind](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=78) **Resistances** bludgeoning 10, piercing 10, slashing 7 (except [axes](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=1)) **Weaknesses** area damage 7, axes 10, [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 10, [splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=699) damage 7 **Blight Burst** ([acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=524), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676)) **Trigger** The creeping cone swarm is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points or is reduced to 0 Hit Points; **Effect** A 15-foot-radius emanation of acid explodes from the creeping cone swarm. Creatures in the area take 3d12 acid damage (DC 25 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). Non-blight bonded creatures damaged by this effect are exposed to [Ayrzul's Blight](/Diseases.aspx?ID=41).
**Putrid Spores** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676)) 30 feet. A creature entering the aura must succeed at a DC 26 Fortitude save or become [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91) until the end of its turn (sickened 2 on a critical failure). While within the aura, an affected creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute. --- **Speed** 25 feet, climb 20 feet **Jagged Scales** ([Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) The creeping cones shake off a barrage of jagged, stony scales. Each creature in a 10-foot burst within 30 feet of the swarm takes 2d12+7 slashing damage (DC 29 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). **Pummeling Lurches** Each enemy in the swarm's space takes 6d6 bludgeoning damage (DC 29 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save). A creature that fails its save falls [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=88).
name: Creeping Cone Swarm

markdown:
A single leshy is a nuisance. A horde of leshies is a natural disaster. When confronted by existential threats or malicious ecological devastation, charismatic leshy leaders can rally their kin into a mob. These bands often include several kinds of leshy, creating a ragtag host that can communicate with and draw power from nearly any plant in its path. The farther they travel, the greater the mob's sense of cohesion becomes, gradually awakening an empathic hive mind, coordinated shapeshifting, and communal spellcasting far beyond what any individual could accomplish. Leshy mobs rarely outlast whatever rallied them in the first place. After pillaging a lumber camp or liberating a greenhouse's contents, the leshies gradually shake off their mob mentality—often with some shock or sheepishness at recognizing whatever crimes they just committed. Though the leshies scatter, they often retain a faint sense of camaraderie with their old comrades, making it easier for them to gather again to confront future threats. **[Recall Knowledge - Plant](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 28 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 26 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 23 [Leshy Mob](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3730) **Source** [Pathfinder #203 Shepherd of Decay](/Sources.aspx?ID=243) pg. 82 **Perception** +21; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Fey](/Languages.aspx?ID=119); [_speak with plants_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1681) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +19, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +22, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +22, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +19 **Str** +5 **Dex** +4 **Con** +7 **Int** +3 **Wis** +5 **Cha** +6 --- **AC** 30 **Fort** +23 **Ref** +19 **Will** +21 **HP** 195 (16 squares) **Weaknesses** area damage 12, [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 8, [splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=699) damage 8 **Verdant Burst** ([healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=623), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676), [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509)) When a leshy mob's Hit Points reach a threshold that would reduce its size, a burst of primal energy explodes from the fallen leshies and empowers the surviving fighters. The leshy mob gains 4d8 temporary Hit Points that last for 10 minutes. In addition, all squares within 5 feet of the troop become filled with various plants, becoming [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453). If the environment is not a viable environment for these plants, they wither after 24 hours.
**[Form Up](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=43)** --- **Speed** 25 feet; troop movement **Primal Innate Spells** DC 30 - **5th** [Wall of Thorns](/Spells.aspx?ID=366) - **Constant (3rd)** [Speak with Plants](/Spells.aspx?ID=294) **[Change Shape](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=55)** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) The leshies can transform into an assortment of Small plants that fills a 15-foot burst centered on any one square the leshy mob occupies, creating difficult terrain. When the leshies return to their natural form, they [Form Up](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=43) anywhere within the burst. This otherwise uses the effects of [_one with plants_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1618). **One with the Foliage** The leshy mob ignores [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) caused by plants and fungi, and it treats greater difficult terrain from such sources as difficult terrain. **Rain of Seeds** The leshies grab and hurl an assortment of stones, spores, and explosive seeds, launching a ranged attack in the form of a volley. This volley is a 10-foot burst within 60 feet that deals 4d8 bludgeoning or poison damage (DC 30 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). When the leshies are reduced to 8 or fewer squares, this area decreases to a 5-foot burst. **Troop Movement** Whenever the leshy mob Strides, it first [Forms Up](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=43) as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then moves up to its Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square of the mob enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to the whole group. **Veggielante Justice** **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The leshies assault each enemy creature within 5 feet, with a DC 30 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) Reflex save. The damage depends on the number of actions.
3d8 bludgeoning or slashing damage
3d8+11 bludgeoning or slashing damage
3d8+16 bludgeoning or slashing damage
A Thousand Apologies After dispersing, a leshy mob's members periodically revisit what they damaged and sometimes feel remorse for what they destroyed. In cases of collateral damage, a leshy community might quietly deliver gifts and perform services for those they wronged. These offerings range from fresh produce on a doorstep to weeding a farm field overnight, or even helping a wronged party's direct descendant uncover buried treasure generations later.
name: Leshy Mob

[Speak with Plants](/Spells.aspx?ID=294) (trees only)

**[Change Shape](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=55)** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) The redwood leshy can take the form of a Large tree, using the effects of [_one with plants_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1618).

**Looming Strike**   The leshy deals an additional 1d8 damage to creatures smaller than it.

**Needles That Catch the Clouds**   The leshy can cast [_create water_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1476), [_downpour_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1849), and [_mist_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1606) as innate primal spells once per day, but only while Large or larger.

</column>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-437" />
name: Redwood Leshy

Resembling twisted lumps of fused gravel with oddly angled crystal limbs, gritblights are shock troops commonly used by [Ayrzul](/Deities.aspx?ID=102) to spread terror and disease to his enemies. These creatures are the gruesome result of experiments on crystalline elementals who were once the allies or servants of Ayrzul's rival lord of elemental earth, [Sairazul](/Deities.aspx?ID=107). Their crystalline body parts appear cracked and deformed, only their single “eye” left intact. **[Recall Knowledge - Elemental](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35), [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 36 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 34 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 31 [Gritblight](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3732) **Source** [Pathfinder #203 Shepherd of Decay](/Sources.aspx?ID=243) pg. 84 **Perception** +23; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), blight sense ([precise](/Rules.aspx?ID=411)) 60 feet, [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=82) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 120 feet, grit vision **Languages** [Petran](/Languages.aspx?ID=109) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +21, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +27 **Str** +8 **Dex** +4 **Con** +5 **Int** +0 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +1 **Blight Sense** A gritblight can detect the location of nearby creatures afflicted with [Ayrzul's Blight](/Diseases.aspx?ID=41) as a precise sense at the listed range.
**Grit Vision** A gritblight's vision is unaffected by clouds of sand, dirt, grit, or other earth materials in air or water. --- **AC** 33 **Fort** +26 **Ref** +19 **Will** +23 +1 status vs. [earth](/Traits.aspx?ID=585) effects **HP** 235 **Immunities** bleed, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), [sickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91), [sleep](/Traits.aspx?ID=696) **Resistances** [acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=524) 15, physical 15 **Blight Cloud** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), [radiation](/Traits.aspx?ID=421)) 30 feet. A gritblight continually sheds tiny fragments of radioactive earth in a cloud around it. This cloud conceals the gritblight as a light fog and sheds [dim light](/Rules.aspx?ID=408) in the area. Any creature that begins its turn in the aura takes 2d6 poison damage with a DC 30 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save. A creature that fails its save is exposed to [Ayrzul's Blight](/Diseases.aspx?ID=41) and a creature that critically fails is additionally [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91). --- **Speed** 30 feet, burrow 30 feet; earth glide **Melee** claw +27 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d6+14 slashing plus 2d6 acid **Ranged** caustic shard +23 ([range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 3d6+10 piercing plus 2d6 acid **[Ayrzul's Blight](/Diseases.aspx?ID=41)** ([Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [Earth](/Traits.aspx?ID=55), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) but DC 33. **Earth Glide** The gritblight can [Burrow](/Actions.aspx?ID=2310) through any earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, the gritblight moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing. **Labyrinthine Vision** ([Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) The gritblight forces disorienting visions of Ayrzul's Blistering Labyrinth into the minds of nearby creatures. All creatures in a 60-foot cone take 7d12 mental damage with a DC 33 Will save. Creatures [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=59) by a gritblight's Labyrinthine Vision see only endless earthen tunnels in every direction. The gritblight can't use this ability again for 1d4 rounds.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature takes half damage.
**Failure** The creature takes full damage and is blinded for 1 minute.
**Critical Failure** The creature takes double damage and is blinded permanently. **[Trample](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=81)** Medium or smaller, claw, DC 33
Rare Urgency Ayrzul's infamously cruel patience is a result of purging his own mind of any need for haste by channeling it into his experiments, burying his desire for swift victory over his enemies like an unpleasant secret. Thanks to the influence of their master's discarded emotions, gritblights display an unusual impatience and irritability compared to their fellow earth elementals and are quick to attack at any perceived provocation.
name: Gritblight

As [Zibik](/Deities.aspx?ID=685) wanders the blighted wilderness and takes on the toxins of others, his body is overburdened by fungal growths. Zibik sheds these growths during his cycle of death and rebirth, and they sometimes emerge as a fungal creature that's independent of but innately connected to the [green man](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1176). Zibik often shapes a speaker in spores to resemble an animal he encountered recently; speakers very rarely share the same form, but they all appear like fungal growths surrounded by glowing spores. **[Recall Knowledge - Fungus](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 36 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 34 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 31 [Blighted Speaker in Spores](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3733) **Source** [Pathfinder #203 Shepherd of Decay](/Sources.aspx?ID=243) pg. 85 **Perception** +25; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), sporesight ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 120 feet **Languages** [Muan](/Languages.aspx?ID=108), [Wildsong](/Languages.aspx?ID=116); shaped tongue, spore matrix **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +22, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +24, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +21, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +27, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +27 **Str** +7 **Dex** +3 **Con** +4 **Int** -2 **Wis** +8 **Cha** +2 **Shaped Tongue** The speaker in spores can speak with all plants and the creature they resemble.
**Spore Matrix** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676)) 60 feet. The speaker in spores is surrounded by a strong concentration of spores. The speaker can communicate telepathically to any creatures in the aura who have breathed in their spores. This communication always uses the listener's native language and can't be used with a creature that doesn't breathe.
**Sporesight** The speaker in spores can see through spores drifting in the air, ignoring cover. This is an imprecise sense and functions only in areas without strong wind currents. Sporesight doesn't function underwater. --- **AC** 32 **Fort** +23 **Ref** +20 **Will** +27 **HP** 250 **Immunities** [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669) **Resistances** bludgeoning 15, piercing 15 **Weaknesses** [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 15, slashing 15 **Blight Walker** The speaker in spores recovers from the [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [slowed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=92), and [stunned](/Conditions.aspx?ID=93) conditions at the end of their turn. They're also immune to penalties to their Speeds and ignore [cover](/Rules.aspx?ID=459), [concealment](/Conditions.aspx?ID=62), [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453), and greater difficult terrain resulting from plants or fungi.
**Toxic Spores** ([disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676)) **Trigger** A creature critically hits the speaker or the speaker dies; **Effect** The blighted speaker in spores releases a burst of toxic spores. Any creature within 10 feet of the speaker in spores takes 3d6 poison damage (DC 31 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save). Creatures that fail their saving throw are exposed to [Ayrzul's Blight](/Diseases.aspx?ID=41). --- **Speed** 40 feet; [_fly_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1534) **Melee** tendril +28 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d10+13 bludgeoning plus 1d6 [persistent poison](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) **Primal Innate Spells** DC 33 - **Constant (5th)** [Environmental Endurance](/Spells.aspx?ID=1517), [Fly](/Spells.aspx?ID=1534) **Rituals** DC 33 - **4th** [Blight](/Rituals.aspx?ID=4) **Accelerate Decay** ([Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [Void](/Traits.aspx?ID=510)) The speaker in spores unleashes void energy that forces desiccation in a 30-foot emanation. Each living creature in the area takes 14d6 void damage (DC 33 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save). Creatures afflicted by a disease take a –2 circumstance penalty to this save. All Small or smaller non-magical plant life (though not [plant](/Traits.aspx?ID=668) creatures) in the area wither and die, eliminating any [cover](/Rules.aspx?ID=459) or [concealment](/Conditions.aspx?ID=62) and leaving [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) in their wake. The speaker in spores is immune to this effect and can't use this ability again for 1d4 rounds. **[Ayrzul's Blight](/Diseases.aspx?ID=41)** ([Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [Earth](/Traits.aspx?ID=55), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) but DC 33.
Healthy Speakers A speaker in spores free of the corrupting influence of [Ayrzul's Blight](/Diseases.aspx?ID=41) doesn't have Toxic Spores or Accelerate Decay. It replaces blight with plant growth as a ritual. Zibik has an empathic link with all healthy speakers in spores, as if they were [familiars](/Rules.aspx?ID=2121) and he had the [Share Senses](/Familiars.aspx?ID=136) ability.
name: Blighted Speaker in Spores

markdown:
Wood elementals are nearly as varied as plant life itself. The following are particularly powerful elementals formed when immense plants experience environmental stress. The fresh shoots that sprout from especially grievous cuts sometimes develop minds of their own, eventually budding off from the injured plant to create a phytohydra. **[Recall Knowledge - Elemental](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35), [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 30 **[Recall Knowledge - Plant](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 30 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 28 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 25 [Phytohydra](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3734) **Source** [Pathfinder #203 Shepherd of Decay](/Sources.aspx?ID=243) pg. 86 **Perception** +25 **Languages** [Arboreal](/Languages.aspx?ID=26), [Muan](/Languages.aspx?ID=108); (can't speak any languages) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +21, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +25 **Str** +7 **Dex** +3 **Con** +5 **Int** -1 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +2 --- **AC** 32 **Fort** +25 **Ref** +19 **Will** +22 **HP** 30 (body) 180; Immunities bleed, [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), [sleep](/Traits.aspx?ID=696); Weaknesses [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 10
HP (head) **Immunities** area damage, bleed, [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), [sleep](/Traits.aspx?ID=696) **Weaknesses** [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 10, slashing 5 **Coppice Regrowth** A phytohydra ordinarily has five heads. A creature can attempt to sever one of the heads by specifically targeting it and dealing damage equal to the head's Hit Points. A head that isn't completely severed returns to full Hit Points at the end of any creature's turn.
A phytohydra can regrow a severed head using phytohydra regeneration. A creature can prevent this regrowth by dealing fire damage to the stump, sealing it. Single-target [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) effects need to be targeted at a specific stump, but effects that deal splash damage or affect areas covering the hydra's whole space seal all stumps if they deal fire damage. If the attack that severs a head deals any fire damage or was dealt by an axe, the stump is sealed instantly. If all five heads are sealed, the phytohydra dies.
**Phytohydra Regeneration** The phytohydra has [regeneration](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=72) equal to 5 × the number of heads it has. If a phytohydra's body is missing any heads and the remaining stumps haven't been cauterized, the phytohydra attempts a DC 35 Fortitude save after it regains Hit Points from regeneration. On a success, one unsealed stump regrows two heads; on a critical success, two unsealed stumps regrow into two heads each. The phytohydra can never grow more than double the number of heads it ordinarily has. The phytohydra's regeneration only fully deactivates if all its heads are severed and all stumps are sealed, at which point it dies.
**Reactive Heads** A phytohydra gains an extra reaction per round for each of its heads beyond the first, which it can use only to make Reactive Strikes. It can't use more than 1 reaction on the same triggering action, even if a creature leaves several squares within its reach, and the phytohydra must use a different head for each Reactive Strike it makes. Whenever one of the phytohydra's heads is severed, the phytohydra loses one of its extra reactions per round.
**[Reactive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=48)** (see reactive heads) --- **Speed** 25 feet, climb 25 feet **Melee** branch +25 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 4d6+11 bludgeoning plus [Push](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=47) 10 feet **Melee** fangs +25 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 4d6+13 piercing **Focused Assault** The phytohydra attacks a single target with its many heads. The phytohydra Strikes with its branches or its fangs. On a successful attack, the phytohydra deals damage from its branches or fangs Strike to the target, plus an additional 2d6 damage for every head it has beyond the first. On a failure (but not a critical failure), the phytohydra deals the damage from one branch or fangs Strike to the target creature. This Strike counts as a number of attacks equal to the number of heads the phytohydra has toward its multiple attack penalty. **Splinter Breath** The phytohydra spews splinters in a 60-foot cone that deals 4d6 piercing damage to all creatures in the area (DC 32 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). The damage increases by 2d6 for each head the phytohydra has. The phytohydra can't use Splinter Breath again for 1d4 rounds. **Storm of Branches** The phytohydra makes a number of Strikes up to its number of heads, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the phytohydra's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after the phytohydra makes all its attacks.
Arboreal Treasures The same wounds that form phytohydras often generate vast quantities of sap that the elementals absorb. Over time, the elementals' movement dries and compresses this sap, leaving nodules of amber throughout their bodies. A careful adventurer can harvest a fortune in gems from the oldest phytohydras, and even a severed head left behind could conceal a life-changing bonanza.
name: Phytohydra

<title level="1" pfs="">[Timberweb](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3735)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

On the [Plane of Wood](/Planes.aspx?ID=25), carnivorous plants sometimes grow so large that they can't sustain themselves on local prey. Rather than starve, parts of these plants sometimes tear themselves free and hunt for themselves. The resulting elementals adopt spiderlike forms and hunting strategies. 

Timberwebs extrude vines covered in tiny barbules and sticky sap. After finding a territory with sufficient prey, a timberweb often uses these vines to create shadowy canopies in which to launch ambushes.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Elemental](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35), [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 32

**[Recall Knowledge - Plant](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 32

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 30

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 27
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Timberweb.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 14">[Timberweb](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3735)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Large" />
<trait label="Elemental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=587" />
<trait label="Plant" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=668" />
<trait label="Wood" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=508" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Pathfinder #203 Shepherd of Decay](/Sources.aspx?ID=243) pg. 87

**Perception** +25; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69), [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=82) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 30 feet, vine sense

**Languages**

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +26, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +27

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +7

**Dex** +6

**Con** +5

**Int** +0

**Wis** +5

**Cha** +2
</row>

**Vine Sense** The timberweb has imprecise tremorsense to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its spun vines.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 35 

**Fort** +27 

**Ref** +24 

**Will** +23 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 250

</row>

**Immunities**
bleed, [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), [sleep](/Traits.aspx?ID=696)

**Weaknesses**
[fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 10

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 40 feet, climb 30 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fangs +29,
**Damage** 3d8+17 piercing plus timberweb toxin

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
leg +29 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 3d6+15 slashing

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
vine +27 ([range increment 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)),
**Damage** 3d6+12 bludgeoning plus tree tether

**Rappel** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Move](/Traits.aspx?ID=114)) The timberweb moves straight down up to 60 feet on a spun vine. It can hang from the vine or drop off. The distance it descends doesn't count toward falling damage. A creature that successfully Strikes the vine (AC 36, Hardness 8, 30 HP) severs it, causing the timberweb to fall.

**Timberweb Toxin**  ([Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Saving Throw** DC 34 Fortitude; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** 5d6 poison damage and [clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=61) (1 round); **Stage 2** 6d6 poison damage and clumsy 2 (1 round); **Stage 3** 8d6 poison damage and clumsy 2 (1 round)

**Tree Tether**   A creature hit by the timberweb's vine Strike becomes entangled by the sticky fibers, taking a –15-foot penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute or until it [Escapes](/Actions.aspx?ID=2296) (DC 34) or is cut free (AC 36, Hardness 8, 30 HP). If the target is adjacent to a wooden object of its size or larger, the target is instead [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=81) and stuck to that object until it Escapes or is cut free.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Eusocial Timberwebs</title>

A timberweb instinctively puts distance between itself and the giant plant from which it budded, seeking distant nutrients. However, when timberwebs unexpectedly discover prey close to home, they sometimes drag excess prey to their parent plant. With enough food, the elementals can even band together, operating like worker ants to feed their creator and encouraging the giant plant to create even more timberwebs.
</aside>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-345" />
name: Timberweb

markdown:
Ruzadoya Swiftmane wasn't always a warmonger. She remembers, as a child, that her parents frequently complained about the Verduran Forest's “protectorate” status. Protected from what? By whom? For what purpose? They always believed the Verduran would be better off left to fend for itself, and Ruzadoya lived much of her early life agreeing with them, though she didn't think much of it—life under the treaty was just the way things were, they said. There was nothing to do about it. In time, as Andoran and Taldor pushed the terms of the treaty to their limits, Ruzadoya came to resent her family's passive acceptance of the treaty. She watched too many friends suffer from ignored quotas or being outright mistreated, threatened, belittled, and harassed by invasive woodcutters and colonists. Sometimes these incidents turned violent. The Lodge's continued repeated election of Valenar the Green baffled Ruzadoya. She believed the leader of the Wildwood Lodge was just like her parents— too much talk, too little action. But, for years, Ruzadoya's family said the same thing: “This is the price we pay for peace.” Over time, Ruzadoya grew worse at controlling her anger, but her parents did little to control her frequent frustrated outbursts. Ruzadoya took her anger out in battle or, when there wasn't a fight to be had, in scuffles with her friends, her cousins, even her sister Vandalya. As hostilities with Andoran and Taldor increased in recent years, Ruzadoya saw far too many friends and family pay the ultimate price. And if that price wasn't securing peace, why not change the terms? She attended the Greenwild Gala intending to confront Valenar and demand restitution for the losses caused by the Treaty of the Wildwood. Instead, Valenar died, as did Ruzadoya, each a casualty of the Greenwild Massacre. As her blood soaked the ground, thick, greenish wood grew over Ruzadoya like a suit of plate armor. Twisted branches sprouted from her shoulders and grasping roots erupted from her body to dangle from the gaps between plates. While her armor is impressive, it has an unnatural and unsettling appearance; the wood looks sick, like it had given up its own vitality to keep Ruzadoya alive. Even without her armor, Ruzadoya was an imposing figure. Now, she's terrifying. Her desiccated flesh, raspy voice, unblinking eyes—they all make her seem like a corpse. Ruzadoya's armor formed from coalesced primal energy that sprouted in her body and soul when she died, fueled by her anger and purpose and in turn granting her the “gift” of undeath. The time Ruzadoya spent on the Isle of Arenway no doubt contributed to this surge of primal energy, though she attributes her newfound power to her own strength and conviction. Ruzadoya has come to believe that her armor represents the will of the Verduran Forest. She considers herself a force of nature with a singular purpose: to restore natural order and Verduran might by destroying her enemies. She's willing to use (and utterly deplete) any resources, powers, and allies at her disposal. No price is too great, and no creature's suffering (not even her own) is unacceptable. Andoran and Taldor have sowed the seeds of their own destruction for centuries. Ruzadoya will only rest once the reaping is done. Campaign Role After antagonizing the PCs for the past three adventures, Ruzadoya faces them in battle when they confront her at the end of this adventure. After gaining trust and support from the people of Cradle of Knot, the PCs can find their way through the blighted wastes and track down their final foe. Defeating Ruzadoya not only ends the threat that she might return to Golarion and retake the Wildwood Lodge, but puts a stop to her efforts to convince Zibik to lay waste to Andoran and Taldor. Of course, Ruzadoya has had a long time to influence Zibik, and the PCs must do more than destroy the graveknight— if they want to thwart Ruzadoya completely, they must also reveal the extent of her deception. If they fail, Ruzadoya's plans to incite war in Avistan could still come to fruition, even beyond her true death and final destruction. Ruzadoya might even return to seek revenge on the PCs if they don't completely eradicate her graveknight armor. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 42 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 40 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 37 [Ruzadoya Swiftmane](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3736) **Source** [Pathfinder #203 Shepherd of Decay](/Sources.aspx?ID=243) pg. 89 **Perception** +26; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Druidic](/Languages.aspx?ID=23), [Elven](/Languages.aspx?ID=4), [Fey](/Languages.aspx?ID=119), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +28, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +26, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) +23, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +28, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +24, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47) +23, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +24, [Warfare Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +27 **Str** +8 **Dex** +4 **Con** +5 **Int** +3 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +6 **Items** _+1 [resilient](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2786) [duskwood](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2800) [full plate](/Armor.aspx?ID=50)_, [Guisarme](/Weapons.aspx?ID=25), [Composite Longbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=74) (20 arrows) --- **AC** 38 **Fort** +27 **Ref** +24 **Will** +24 **HP** 255 (rejuvenation, [void healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=83)) **Immunities** bleed, [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95) **Resistances** [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509) 10 **Grasping Armor** A creature that Strikes Ruzadoya with a melee weapon must succeed at a DC 31 Reflex save or be [disarmed](/Actions.aspx?ID=2383) of that weapon. If the creature critically fails, the weapon ends up in Ruzadoya's space. A creature that hits Ruzadoya with an unarmed attack must succeed at a DC 31 Reflex save or become [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=77) by Ruzadoya until the end of her next turn, it [Escapes](/Actions.aspx?ID=2296), or Ruzadoya moves, whichever comes first.
**Rejuvenation** ([primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676)) When Ruzadoya is destroyed, her armor rebuilds her body over the course of 1d10 days. If her body is destroyed before then, the process restarts. Ruzadoya can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating her armor (such as with [_disintegrate_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1492)), transporting it to the [Plane of Fire](/Planes.aspx?ID=31), or throwing it into the heart of a volcano.
**Sapping Aura** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676), [void](/Traits.aspx?ID=510)) 30 feet. When a creature in the aura uses a [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509) spell or ability, Ruzadoya automatically attempts to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) it, with a +23 counteract modifier.
**[Reactive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=48)** --- **Speed** 40 feet **Melee** _guisarme_ +29 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196)), **Damage** 3d10+14 slashing plus 1d6 [persistent bleed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) plus rooting strikes **Melee** hoof +29 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 3d8+14 bludgeoning plus 1d6 [persistent bleed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) plus rooting strikes **Ranged** _composite longbow_ +25 ([deadly 2d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Propulsive](/Traits.aspx?ID=191), [range increment 100 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 0](/Traits.aspx?ID=254), [volley 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=201)), **Damage** 3d8+10 piercing plus 1d6 [persistent bleed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) **Graveknight's Curse** ([Curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=38), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) This curse affects anyone who wears Ruzadoya's armor for at least 1 hour; **Saving Throw** DC 39 Will; **Onset** 1 hour; **Stage 1** [doomed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=67) and can't remove the armor (1 day); **Stage 2** doomed 2, –10-foot status penalty to Speeds, and can't remove the armor (1 day); **Stage 3** dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight. **Rooting Strikes** On a critical hit with a melee weapon or [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=719) attack, Ruzadoya's target is [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=81) for 1 round ([Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=2296) DC 31) and [clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=61) for as long as the immobilization lasts. **Ruinous Weapons** Any weapon or unarmed attack Ruzadoya uses gains the effects of the +1 [_greater striking_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2829) and [_wounding_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2854) weapon runes. **[Trample](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=81)** Medium or smaller, hoof, DC 31 **Weapon Master** Ruzadoya has access to the [critical specialization effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235) of any weapons she wields. **Withering Blast** ([Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [Void](/Traits.aspx?ID=510)) Ruzadoya unleashes a 30-foot cone of corruption. Creatures in the area take 8d12 void damage (DC 34 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save). Ruzadoya can use this ability once every 1d4 rounds.
name: Ruzadoya Swiftmane

“[Zibik](/Deities.aspx?ID=685) shepherds death, and life follows.” A common greeting among Zibik's followers, this saying encompasses many aspects of the [green man](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1176)'s life and teachings. While typical green men concern themselves entirely with the wellbeing of plants, Zibik focuses on the persistent collapse and decomposition that allows environments to thrive. In many ways, he's the embodiment of a towering tree falling over, the loss of its expansive canopy allowing sunlight to reach a new generation of saplings. Fungus fascinates Zibik, and his long association with decay and regrowth has caused him to take on aspects of primal fungus. Ages ago, before the [Plane of Wood](/Planes.aspx?ID=25) was sealed off, Zibik traveled there hoping to study and understand how a plane of unfettered growth could sustain itself. While exploring [the Universe](/Planes.aspx?ID=26), he learned that many natural areas recovered from horrifying calamities to be stronger than before, while others stagnated after experiencing even mild changes to the environment. What allowed the Plane of Wood to eternally flourish? Did death and decomposition exist here as well, perhaps to an even greater degree? Or did the environment somehow thrive without natural cycles of decay? He learned much, but his investigations were short-lived, and he never returned to the Universe with his findings; the betrayal and conflict between the Elemental Lords sequestered the Plane of Wood, trapping Zibik there. However, these same events introduced [Ayrzul's Blight](/Diseases.aspx?ID=41), giving Zibik newfound purpose. The disease caused fascinating mutations, and even as it killed off swaths of plant life, it left new life in its wake. As the blight spread, eradicating entire ecosystems, Zibik's fascination turned to desperate terror; natural diseases are part of life, but Ayrzul's Blight is anything but natural. For thousands of years, he's fought the blight by destroying vibrant frontiers (forming the equivalent of firebreaks), decomposing afflicted material, and absorbing disease and radiation into his own body so that blighted areas might regrow. The cycle of fighting the blight (involving Zibik's own cyclical death and rebirth) has increasingly shaped his moral perspective; he sees that drastic action against a part is sometimes the only thing that can save the whole. Zibik focuses his efforts on remote areas of the plane, rarely interacting with settlements except to warn them of his intentions if they happen to be near an ecosystem he plans to transform. He often spends decades in a single blighted region before moving on. The Elemental Lords of Wood know to leave Zibik alone; he's largely helping the plane thrive, even when he must make sacrifices, and confronting him poses certain risks due to the tremendous levels of disease and blight afflicting the green man at any given time. Zibik's appearance shifts as he progresses through cycles of decay and regrowth. After rejuvenating, he looks stout and healthy, his stride and posture almost regal. As he absorbs diseases from the environment, sickly fungus sprouts all over his body, weighing him down and draining his energy, both physically and spiritually. However he appears, his voice always carries the same grim determination and pride. Campaign Role Zibik is by far the most powerful being the PCs encounter in the Wardens of Wildwood campaign. Thankfully for the PCs, they aren't likely to face him in combat, though he poses a grave threat to the Verduran Forest and nearby nations. In the adventure's final scene, the PCs must convince Zibik that Ruzadoya Swiftmane has deceived him. Should they fail to counter the graveknight's deceptive narratives about Avistan and its people, Zibik is sure to make his way through the portal to the Isle of Arenway. Once he does, few could stand in his way. In his current state, he would spread destruction, death, and disease. The blight would spread. Andoran and Taldor would be the first nations impacted, but without swift and decisive action, they would fail to stop Zibik. Most living things would be killed outright, survivors would experience agonizing disease, and decades of suffering would follow. But in time, life would return to southern Avistan, the region forever transformed into something new. Something better. Stronger. More resilient. Zibik, his work accomplished, would be long gone—unless the people of Avistan proved Ruzadoya Swiftmane was right all along. Should they mount an offensive against Zibik, rather than letting him destroy the region and bring about new life, he might decide he has no choice but to stay on Golarion a while longer. So be it. Zibik shepherds death, and life follows. **[Recall Knowledge - Fungus](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 58 **[Recall Knowledge - Plant](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 58 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 56 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 53 [Zibik](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3737) **Source** [Pathfinder #203 Shepherd of Decay](/Sources.aspx?ID=243) pg. 90 **Perception** +42; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), plantsense 60 feet **Languages** [Arboreal](/Languages.aspx?ID=26), [Fey](/Languages.aspx?ID=119), [Muan](/Languages.aspx?ID=108), [Wildsong](/Languages.aspx?ID=116); green tongue **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +39, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +42, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +40, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) +40, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +40, [Medicine](/Skills.aspx?ID=42) +48, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +48, [Plane of Wood Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +48, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +41, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +44 **Str** +12 **Dex** +9 **Con** +11 **Int** +7 **Wis** +10 **Cha** +8 **Green Tongue** A green man can communicate with plants, with the effects of [_speak with plants_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1681), and can use [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) to [Make an Impression](/Actions.aspx?ID=2392) on plants and [Request](/Actions.aspx?ID=2393) things from plants.
**Plantsense** A green man can sense life force via plants. This allows them to observe a living or [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=722) creature's vital essence within 60 feet of the green man, but they can also use this precise sense to observe any living or undead creature within 60 feet of any plant matter within 120 feet of the green man. This allows the green man to see living things through solid plant matter, as well as seeing through other barriers if there are plants on the other side. --- **AC** 51 **Fort** +43 **Ref** +39 **Will** +42 **HP** 525 **Resistances** bludgeoning 20, piercing 20 **Weaknesses** axe vulnerability, fire 20 **Aura of Absorption** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [fungus](/Traits.aspx?ID=614), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676)) 120 feet. Zibik constantly absorbs toxins and pathogens from his surroundings. Zibik automatically absorbs afflictions from non-creature plants, increasing his [drained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=68) value by 1 each round he absorbs any afflictions from such plants (with no maximum). Living creatures in the area can attempt a saving throw against any [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578) or [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669) afflicting them each round, increasing their degree of success for the save by one step. If a creature succeeds, Zibik automatically [counteracts](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) the affliction and increases his current drained value by 1 (with no maximum). When Zibik removes an affliction with this ability, he automatically advances to Stage 1 of the affliction and must continue to attempt saving throws as normal. Zibik can choose to exclude any number of creatures in the area from this effect, and generally does so to absorb [Ayrzul's Blight](/Diseases.aspx?ID=41) while allowing natural afflictions to run their course.
**Axe Vulnerability** A green man takes 20 additional damage from [axes](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=1).
**Fungal Rebirth** ([fungus](/Traits.aspx?ID=614), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676)) When Zibik dies as the result of a disease or his Aura of Absorption, fungus rebuilds his body over the course of 3d6 days. If his body is destroyed before then, the process restarts. When restored to life, he's bolstered by primal might; he gains a +3 circumstance bonus to saving throws against diseases for a number of weeks equal to the number of days it took his body to regrow, and he's unaffected by the [drained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=68) condition for the same duration (though he can still gain the condition).
**Green Caress** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=631), [plant](/Traits.aspx?ID=668), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676), [transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) 60 feet. Living creatures in the area other than plants slowly transform into non-creature plants. The green man can exclude creatures from this effect, but they must be aware of a creature's presence and location to do so. A non-[plant](/Traits.aspx?ID=668) creature in the area must attempt a DC 45 Fortitude save immediately before the start of its turn.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected, or if it is [slowed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=92) by green caress, it reduces its slowed value by 2.
**Success** The creature is unaffected, or if it is slowed by green caress, it reduces its slowed value by 1.
**Failure** The creature becomes slowed 1, or if it was already slowed by green caress, increases the slowed value by 1, as their body transforms more and more into a non-creature plant. If the creature ever becomes slowed to the point they have no actions left for their turn, they become an inanimate plant, a condition that can only be reversed by [_primal phenomenon_](/Spells.aspx?ID=231) or similarly powerful magic.
**Critical Failure** As failure, except the creature becomes slowed 2 (or increases the condition value by 2).
**Root In Place** **Trigger** A creature within the green man's reach uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using; **Effect** The green man lashes out to hold the foe in place. The green man makes a vine Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack hits, the green man disrupts the action. If the creature was [Flying](/Actions.aspx?ID=2312) when its action was disrupted, it falls. --- **Speed** 40 feet, climb 40 feet **Melee** vine +46 ([deadly 3d12](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [versatile P](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 4d10+27 bludgeoning plus absorb magic and [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=66) **Ranged** thorn +43 ([fatal d12](/Traits.aspx?ID=178), [range increment 120 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 0](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)), **Damage** 4d8+27 piercing plus embed **Primal Innate Spells** DC 48 - **Cantrips (10th)** [Detect Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=66), [Read Aura](/Spells.aspx?ID=246) - **8th** [Desiccate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1484), [Life-Draining Roots](/Spells.aspx?ID=1403), [Unfettered Movement](/Spells.aspx?ID=1732) - **9th** [Energy Aegis](/Spells.aspx?ID=100), [Entwined Roots](/Spells.aspx?ID=1400) - **10th** [Flourishing Flora](/Spells.aspx?ID=1401) (×3), [Heal](/Spells.aspx?ID=148) (×3), [Nature's Pathway](/Spells.aspx?ID=1613) (at will), [Regenerate](/Spells.aspx?ID=248) (×3), [Truesight](/Spells.aspx?ID=1727) **Rituals** DC 48, green rituals - **4th** [Plant Growth](/Rituals.aspx?ID=18) - **6th** [Awaken Animal](/Rituals.aspx?ID=3), [Commune](/Rituals.aspx?ID=6), [Primal Call](/Rituals.aspx?ID=19) - **8th** [Control Weather](/Rituals.aspx?ID=9) - **10th** [Wish](/Rituals.aspx?ID=125) **Absorb Magic** The green man's vines leach away magic and transform it into life essence for the green man. On a successful vine Strike, the green man attempts to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) one spell active on the target (typically one vexing the green man, or determined randomly if they aren't aware of specific effects), with a counteract level of 10 and a modifier of +38. If the effect is counteracted, the green man gains 30 temporary Hit Points that last for 10 minutes. **Embed** The green man's thorns embed themselves into any creature they damage, taking root into the ground. A target damaged by a thorn has its Speeds halved, and it can't Step, [Fly](/Actions.aspx?ID=2312), [_air walk_](/Spells.aspx?ID=6), or otherwise leave the ground until the thorn is removed. Removing a thorn requires 3 Interact actions, which don't have to be consecutive. If the creature performing the final action doesn't succeed at a DC 45 [Medicine](/Skills.aspx?ID=42) check as part of that action, the target takes 10d6 damage upon the thorn's removal. **Focus Vines** The green man focuses all their vines against a single vexing foe, making a single vine Strike. On a success, the target takes 5d10 additional damage and is affected by Absorb Magic three times. Even on a failure, the target takes the normal effects of a hit with a vine Strike, but on a critical failure, the vines miss completely. **Green Grab** A green man can use their [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=66) action against a creature of any size. **Green Rituals** A green man can perform all their rituals without secondary casters, relying on their own primal ties to the vital essence in spirits of nature. A green man's [_awaken animal_](/Rituals.aspx?ID=109) and [_primal call_](/Rituals.aspx?ID=122) rituals work on plants instead of their usual range of choices. Most green men also know the ritual to create various types of [leshys](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=437) and possibly even magic allowing the creation of [arboreals](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=364) or more powerful plant creatures. **Purge Plaguebearers** ([Fungus](/Traits.aspx?ID=77), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) Zibik exudes a cloud of spores in a 30-foot-radius emanation. They cling to all creatures currently afflicted with any [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578) in the area. Afflicted creatures take 25d6 void damage with a DC 48 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save. A creature that fails its save becomes [doomed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=67) for 1 minute and [sickened 3](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91). Zibik can choose to exclude any number of creatures in the area from this effect. Zibik can't use Purge Plaguebearers again for 1d4 rounds. **Vine Forest** The green man lashes out with all six vines to attack many opponents. They make up to six vine Strikes, each against a different target; this counts as one attack for their multiple attack penalty, increasing only after all the attacks are made.
name: Zibik

<title level="1" pfs="">[Azarpal](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3738)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Azarpals resemble bipedal hogs with wide-tusked mouths, bloated bellies, and long, bristly tails. They can store food in their multiple stomachs for long periods of time, slowly infusing it with a signature poison that causes those afflicted to sweat profusely and succumb to intense nausea.

 Azarpals love spreading discontent via poisoned food. They delight in traveling caravan routes, disguised as merchants, constantly sampling regional cuisines, and choosing their favorites for stomach storage and poison infusion. Then, upon reaching a land where the dish is rare or sought after, they find a place to leave the meal out for an unwary traveler. They might also find a way to introduce the poisoned meal to a tavern or restaurant and hang back to watch the resulting fun.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Fey](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 33

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 28
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Azarpal.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 13">[Azarpal](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3738)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=721" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Fey" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=599" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Pathfinder #204: Stage Fright](/Sources.aspx?ID=245) pg. 84

**Perception** +24; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Diabolic](/Languages.aspx?ID=117), [Fey](/Languages.aspx?ID=119)

**Skills**
[Cooking Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +23, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=37) +23, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +27, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +26, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=50) +24

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +4

**Dex** +7

**Con** +5

**Int** +5

**Wis** +4

**Cha** +8
</row>

**Items**
[moderate skeptical fury cocktail](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1917) laced with azarpal poison, [moderate poison fizz](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1926) laced with azarpal poison, [4 regional meals laced with azarpal poison](/Armor.aspx?ID=22)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 34 

**Fort** +24 

**Ref** +26 

**Will** +20 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 275

</row>

**Immunities**
azarpal poison, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 30 feet, burrow 15 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
jaws +26 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179)),
**Damage** 3d12+12 piercing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
tail +26 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179)),
**Damage** 3d10+10 bludgeoning

**Occult Innate Spells** DC 30, attack +22
- **7th**
[Illusory Disguise](/Spells.aspx?ID=159)

**Azarpal Poison**  ([poison **Saving Throw** DC 28 Fortitude](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Onset** 1 minute; **Maximum Duration** 6 minutes; **Stage 1** [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91) (1 minute); **Stage 2** [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=73) and sickened 2 (1 minute); **Stage 3** 2d12 poison damage plus fatigued and sickened 3 (1 minute); the sickened condition value caused by azarpal poison cannot be reduced below 1 as long as the poison's duration remains active.

**Culinary Alchemy**   The azarpal knows the formulas for all common and [uncommon](/Traits.aspx?ID=721) [alchemical foods](/Equipment.aspx?Category=6&Subcategory=92) of its level or lower in _Treasure Vault_ without needing a formula book. A typical azarpal carries about 700 gp of alchemical food.

**Gulp or Grab** <actions string="Three Actions" /> ([Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) The Azarpal swallows a single meal or alchemical food and stores it in one of six stomachs. Therein, the food doesn't spoil (drinks must be swallowed in closed containers, or they spill and affect the azarpal normally). The azarpal can use this activity to reach into its mouth and retrieve a stored item as well. Any item that remains stored in an azarpal's stomach for at least 24 hours becomes laced with azarpal poison.

**Lasting Illusion**   When an azarpal casts [_illusory disguise_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1568) and only targets themselves, the duration increases to 24 hours.

**Twirl Tail** <actions string="Single Action" />  The azarpal lashes and twirls their confounding tail, snapping and lashing it in all adjacent squares. Until the start of the azarpal's next turn, all non-azarpals treat the squares adjacent to the azarpal as [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453).

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="">Removing Azarpal Poison</title>

Once an item of food or drink has been laced with azarpal poison, it can be detoxified through the use of a [_cleanse cuisine_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1468) spell or by spending an hour using alchemical supplies to nullify the poison. This latter option requires access to an [alchemical lab](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2701) and a successful [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=37) check against the azarpal's poison save DC.
</aside>
name: Azarpal

markdown:
A mass of undulating tendrils and nerves, furnericos stalk sewer systems below large cities, reveling in the filth and rotting detritus created by those who dwell above the middens and sumps they call home. Fortunately for sanitation workers and other civil servants who ply their trade in sewer tunnels, furnericos are exceedingly rare and solitary. Their power is such that once one moves into a sewer system, it's often easier for urban planners to simply abandon that section to the monster and rebuild around it. A furnerico left to its domain like this is generally content to remain—as long as the filth keeps flowing. Furnericos are asexual, spawning a single offspring as they expire from natural causes. One that dies by violence does not perpetuate its kind, presenting a vexing question to sages: where do these creatures come from, and why haven't they gone extinct over the ages? **[Recall Knowledge - Aberration](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44)): DC 37 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 35 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 32 [Furnerico](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3739) **Source** [Pathfinder #204: Stage Fright](/Sources.aspx?ID=245) pg. 85 **Perception** +24; [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=74) ([precise](/Rules.aspx?ID=411)) 60 feet **Languages** **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +28, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +25 **Str** +8 **Dex** +5 **Con** +8 **Int** -4 **Wis** +4 **Cha** -3 --- **AC** 33 **Fort** +28 **Ref** +23 **Will** +24 **HP** 320 **Immunities** [acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=524), [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578) **Resistances** bludgeoning 15, piercing 15, [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669) 15 **Weaknesses** slashing 15 **Fetid Aura** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [olfactory](/Traits.aspx?ID=664)) 80 feet. A creature entering or beginning its turn in a furnerico's fetid aura must succeed at a DC 31 Fortitude or be [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91); the creature also becomes [enfeebled 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=71) until the end of their next turn. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to all furnerico fetid auras for 1 minute.
**Hydrophobic** A furnerico avoids water and won't willingly approach within five feet of a body of water. It won't initiate an attack against any creature that's soaking wet with water or that has the [water](/Traits.aspx?ID=732) trait. A furnerico takes a –2 circumstance penalty to its attack rolls against such creatures who attack it.
**Susceptible to Water** A furnerico cleansed of filth becomes sluggish. If ever immersed fully in pure, clean water, or if it ever fails a saving throw against a [water](/Traits.aspx?ID=732) effect, the furnerico becomes [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=92) until it starts its turn in an area of filth or contaminated water. --- **Speed** 15 feet, climb 30 feet **Melee** pseudopod +28 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d12+14 bludgeoning **Ranged** acidic slime +25 ([range 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 4d6 acid plus 3d6 [persistent acid](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) **Feast on Illness** ([Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) **Requirements** The furnerico's last action was a successful pseudopod Strike against a creature with the [sickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91) condition; **Effect** The furnerico feeds off the sweet sickness of the creature, gaining 30 temporary hit points for 1 minute. **Sticky Slime** A creature that's critically hit by a furnerico's acidic slime becomes [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=81) until they [Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=2296) (DC 34) or 1 minute passes, after which the slime dissolves.
Cultist Creations The answer to “where are furnericos from?” is known by only a few, for it lies with the faithful of the parasite god [Ghlaunder](/Deities.aspx?ID=343). These cultists use obscure rites to create furnericos from the very filth the monsters wallow in. Ghlaunder worshippers often do so to create powerful guardians for their hidden temples; furnericos created in this manner instinctively treat worshippers of Ghlaunder as allies... a trait not shared by those born from a prior furnerico, and a lesson many Ghlaunder cultists only learn moments before their death after assuming otherwise from a furnerico found in the wild.
name: Furnerico
