When a group of diabolists or worshippers of an archdevil come to an ignominious end, their souls can sometimes be caught between life and death, unable or unwilling to pass on to the afterlife due to the humiliation of their untimely deaths. When enough closely-associated worshippers whose souls aren't already claimed in existing contracts meet such a fate, the spiritual “weight” of this shame can cause them to merge into a conglomeration of infernally-infused spirits—a hellshadow. Hellshadows look like a bank of fire and smoke, yet the flames themselves are made of distorted bodies and faces. Although made of multiple souls, a hellshadow is a singular creature with one mind and typically one goal: to defeat as many enemies of their faith as they can in order to repay the shame of their humiliating deaths. **[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 36 **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 36 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 34 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 31 [Hellshadow](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3740) **Source** [Pathfinder #204: Stage Fright](/Sources.aspx?ID=245) pg. 86 **Perception** +24; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Diabolic](/Languages.aspx?ID=117) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +25, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +27, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +25 **Str** -5 **Dex** +6 **Con** +5 **Int** +4 **Wis** +5 **Cha** +8 --- **AC** 33 **Fort** +23 **Ref** +25 **Will** +22 **HP** 175 ([void healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=83)) **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), precision, [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95) **Resistances** all 10 (except [force](/Traits.aspx?ID=610), [ghost touch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2840), or [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509); double resistance against non-[magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=644)) **Weaknesses** [holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517) 10 **Brimstone Cloak** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=579), [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604), [sanctified](/Traits.aspx?ID=519)) 10 feet. The hellshadow constantly exudes a cloud of smoke that scorches flesh but leaves other materials unharmed. Living creatures who start their turn in this aura take 2d6 fire damage (DC 30 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex). On a critical failure, the creature is also [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91). --- **Speed** fly 40 feet **Melee** brimstone tendrils +27 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Sanctified](/Traits.aspx?ID=519)), **Damage** 3d8+6 fire plus 2d6 void and clinging smoke **Divine Innate Spells** DC 33, attack +25 - **Cantrips (7th)** [Divine Lance](/Spells.aspx?ID=84), [Void Warp](/Spells.aspx?ID=1745) - **6th** [Crisis of Faith](/Spells.aspx?ID=55), [Divine Immolation](/Spells.aspx?ID=1496) - **7th** [Divine Decree](/Spells.aspx?ID=82), [Shadow Blast](/Spells.aspx?ID=273) (fire or spirit only) **Clinging Smoke** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48)) A creature that takes damage from the hellshadow's brimstone tendrils Strike has coils of the creature's smoke solidify around their body, impeding movement. The creature must attempt a DC 33 Reflex save.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The smoke solidifies as it coils around their limbs, imposing a –5-foot status penalty to all Speeds until the end of the creature's next turn.
**Failure** As success, except –10 feet to speed and the creature is also clumsy 1 until the end of their next turn.
**Critical Failure** As failure, except the creature is also slowed 1 until the end of their next turn.
Why Only Hell? The nature of diabolic worship and the strict rules involved are a big part of the psychology of humiliation that causes devil worshippers to become hellshadows. This same mix of conditions is rarer among other fiendish cults, who are more likely to become more common undead after such a death. Non-diabolic– themed hellshadows are all but unknown as a result.
name: Hellshadow

With its mottled green-and-tan rubbery flesh, six short legs ending in two-clawed feet, and three circular mouths arrayed equidistantly around a disk-shaped head crowned by multiple bulbous eyes, the bizarre Darklands-dwelling ockomlire's strange appearance blurs the line between aberration and fungus. Ockomlires eat magic, and their specialized organs process and release that magic in the form of a mist that saps the willpower of those it touches. Originally created by [sekmin](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=468) occultists as a potent weapon against Azlanti wizards, since the serpentfolk empire's collapse thousands of years ago, ockomlires have spread upward through the Darklands. They often lair in sewers or abandoned basements in urban areas, drawn to society's use (and waste) of magical energy. Ockomlires are quite intelligent but tend to have bland personalities. They're fond of verbalizing their observations and experiences, speaking in unsettling piping voices through three mouths; they have a curious penchant for referring to themselves in the third person. They've little interest in having personal names and tend to refer to those they encounter by ancestry instead of name as well. **[Recall Knowledge - Aberration](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44)): DC 36 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 34 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 31 [Ockomlire](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3741) **Source** [Pathfinder #204: Stage Fright](/Sources.aspx?ID=245) pg. 87 **Perception** +23; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [_detect magic_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1485) **Languages** [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Sakvroth](/Languages.aspx?ID=118) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +27, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44) +24, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +23 **Str** +8 **Dex** +4 **Con** +5 **Int** +5 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +0 --- **AC** 33 **Fort** +26 **Ref** +21 **Will** +23 +1 status to all saves vs [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=590) effects **HP** 235 **Resistances** [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647) 15 **Weaknesses** emotion vulnerability **Emotion Vulnerability** If an ockomlire fails a saving throw against an emotion effect, they loses their resistance to mental damage and gains an equal amount of weakness to mental damage (weakness to mental 15 for the typical ockomlire) until the end of their next turn. --- **Speed** 20 feet, climb 10 feet **Melee** jaws +27 ([Forceful](/Traits.aspx?ID=180)), **Damage** 3d10+14 piercing plus [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=66) **Occult Innate Spells** DC 33 - **7th** [Calm](/Spells.aspx?ID=1458) (at will) - **Constant (7th)** [Detect Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=66) **Devour Magic** ([Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) The ockomlire attempts to devour a spell effect from a creature they've [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=77). To successfully do so, they must [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) that effect with an [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44) check. If the spell effect is an [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=590) effect, the ockomlire gains a +2 circumstance bonus to this check.
**Critical Success** The spell is countered, the ockomlire gains temporary Hit Points equal to twice the spell's rank for 1 minute, and the grabbed creature becomes [stupefied 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=94) for 1 minute.
**Success** As success but stupefied 1.
**Critical Failure** The attempt backfires, and the ockomlire becomes overwhelmed; their emotion vulnerability becomes active until the end of their turn. **Haze of Despair** ([Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) **Requirements** The ockomlire has temporary hit points gained from Devour Magic; **Effects** The ockomlire digests the magic and releases mist that stings the eyes and heart alike. The ockomlire loses any temporary Hit Points they have and all non-ockomlire creatures in a 30-foot emanation take 9d10 mental damage (DC 33 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Will save).
Ockomlire Apathy Because they exude feelings of hopelessness and despair as “waste” from their magical feeding, the ockomlire has become a creature of apathetic detachment. While this affords the ockomlire protection from emotion-based effects, those that do affect them tend to hit hard and actually cause mental anguish. There are thrilling legends of ockomlires laid low by a single bard whose gripping performance simply stirred up enough emotions within the normally distant creatures to cause them rip themselves apart from the inside.
name: Ockomlire

markdown:
Rezzelkis are curious-looking beasts native to the deserts of Osirion. Three feet tall at the shoulder and five feet long, rezzelkis are squat, mammalian quadrupeds with tawny red fur, with crystal-studded flat tails, and prehensile anteater-like snouts. Their long, pink tongues are covered with hundreds of tiny, razor-sharp bristles that allow them to rasp through flesh with unnerving ease, even before accounting for the effect of their acidic saliva. Rezzelkis are ferociously territorial and quick to attack anyone or anything they regard as intruding upon their territory. Yet they're also prone to strange gastronomic obsessions, and if someone can deduce a particular rezzelki's favorite food, it's possible to become the creature's ally by simply providing it regular access to its preferred meals. A specific rezzelki's favorite food is always a specific type of creature— some even prefer to dine exclusively on the dry bodies of undead like [mummies](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=445)—but most have a taste for a singular humanoid ancestry. Presented with a potential meal, the rezzelki moves quickly to smash its feast with its wide tail. Then it feeds upon the pulverized remains of the destroyed creature, slurping up battered flesh and powdered bones with a noisy gusto that has earned them a strange nickname in certain circles: “deathlicker.” **[Recall Knowledge - Beast](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35), [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 29 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 27 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 24 [Rezzelki](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3742) **Source** [Pathfinder #204: Stage Fright](/Sources.aspx?ID=245) pg. 88 **Perception** +21; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), glutton scent ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 60 feet **Languages** [Osiriani](/Languages.aspx?ID=40); (can't speak) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +22 **Str** +6 **Dex** +3 **Con** +5 **Int** -3 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +2 **Glutton Scent** A rezzelki's scent ability becomes a [precise](/Rules.aspx?ID=411) sense against its favored meal. --- **AC** 29 **Fort** +21 **Ref** +17 **Will** +19 **HP** 175 **Resistances** [acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=524) 10 **Favored Meal** All rezzelkis have a favorite type of creature to feast upon (see the Rezzelki Hunger sidebar). Against a favored meal in combat, a rezzelki gains a +1 circumstance bonus to all Strikes and [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) checks.
**Reactive Taste** ([primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676)) **Trigger** A creature within reach of the rezzelki's tongue uses a [manipulate](/Actions.aspx?ID=2229) or a [move](/Traits.aspx?ID=658) action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using; **Effect** The rezzelki makes a tongue Strike against the triggering creature. --- **Speed** 25 feet, fly 20 feet **Melee** tail +22 ([Forceful](/Traits.aspx?ID=180)), **Damage** 2d12+10 bludgeoning plus [Knockdown](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=46) **Melee** tongue +22 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d6+6 slashing plus 1d6 acid **Primal Innate Spells** DC 29 - **Constant (5th)** [Fly](/Spells.aspx?ID=125) **Fracturing Smash** ([Attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15)) The rezzelki Strikes a target with a particularly powerful blow from its tail, with enough force to potentially pulverize bone. This Strike treats any object it hits as if it had half as much Hardness as usual, unless the object's hardness is greater than the rezzelki's level. If the Fracturing Smash hits, it deals two extra dice of weapon damage. A creature with a skeleton that takes damage must succeed at a DC 26 Fortitude save or become [clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=61) (clumsy 2 on a critical failure) by the Fracturing Smash as its bones are partially broken.
Rezzelki Hunger While a rezzelki can subsist on any sort of pulverized creature's remains, they vastly prefer a specific type of creature and can sniff these potential meals out with alarming accuracy. If an encounter doesn't specify what a rezzelki's favorite foodstuff is, roll 1d6: 1—[human](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=6), 2—[dwarf](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=1), 3—[elf](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=2), 4—[kholo](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=79), 5—[desert giant](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1167), 6—[mummy](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=445). Rezzelkis found in regions other than Osirion certainly develop appetites for other types of creatures, of course!
name: Rezzelki

markdown:
Across the crooked folds of the [Dimension of Time](/Planes.aspx?ID=46), intense emotions gather like flotsam in the still waters of river pools. These accumulate over ages, harvesting stronger feelings during times of great change such as calamities and the rule of tyrannical despots, as well as periods of joy and pride. These accretions eventually give birth to siktemporas. The anguish siktempora is rare, even among others of their kind. They delight in seeking out creatures to inflict their suffering upon, the utterances of their dreadful wails relieve their anguish—if only for a fleeting moment. With a huge, malformed human head gaping in the act of screaming, their sickly hook-ended limbs hang limply below the neck. When an anguish siktempora bites foes with their jaws, they continue screaming, adding sonic damage to the already crushing punishment their numerous grinding teeth inflict. **[Recall Knowledge - Time](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44), [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44)): DC 36 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 34 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 31 [Anguish Siktempora](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3743) **Source** [Pathfinder #204: Stage Fright](/Sources.aspx?ID=245) pg. 89 **Perception** +26; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13); (can't speak any language); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=79) 300 feet **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +24, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +27, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +24, [Dimension of Time Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +26, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +24 **Str** +8 **Dex** +5 **Con** +5 **Int** +5 **Wis** +7 **Cha** +5 **Temporal Sense** A siktempora can always roll [Dimension of Time Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) for initiative. When it does, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to the roll. --- **AC** 34 **Fort** +24 **Ref** +22 **Will** +26 **HP** 180 , regeneration 40 (deactivated by [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647), [orichalcum](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2859), or [spirit](/Traits.aspx?ID=737)) **Immunities** [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=590), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669) **Foster Fear** Creatures with the frightened condition are always off-guard to the anguish siktempora.
**Uncanny Pounce** **Trigger** The anguish siktempora rolls [Dimension of Time Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) for initiative; **Effect** The siktempora Strides once and makes a jaws Strike, in either order. --- **Speed** 10 feet, fly 40 feet **Melee** jaws +27, **Damage** 3d6+14 bludgeoning plus 2d6 sonic **Melee** claw +27 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)), **Damage** 3d8+14 slashing **Occult Innate Spells** DC 33 - **4th** [Translocate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1724) (at will) - **7th** [Flicker](/Spells.aspx?ID=1532) - **Constant (7th)** [Fly](/Spells.aspx?ID=125) **[Rend](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=73)** claw **Scream of Despair** ([Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [Sonic](/Traits.aspx?ID=147)) The anguish siktempora emits a terrible scream in a 30-foot emanation. Creatures in the area must attempt a DC 33 Will save. The anguish siktempora can't use Scream of Despair for 1d4 rounds. **Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature takes 2d6 mental damage, 2d6 sonic damage, and is [frightened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=76).
**Failure** The creature takes 6d6 mental damage, 6d6 sonic damage, and is frightened 2.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but frightened 3 and the creature gains weakness to [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647) 15 (this weakness applies to this Scream of Despair). **Wracking Despair** ([Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The anguish siktempora projects their crippling despair into the mind of a frightened creature they can see within range of their telepathy. The frightened creature takes 6d6 mental damage (DC 30 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Will save).
Soaked In Screams The anguish siktempora, sometimes called a living scream, forms from similar emotions that generate misery siktemporas. Where disasters and devastation occur, so too do both of these creatures manifest— often compounding the ambient pain and bloating the siktemporas accordingly. Occasionally, misery and anguish siktempora fight each other over territory in such moments, literally pulling their rivals limb from limb in an unquenchable need to feed adjacent hungers.
name: Anguish Siktempora

Gambling devils, known also as agadazes, resemble horned humans crafted out of living gold in their natural forms, though their shapeshifting abilities let them move among mortals undetected. They're most commonly encountered in Erebus, the third layer of [Hell](/Planes.aspx?ID=42), where many serve [Mammon](/Deities.aspx?ID=399) as accountants. They're unusually impulsive and distractible for their kind. Other devils often view their Risk Aura as a hindrance, so they usually receive less important missions. They don't mind, for it gives them more time to meddle with mortals. **[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 21 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 19 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 16 [Agadaz](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3744) **Source** [Pathfinder #205: Singer, Stalker, Skinsaw Man](/Sources.aspx?ID=246) pg. 86 **Perception** +10; [greater darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Diabolic](/Languages.aspx?ID=117), [Empyrean](/Languages.aspx?ID=115); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=79) 100 feet **Skills** [Accounting Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +11, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +12, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) +11, [Games Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +13, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +10, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=50) +11 **Str** +3 **Dex** +4 **Con** +4 **Int** +3 **Wis** +2 **Cha** +4 **Items** 20 gp --- **AC** 20 **Fort** +12 **Ref** +14 **Will** +10 **HP** 50 **Immunities** [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) **Resistances** physical 5 (except [silver](/Equipment.aspx?ID=379)), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669) 5 **Weaknesses** [holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517) 5 **Risk Aura** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=579), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647), [misfortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=654)) 30 feet. A feeling of recklessness surrounds a gambling devil. When a non-fiend creature enters the aura or begins its turn in the aura, it must attempt a DC 21 Will save.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Risk Aura for 24 hours.
**Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Failure** The next time the creature rolls a d20, it must roll twice. If either roll is a natural 20, the creature uses that result; otherwise, it must take the lower of the two results.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but applies to all of the creature's d20 rolls as long as it remains in the aura. --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** fist +12 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)), **Damage** 2d4+7 bludgeoning **Ranged** thrown coin +12 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)), **Damage** 2d4+5 bludgeoning plus 1d6 precision **Divine Innate Spells** DC 18 - **Cantrips (2nd)** [Figment](/Spells.aspx?ID=1528) - **1st** [Ill Omen](/Spells.aspx?ID=696) (at will) - **2nd** [Illusory Creature](/Spells.aspx?ID=158), [Illusory Object](/Spells.aspx?ID=160) **Rituals** - **1st** [Diabolic Pact](/Rituals.aspx?ID=143) **[Change Shape](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=55)** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127)) The agadaz adopts the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes, but it might change the type of damage their Strikes deal. **Double Down** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Fortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=76)) **Trigger** The agadaz attempts a Strike, saving throw, or skill check; **Effect** The agadaz takes a –2 status penalty to the roll, then gains a +2 status bonus to the next Strike, saving throw, or skill check they attempt before the end of their turn, or before the end of their next turn if they used Double Down during another creature's turn. **Produce Gold Coins** **Frequency** once per round; **Requirements** The agadaz has a free hand; **Effect** The agadaz creates up to 5 gp in their hand. At any one time, an agadaz can possess no more than 20 gp created in this way; coins created in excess of this value vanish. A coin created in this way vanishes automatically 1 hour after leaving the devil's possession.
Heavy Footsteps Even when appearing in a humanoid guise, a gambling devil's body remains extremely dense and heavy, often weighing more than 500 pounds. Old gamblers' yarns warn to watch the footsteps of fellow gamblers and be wary of those whose tread seems disproportionate to their size, though in truth, all but the most careless gambling devils know how to step lightly in their humanoid forms.
name: Agadaz

Masque mannequins are a type of soulbound construct animated by a fragment of a once-living soul infused into an eerie, nearly featureless mask that's then affixed to a mannequin or dressmaker's dummy. Though similar in process to the creation of a soulbound doll or mannequin, creating a masque mannequin requires conducting ritualistic murder and extracting a soul shard during an unwilling victim's death, and only the vilest of crafters would consider attempting such a deed. Masque mannequins are popular among [Norgorberites](/Deities.aspx?ID=289), especially devotees of Father Skinsaw, as well as [Kuthites](/Deities.aspx?ID=296) who take pride in drawing out the ritual to gain the largest possible fragment of the soul. **[Recall Knowledge - Construct](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35), [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=37)): DC 36 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 34 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 31 [Masque Mannequin](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3745) **Source** [Pathfinder #205: Singer, Stalker, Skinsaw Man](/Sources.aspx?ID=246) pg. 87 **Perception** +26; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** one spoken in life (typically [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=155); can't speak any language) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +29, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +29, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +29 **Str** +8 **Dex** +6 **Con** +5 **Int** -2 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +0 **Soul Mask** The spark of the soul used to create a masque mannequin is infused into its mask. A creature can break a masque mannequin's soul mask with a DC 40 [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) check or steal it with a DC 40 [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=50) check. If its mask is [broken](/Conditions.aspx?ID=60) or removed, a masque mannequin must attempt a DC 40 Fortitude save.
**Critical Success** The masque mannequin's animating spark shifts to infuse its body; it is unaffected and no longer has a soul mask.
**Success** The masque mannequin takes 2d6 [persistent mental damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29). If it regains its mask, it can place it back on its face as an Interact action to automatically stop this persistent mental damage.
**Failure** As success, but 4d6 persistent mental damage and [stunned 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=93).
**Critical Failure** As failure, but 8d6 persistent mental damage and stunned 3. --- **AC** 38 **Fort** +26 **Ref** +29 **Will** +24 **HP** 210 **Immunities** bleed, [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [doomed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=67), [drained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=68), [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=73), [healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=623), [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=661) attacks, [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), [sickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95), [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509), [void](/Traits.aspx?ID=510) **Resistances** bludgeoning 7, piercing 15, slashing 7 **Weaknesses** [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 15 **Awaken** **Requirements** The masque mannequin is in Pose; **Trigger** A creature unaware of the mannequin's true nature approaches within reach; **Effect** The mannequin makes a Strike against the triggering creature. --- **Speed** 30 feet, climb 30 feet **Melee** fist +29 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)), **Damage** 3d8+16 bludgeoning plus [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=66) **Occult Innate Spells** DC 33 - **Cantrips (7th)** [Daze](/Spells.aspx?ID=61) - **7th** [Spirit Blast](/Spells.aspx?ID=301) (×3) **Pose** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32)) Until the next time the masque mannequin acts, it appears to be an inanimate mannequin. It has an automatic result of 45 on [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) checks and DCs to appear as an ordinary mannequin. **Refashion** ([Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) **Requirements** The masque mannequin is [grappling](/Conditions.aspx?ID=77) a living creature; **Effect** The grabbed creature must attempt a DC 36 Fortitude save.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature is [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=92) for 1 round as its body grows more wooden.
**Failure** The creature is [petrified](/Conditions.aspx?ID=87) for the next 24 hours, but instead of turning to stone, it turns into a wooden mannequin. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns.
**Critical Failure** The creature turns into a wooden mannequin permanently.
Malevolent Mindsets Masque mannequins, even those crafted from virtuous individuals, tend to have a sadistic sense of malice. If left to their own devices, a masque mannequin enjoys playing cat and mouse games with their chosen victims by freezing and unfreezing in areas with mundane mannequins, slowly driving their unfortunate playthings to paranoia before going for the kill.
name: Masque Mannequin

<title level="1" pfs="">[Shanty Chanter](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3746)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Shanty chanters are known to dwell along the coasts of Garund or the eastern isles of the Shackles, living on small islands or cliffsides but rarely venturing too far inland. These capricious fey have humanoid torsos and seagull heads, wings, and feet, and they stand about 5 feet tall. Consummate performers, shanty chanters adore music, especially the sea shanties sung by ships' crews. The songs from these fey's aeries can be heard from miles away over the open sea. While some sailors claim these songs intentionally lure mortals to drown, most shanty chanters aren't outright malevolent and would be more inclined to investigate a foundering ship than to slaughter those aboard, even if they do relieve such a vessel of its valuables.

 Shanty chanters have a particular affinity for pirate ships, and a captain who wins an alliance with an aerie of shanty chanters is considered blessed with good luck. Of course, this attention can be a double-edged sword. If a captain fails to appease the ship's allied shanty chanters (generally by giving them a fair share of the plunder gained while they're on board), the affronted fey afflicts the captain with a mariner's curse before departing for more prosperous shores.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Fey](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 32

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 30

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 27
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Shanty_Chanter.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<traits>

**Perception** +20; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +20, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +22, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) +20, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +20, [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=45) +22, [Sailing Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +18

<row gap="medium">

**Con** +5

**Int** +4

**Wis** +4

**Cha** +6
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 30 

**Fort** +17 

**Ref** +22 

**Will** +20 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 175

</row>

**Weaknesses**
[cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=375) 10

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet; fly 60 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
beak +22 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)),
**Damage** 2d12+11 piercing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
talon +22 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)),
**Damage** 2d8+11 slashing

**Primal Innate Spells** DC 29
- **Cantrips (5th)**
[Electric Arc](/Spells.aspx?ID=97)
- **3rd**
[Wall of Wind](/Spells.aspx?ID=367)
- **4th**
[Charm](/Spells.aspx?ID=34), [Lightning Bolt](/Spells.aspx?ID=172), [Water Breathing](/Spells.aspx?ID=370)
- **5th**
[Mariner's Curse](/Spells.aspx?ID=184) (×2)

**Seasong**  ([Air](/Traits.aspx?ID=5), [Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) A shanty chanter aboard a vessel that uses wind propulsion can use this exploration activity to call up lightly buffeting winds. The chanter can Sustain this effect for up to 8 hours, during which the vessel they're on benefits from the propulsion in the desired direction. Seasong is overwhelmed and negated by powerful storms.

**Shanty Call** <actions string="Three Actions" /> ([Auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [Linguistic](/Traits.aspx?ID=101), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) **Frequency** once per day; **Effect** The shanty chanter begins to sing a catchy sea shanty and selects up to 10 allies within 60 feet who can hear the shanty chanter to potentially join in. Selected allies feel an urge to join but aren't required to—a targeted ally can join as a Reaction. A shanty chanter can Sustain Shanty Call as a Reaction at the start of their turn for up to 1 minute. While sustained, the shanty chanter and all allies who joined the shanty when they began to sing become quickened and can use the extra action to [Climb](/Actions.aspx?ID=2374), [Force Open](/Actions.aspx?ID=2375), [Reposition](/Actions.aspx?ID=2379), [Shove](/Actions.aspx?ID=2380), Strike, or [Swim](/Actions.aspx?ID=2381). When the shanty chanter ceases to Sustain Shanty Call, they and all allies who were affected become [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=73) for 1 minute.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Chanter Vanity</title>

Shanty chanters are quite vain, adorning themselves in jewelry obtained in the raids of their allied ships or taken in raids of their own. They appreciate flattery toward both their physical appearances and musical talents, and they view this type of bribe to be as valuable as material goods. Conversely, the surest way to gain a shanty chanter's enmity is to insult their singing, and only the deeply unwise would dare such a thing.
</aside>
name: Shanty Chanter

markdown:
The undead ooze known as a waxen effigy forms under a specific set of circumstances, making such creatures quite rare. Most waxen effigies arise from botched rituals intended to migrate a powerful sapient creature's soul into a body made of wax, whether in a bid for immortality or a method of imprisonment or sacrifice. The death—especially a traumatic death—of a sapient creature in close proximity to a wax figure or while attempting to craft a construct out of wax might also result in a waxen effigy. A waxen effigy looks like a partially melted wax version of who it appeared as in life. They retain little of their former personality but recall a jumble of memories from their mortal existence that serves only to anger them. They often cling to objects that were important to them in life, such as a spouse's wedding band or a tool from a favorite hobby. Displaying such an object to a waxen effigy transfixes their attention, though they often lash out if the object is taken away before they can be laid to rest. **[Recall Knowledge - Ooze](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44)): DC 43 **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 43 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 41 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 38 [Waxen Effigy](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3747) **Source** [Pathfinder #205: Singer, Stalker, Skinsaw Man](/Sources.aspx?ID=246) pg. 89 **Perception** +29; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20); one language known in life (can't speak any language) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +35, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +32 **Str** +9 **Dex** +4 **Con** +7 **Int** -1 **Wis** +5 **Cha** +0 --- **AC** 38 **Fort** +31 **Ref** +24 **Will** +27 **HP** 415 ([void healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=83)) **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), precision, [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95) **Weaknesses** [cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=555) 15 **Memento Vulnerability** Waxen effigies retain an attachment to objects they had a strong tie to in life. A character who holds such a memento in a hand can use it to alter the effects of [Demoralize](/Actions.aspx?ID=2395). Doing so adds the [manipulate](/Actions.aspx?ID=2229) trait to Demoralize. If the attempt to Demoralize the waxen effigy is successful, it becomes [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=92) (slowed 2 on a critical success) for 1 round rather than becoming [frightened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=76). On a critical failure, the waxen effigy loses Memento Vulnerability for 24 hours.
**Wax Trail** A waxen effigy leaves behind a trail of molten wax when it Strides, making any spaces it moves through difficult hazardous terrain until the beginning of its next turn, whereupon the molten wax trail vanishes. Creatures moving through the wax trail take 4d6 fire damage each time they do so (DC 40 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). --- **Speed** 20 feet, climb 20 feet **Melee** fist +35 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 3d10+17 bludgeoning plus 2d6 [persistent fire](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) **Ranged** wax spray +30 ([Fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 3d8+8 bludgeoning plus 2d6 [persistent fire](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) **Enervating Howl** ([Auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16)) The waxen effigy emits a gurgling howl, sapping the life energy from all living creatures within 30 feet. Affected creatures must attempt a DC 40 Fortitude save. The waxen effigy can't use Enervating Howl again for 1d4 rounds
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature takes 6d6 void damage and is [drained 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=68).
**Failure** The creature takes 12d6 void damage and is drained 2.
**Critical Failure** The creature takes 24d6 void damage, is drained 2, and is [doomed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=67) for as long as they have the drained condition.
Cruel Creations Few set out to create a waxen effigy on purpose, as their fragmented memories cause them to behave rather erratically, and as such, they make poor guardians or assassins. Any intentional creation of a waxen effigy is solely an act of spite since it condemns the soul to an undeath steeped in bewilderment and fear.
name: Waxen Effigy

markdown:
When a powerful worshipper catches Norgorber's eye, he sometimes transforms that worshipper into one of his masks—supernatural incarnations who become powerful proxies to their god but sacrifice their free will. **[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 40 **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 40 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 38 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 35 [Mask of Norgorber](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3748) **Source** [Pathfinder #206: Bring the House Down](/Sources.aspx?ID=247) pg. 84 **Perception** +32; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [_truesight_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1727) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1); [_truespeech_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1728) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +31, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +28, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=37) +29, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +30, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) +30, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +30, [Norgorber Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +31, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46) +28, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47) +27, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +33, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=50) +31 **Str** +6 **Dex** +9 **Con** +5 **Int** +5 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +6 **Items** _+2 [greater striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2829) [shortsword](/Weapons.aspx?ID=398)_, _[true faith tattoo](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2207)_, _+2 [resilient](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2786) [leather armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=41)_ --- **AC** 39 **Fort** +25 **Ref** +33 **Will** +28 **HP** 290 **Secretive Tattoos** The mask keeps their _faith tattoo_ hidden (typically by wearing gloves to cover the palm). To use it as a divine focus, they must first Interact to uncover the tattoo. The tattoo then stays uncovered until the mask Interacts to cover it up. A mask's _faith tattoo_ only allows for the casting of [_harm_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1552). Upon the mask's death, the tattoo disappears.
**[Reactive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=48)** --- **Speed** 30 feet **Melee** _shortsword_ +33 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [versatile P](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 3d6+14 slashing plus 1d6 persistent damage (see Aspect's Agony) **Divine Innate Spells** DC 37, attack +29 - **Cantrips (8th)** [Daze](/Spells.aspx?ID=61), [Detect Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=66), [Message](/Spells.aspx?ID=190) - **4th** [Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=164) (×3), [Silence](/Spells.aspx?ID=287) (×3) - **6th** [Sending](/Spells.aspx?ID=272) (×3), [Spellwrack](/Spells.aspx?ID=298) - **7th** [Cleanse Affliction](/Spells.aspx?ID=1467), [Divine Decree](/Spells.aspx?ID=82) - **8th** [Heal](/Spells.aspx?ID=148) (×3), [Shadow Blast](/Spells.aspx?ID=273) - **Constant (8th)** [Truesight](/Spells.aspx?ID=1727), [Truespeech](/Spells.aspx?ID=1728) **Aspect's Agony** When a mask of Norgorber Strikes a foe with a weapon, they inflict an additional 1d6 persistent damage of a type determined by their aspect. As long as a creature is taking this persistent damage, they're [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58). **Sneak Attack** A mask of Norgorber deals 2d6 extra precision damage to creatures who are [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58).
Aspect Of Blackfingers These masks focus on the use of poisons to spread Norgorber's will. Blackfingers Aspect **Aspect's Agony** 1d6 persistent poison
**Additional Divine Innate Spells** **8th** [_toxic cloud_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1722); **7th** [slither](/Feats.aspx?ID=2382)
**Evaporate Poison** ([divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=579), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669)) **Frequency** once per day; **Effect** The mask blows out a breath and targets a creature within 30 feet that is currently poisoned or is taking [persistent poison damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29). The target must attempt a DC 37 Fortitude save as the mask attempts to transmute the poison afflicting them into toxic vapor.
**Critical Success** The poison effect on the target immediately ends.
**Success** The poison effect on the target immediately ends, but toxic vapor fills one of the target's adjacent squares, chosen by the mask. A creature in this square is exposed to [brimstone fumes](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3327); the toxic vapor then vanishes.
**Failure** As success, but the toxic vapor fills a 5-foot emanation around the target, exposing all creatures in the area (including the target) to brimstone fumes; the toxic vapor then vanishes.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but the toxic vapor fills a 10-foot emanation around the target, and the poison effect or persistent poison damage the target is suffering does not end. Aspect Of Father Skinsaw These masks are murderers who revel in the ripping of an opponent's flesh. Father Skinsaw Aspect **Aspect's Agony** 1d6 persistent bleed
**Additional Divine Innate Spells** **8th** [_blood vendetta_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1454); **7th** [_mask of terror_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1595)
**Invigorating Flense** ([divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=579)) **Frequency** once per day; **Effect** The mask makes a quick striking motion, as if slicing flesh with a small knife, and targets a creature within 30 feet. The target immediately takes 12d6 slashing and 5d6 [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) (DC 37 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save), and the mask becomes quickened as long as the target continues to take persistent bleed damage. The mask can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike. Aspect Of The Gray Master These masks focus on theft in all of its forms. Gray Master Aspect **Aspect's Agony** 1d6 persistent void
**Additional Divine Innate Spells** **8th** [_quandary_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1644); **7th** [_umbral graft_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1023)
**Steal Life** ([death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=579), [void](/Traits.aspx?ID=510)) **Frequency** once per day; **Effect** The mask makes a quick plucking gesture as they attempt to steal a creature's life. The mask targets a living creature within 30 feet, inflicting 17d6 void damage (DC 37 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save). The mask gains temporary Hit Points equal to half the void damage the target takes (after applying resistances and the like), and loses any remaining temporary Hit Points after 24 hours. Aspect Of The Reaper These masks fracture trust and turn allies against each other. Reaper Of Reputation Aspect **Aspect's Agony** 1d6 persistent mental
**Additional Divine Innate Spells** **8th** [_suggestion_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1693); **7th** [_warp mind_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1754)
**Insidious Secrets** ([auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=541), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=579), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=590), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=598), [linguistic](/Traits.aspx?ID=642), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647)) **Frequency** once per day; **Effect** The mask whispers, then targets a creature within 30 feet. The target must then attempt a DC 37 Will save.
**Critical Success** The target fails to hear the secret whispered and is unaffected.
**Success** The mask whispers a horrific secret to the target, and though their mind recoils and forgets, the target still takes 8d6 mental damage and is [frightened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=76).
**Failure** As failure, but 17d6 mental damage and frightened 2; the target is [confused](/Conditions.aspx?ID=63) as long as they are frightened.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but 30d6 mental damage and the target is confused for 1 minute.
Masks and the Afterlife When a worshipper becomes a mask, they technically die and travel to the [Boneyard](/Planes.aspx?ID=39) to be judged by [Pharasma](/Deities.aspx?ID=290), but in this case, the process is almost instantaneous. When [Norgorber](/Deities.aspx?ID=289) chooses someone to become a mask, a swift and nearly instantaneous blurring of the creature is the only indication of their change. Like most fiends, masks are immortal unless slain through violence or misadventure. Once slain, a mask's body decays as normal, and after a variable amount of time has passed, their soul returns to the Great Beyond to accrete its quintessence into Norgorber's realm of Duskfathom.
Other Ancestries Most of the masks of Norgorber are [human](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=6), but not all. A mask's statistics don't change if it's a Small creature, and they gain [increased space and reach if they're Large or larger](/Rules.aspx?ID=2359). Change ancestry traits as needed, but Speed and languages are unchanged. All masks of Norgorber possess [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) granted them by their deity. Whether or not you grant a mask additional ancestry-based abilities is left to you to decide.
name: Mask of Norgorber

Souls of beasts and animals that return as palinthanos manifest as ghostly, bestial undead of pure hunger and instinct. They appear as somewhat indistinct monstrous creatures, regardless of what they were in life. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 41 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 39 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 36 [Egarhowl](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3749) **Source** [Pathfinder #206: Bring the House Down](/Sources.aspx?ID=247) pg. 86 **Perception** +31; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=74) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 30 feet **Languages** **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +32 **Str** -5 **Dex** +7 **Con** +0 **Int** -4 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +0 --- **AC** 38 **Fort** +25 **Ref** +32 **Will** +29 **HP** 235 ([void healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=83)) **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), precision, [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95) **Resistances** all damage 15 (except [force](/Traits.aspx?ID=610), [ghost touch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2840), or [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509); double resistance vs. non-[magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=644)) **Reaction Reversal** Since an egarhowl appears to move backwards in time and the results of its actions manifest slightly out of sync, its [manipulate](/Actions.aspx?ID=2229) or [move](/Traits.aspx?ID=658) actions and Strikes don't trigger reactions normally. Whenever a reaction would be triggered by an egarhowl in this way, the reacting creature must attempt a DC 11 flat check. On a failure, their reaction does not trigger.
**Predestined Defeat** ([occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=662)) **Trigger** The egarhowl rolls initiative; **Frequency** once per day; **Effect** At the start of combat, an inverted, reversed explosion of spiritual and void energy implodes in a 30-foot emanation centered on the egarhowl—a reversal of the creature's spiritually explosive death. All creatures in the area take 6d8 spirit damage (DC 35 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save); creatures that fail this save are also [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=92) for 1 round as time seems to distort around them. --- **Speed** fly 30 feet **Melee** jaws +32 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 3d12+8 piercing plus 3d6 spirit and rabid rage **Melee** claw +32 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 3d8+8 slashing plus 3d6 spirit **Rabid Rage** ([Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) An egarhowl's bite transmits its supernatural fury. A creature bitten by an egarhowl must attempt a DC 36 Will save. They then become temporarily immune to rabid rage for 24 hours.
**Critical Success** The creature suffers no ill effects.
**Success** The creature is filled with anger and becomes [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=92) for 1 round as they waste some of their time shrieking and raving on their turn.
**Failure** As success, but slowed 1 for 1 minute.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but the creature is also [confused](/Conditions.aspx?ID=63) for as long as it is slowed.
name: Egarhowl

Palinthanos formed from intelligent creatures tend to be scheming and envious opportunists who seek to possess mortal bodies. They appear as vortexes of twisted, misty faces from which ghostly limbs emerge, regardless of their appearance in life. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 43 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 41 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 38 [Echosyvne](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3750) **Source** [Pathfinder #206: Bring the House Down](/Sources.aspx?ID=247) pg. 87 **Perception** +31; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +35, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +32 **Str** -5 **Dex** +9 **Con** +0 **Int** +6 **Wis** +5 **Cha** +6 --- **AC** 39 **Fort** +24 **Ref** +33 **Will** +31 **HP** 255 ([void healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=83)) **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), precision, [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95) **Resistances** all damage 15 (except [force](/Traits.aspx?ID=610), [ghost touch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2840), or [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509); double resistance vs. non-[magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=644)) **Reaction Reversal** Since an egarhowl appears to move backwards in time and the results of its actions manifest slightly out of sync, its [manipulate](/Actions.aspx?ID=2229) or [move](/Traits.aspx?ID=658) actions and Strikes don't trigger reactions normally. Whenever a reaction would be triggered by an egarhowl in this way, the reacting creature must attempt a DC 11 flat check. On a failure, their reaction does not trigger.
**Predestined Defeat** ([occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=662)) **Trigger** The egarhowl rolls initiative; **Frequency** once per day; **Effect** At the start of combat, an inverted, reversed explosion of spiritual and void energy implodes in a 30-foot emanation centered on the egarhowl—a reversal of the creature's spiritually explosive death. All creatures in the area take 15d8 spirit damage (DC 37 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save); creatures that fail this save are also [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=92) for 1 round as time seems to distort around them. --- **Speed** fly 30 feet **Melee** claw +33 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 3d6+8 slashing plus 3d6 spirit **Occult Innate Spells** DC 40 - **9th** [Possession](/Spells.aspx?ID=225) (×3) **Distort Perception** ([Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The echopsyvne targets a creature it can see within 30 feet and alters its perception of time. The target must attempt a DC 40 Will save. Regardless of success or failure, the creature then becomes temporarily immune to this ability for 24 hours.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature perceives time to flow backward briefly and becomes [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=92) for 1 round.
**Failure** Time flows backward for the creature, leaving them unable to interact with the world around them. The creature is [stunned 3](/Conditions.aspx?ID=93), after which it is slowed 1 for 1 round.
**Critical Failure** The creature's mind becomes stuck in a time loop, and it becomes [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85) by the disorienting sight for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, it can attempt a new Will save to reduce the remaining duration by 1 round or end it entirely on a critical success. **Temporal Possession** When the echopsyvne casts [_possession_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1638) on a creature, that creature experiences time backward. When the echopsyvne controls the target, they function normally, but when the target takes their own actions while the echopsyvne is in partial control or riding along in their body, they become [clumsy 3](/Conditions.aspx?ID=61) and take a –10-foot status penalty to all of their Speeds. When the echopsyvne stops possessing the target, willingly or otherwise, the target must succeed at a DC 37 Will save or be [stunned 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=93) as they readjust to a more familiar flow of time.
Backward Speakers When a palinthanos vocalizes, the sounds it creates are reversed. For the egarhowl, this only results in unnerving backwards sounds of angry roars and bestial noises, but for those who can speak, it makes understanding them difficult. A palinthanos has no difficulty understanding any language it can speak, but when it speaks, listeners must succeed at a DC 30 Perception check made as a free action with the [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561) trait each round to quickly decipher the reversed conversation. This prevents a palinthanos from being able to easily utilize [linguistic](/Traits.aspx?ID=642) actions.
name: Echosyvne
resistance_markdown: all damage 15 (except [force](/Traits.aspx?ID=610), [ghost touch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2840), or [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509); double resistance vs. non-[magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=644))

markdown:
Before he became a deity, [Norgorber](/Deities.aspx?ID=289) gained Venomfist's eternal service by giving the disgraced [faydhaan shuyookh](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2662) poisons to exact revenge upon those who stripped the genie of their status. The vengeance transformed Venomfist into what they are now, an outcome Norgorber cautioned of, yet one Venomfist doesn't regret. Today in Duskfathom, Venomfist resides in the Sky Sea as the perfect defender of the unnamed islands. When summoned to other planes, only a part of them leaves while their main body remains behind. Venomfist's vivid green body is a testament to all the deals for poisons made with mortals and immortals alike over millennia. **[Recall Knowledge - Elemental](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35), [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 54 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 52 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 49 [Venomfist](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3751) **Source** [Pathfinder #206: Bring the House Down](/Sources.aspx?ID=247) pg. 88 **Perception** +40; [greater darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [wavesense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=84) ([precise](/Rules.aspx?ID=411)) 120 feet **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Muan](/Languages.aspx?ID=108), [Petran](/Languages.aspx?ID=109), [Pyric](/Languages.aspx?ID=110), [Sussuran](/Languages.aspx?ID=111), [Talican](/Languages.aspx?ID=112), [Thalassic](/Languages.aspx?ID=113); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=79) 100 feet, [_truespeech_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1728) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +43, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=37) +39, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) +36, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +38, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +38, [Norgorber Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +41, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46) +40, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +38 **Str** +11 **Dex** +8 **Con** +10 **Int** +9 **Wis** +8 **Cha** +6 --- **AC** 48 **Fort** +42 **Ref** +34 **Will** +36 **HP** 430 **Immunities** bleed, [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), [sleep](/Traits.aspx?ID=696) **Resistances** [acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=524) 20, bludgeoning 20, [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 20 **Toxic Downpour** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676)) Venomfist's presence alters the weather within 2 miles to heavy rainfall as long as they're located in a sizable body of water. When they become hostile, the rain in a 120-foot emanation from them becomes highly toxic and deals 8d8 poison damage (DC 42 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude half) to all creatures in the area.
**Vortex** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [water](/Traits.aspx?ID=732)) 120 feet. Water in the area that is in the same body of water as Venomfist is [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) for [Swimming](/Actions.aspx?ID=2381) creatures that don't have the [water](/Traits.aspx?ID=732) trait. --- **Speed** 40 feet, swim 120 feet **Melee** fist +42 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 4d6+21 bludgeoning plus 4d6 poison and [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=66) **Divine Innate Spells** DC 45 - **Cantrips (9th)** [Caustic Blast](/Spells.aspx?ID=1461) - **8th** [Hydraulic Push](/Spells.aspx?ID=154) (at will) - **9th** [Toxic Cloud](/Spells.aspx?ID=1722), [Wrathful Storm](/Spells.aspx?ID=1759) - **10th** [Cataclysm](/Spells.aspx?ID=32) - **Constant (10th)** [Truesight](/Spells.aspx?ID=1727), [Truespeech](/Spells.aspx?ID=1728) **[Constrict](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=57)** 4d6 bludgeoning and 4d6 poison, DC 45 **Create Poison** **Frequency** once per day; **Effect** Venomfist transforms a portion of their watery body into a single dose of any type of common [poison](/Equipment.aspx?Category=6&Subcategory=9) of 20th level or lower—[tears of death](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3348) is their favorite. If they're holding a container, they can create the poison within that container, at which point the poison remains viable for 24 hours before it reverts to water. Alternatively, they can apply a [contact](/Traits.aspx?ID=565) or [injury](/Traits.aspx?ID=635)-created poison to their fist. **Surge** Venomfist expands their space to fill the area of their vortex. Creatures within the aura take 6d12+6 bludgeoning damage and 6d12+6 poison damage with a DC 45 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save. A creature that fails this save is [pushed](/Rules.aspx?ID=451) 40 feet. Venomfist then retracts to their former space and cannot use Surge again for 1d4 rounds.
Spared From Death Venomfist was instrumental in helping Norgorber cross the chasm outside the Starstone Cathedral. In an ironic turn of events, Venomfist warned that the proposed plan could kill the then-very-mortal Norgorber. The man's response? “I don't care.” Even today, Venomfist doesn't know what desperation drove Norgorber to seek out the Starstone. As they never pried into Norgorber's past, motivations, or business, the god never felt the need to kill Venomfist after his ascension.
name: Venomfist

The zimiezeks, also known as those-that-weave-secrets, are one of many creatures native to Duskfathom. They resemble large spiders with humanoid hands instead of spidery feet and possess vaguely humanoid heads with multiple eyes and spider fangs for jaws. Their faces are often shrouded by a veil, mask, or webbing to both hide their identity and as a gesture of peace, for a zimiezek's bite can turn other humanoids into them. Unlike the [karumzeks](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=290), [Norgorber's](/Deities.aspx?ID=289) more common divine servitors, zimiezeks almost never leave Duskfathom. Most are average citizens who revere Norgorber as both deity and prince. Only a few serve the god of secrets directly as the city's security and elite strike force. **[Recall Knowledge - Aberration](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44)): DC 43 **[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 43 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 41 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 38 [Zimiezek](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3752) **Source** [Pathfinder #206: Bring the House Down](/Sources.aspx?ID=247) pg. 89 **Perception** +33; [greater darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Chthonian](/Languages.aspx?ID=114), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Daemonic](/Languages.aspx?ID=31), [Diabolic](/Languages.aspx?ID=117), [Utopian](/Languages.aspx?ID=36) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +35, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +32, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +34, [Duskfathom Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +31, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +35, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47) +31, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +33 **Str** +6 **Dex** +7 **Con** +6 **Int** +5 **Wis** +9 **Cha** +6 **Items** _+2 [greater striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2829) [astral](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2832) [corrosive](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2834) [shortsword](/Weapons.aspx?ID=398)_ --- **AC** 41 **Fort** +28 **Ref** +31 **Will** +33 **HP** 335 **Immunities** [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669) **Darting Legs** **Trigger** The zimiezek is targeted with an attack; **Effect** The Zimiezek gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
**[Reactive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=48)** The zimiezek gains two extra reactions on their turn that they can only use to make Reactive Strikes. --- **Speed** 40 feet, climb 40 feet **Melee** _shortsword_ +35 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 3d6+14 slashing plus 1d6 astral and 1d6 acid **Melee** bite +33 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 3d10+14 piercing plus 3d6 poison and zimiezek infection **Ranged** web +33 ([range 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** web restraints **Occult Innate Spells** DC 37, attack +29 - **Cantrips (9th)** [Telekinetic Hand](/Spells.aspx?ID=1715), [Telekinetic Projectile](/Spells.aspx?ID=334) - **4th** [Translocate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1724) (at will) - **5th** [Translocate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1724) - **9th** [Web](/Spells.aspx?ID=374) (×3) **Web Restraints** A creature hit by the zimiezek's web Strike is [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=90) either to a surface or tethered to the zimiezek until it [Escapes](/Actions.aspx?ID=2296) (DC 40). The zimiezek gains a +2 circumstance bonus to [Trip](/Actions.aspx?ID=2382) a tethered target and can Interact with the tether to [pull](/Rules.aspx?ID=451) a target 15 feet toward them. **Zimiezek Infection** ([Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [Virulent](/Traits.aspx?ID=162)) [Anadis](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=42) are immune; **Saving Throw** DC 37; **Stage 1** [clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=61) (1 day); **Stage 2** clumsy 2 (eight spider legs start to grow out of your back; 1 day); **Stage 3** clumsy 2, [drained 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=68) (venomous fangs grow from your mouth, 1 day); **Stage 4** clumsy 2, drained 1, [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=92) (sticky webbing exudes from your flesh, 1 day); **Stage 5** [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95) (you become cocooned in webbing, during which you have no need for food and water, 1 week); **Stage 6** death (and a brand new zimiezek emerges from your cocooned body)
Uncertain Origins The zimiezeks believe the first of them arose from souls who were once Norgorber's allies in life who stumbled upon the god's greatest secret and were slain to conceal his identity. Some doubt this claim, given Norgorber's anathema on showing mercy. Nevertheless, a connection exists between Norgorber and both zimiezeks and karumzeks that lets the god automatically know the creatures' names and identities.
name: Zimiezek

This massive bovine looks like a larger, wilder version of the domesticated cattle found throughout the Inner Sea region. During winter, vast herds of the animals roam the southern reaches of the Realm of the Mammoth Lords, but as the ice high in the mountains begins to melt, the aurochs migrate south into Belkzen, following their ancestral route along the Flood Road. Once the water flows in earnest and turns to massive floods, the sudden surge of greenery provides the aurochs with all the food they need to survive. Aurochs are essential to life in Belkzen. Not only do the orcs there hunt the wild cattle for their meat, but they use every part of the aurochs, from hide to bones, to craft their weapons and tools. The aurochs' arrival prompts the beginning of the Flood Truce, during which the usually war-focused orc holds cease all hostilities to take advantage of this time of plenty. While groups of 20 or fewer animals are sometimes encountered, most aurochs travel in herds that stretch to the horizon. The land thunders under the weight of these herds, and the dust kicked up by their hooves is often spotted days before the aurochs—or the floodwaters that spurred their migration—arrive. Aurochs bulls stand between 6 and 7 feet tall at the shoulder and weigh around 2,500 pounds, although prodigious specimens can grow to over 7 feet tall and 3,000 pounds. Cows are smaller, standing near 6 feet at the shoulder and weighing up to 2,000 pounds. All aurochs have slightly curved horns that grow up to three feet long from base to spearsharp tip. The aurochs is represented in much of Belkzen's artwork. Not only are the animals vital to survival in that unforgiving land, but their strength, power, and tenacity serve as potent symbols for orc holds. **[Recall Knowledge - Animal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 18 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 16 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 13 [Aurochs](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3753) **Source** [Pathfinder #207: Resurrection Flood](/Sources.aspx?ID=249) pg. 82 **Perception** +9; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69), [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=74) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 30 feet **Languages** **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +11, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +9 **Str** +4 **Dex** +3 **Con** +4 **Int** -4 **Wis** +1 **Cha** -1 --- **AC** 18 **Fort** +12 **Ref** +9 **Will** +6 **HP** 42 **Easily Spooked** The aurochs gains a +5-foot-status bonus to Speed while [frightened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=76).
**Safety in Numbers** Aurochs move together to keep safe from predators. While within 10 feet of another aurochs, the aurochs gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC. --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** hoof +10, **Damage** 1d8+6 bludgeoning **Melee** horn +10, **Damage** 1d8+6 piercing plus [Knockdown](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=46) **[Trample](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=81)** Medium or smaller, hoof, DC 19 **Wild Charge** The aurochs Strides twice and makes a single horn Strike against any foe along its path.
Aurochs Rolling Farmers throughout the Inner Sea often joke about cow tipping: sneaking up on an unsuspecting bovine and pushing it over while it sleeps. But since cattle sleep lying down, the animal usually has the last laugh. Nonetheless, some younger orcs in Belkzen spend evenings creeping up on sleeping aurochs to roll them over. This usually results in little more than a startled aurochs.
name: Aurochs

markdown:
The wild animals that have adapted to the harsh environs of Belkzen are either fierce enough to scare off predators, tough enough to survive attacks, or smart enough to avoid trouble. Bristle boars are all three. Many orcs admire the bristle boar, viewing them as living symbols of the toughness Belkzen demands from its inhabitants. With their spiny manes, sharp tusks, keen noses, and irascible nature, the creatures are both intimidating and dangerous. Hunters throughout the Inner Sea region know that taking down a wild boar can prove deadly for the unprepared. Bristle boars—the name given to both male and female specimen—are even more challenging to kill. Further, their meat is sinewy, so few hunters even bother with the animals. For those who fell the beasts, the boars' spined hides often serve as trophies of the hunter's skill. Bristle boars are not as reliant on the Deluge as other animals in Belkzen. Though they're certainly found in the green areas that spring up during the annual flooding, sounders of bristle boars can survive even in desolate areas like the Dirt Sea, grubbing for sustenance where few others can. The Cleft Head Hold maintains a small herd of tamed bristle boars. The orcs have learned that, with the right trainer, the clever animals make excellent companions. Aside from their utility in battle, the boars are often used to sniff out the rare yellow truffles that grow throughout the hold. A typical bristle boar stands 4 feet tall and weighs roughly 200 pounds. **[Recall Knowledge - Animal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 18 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 16 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 13 [Bristle Boar](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3754) **Source** [Pathfinder #207: Resurrection Flood](/Sources.aspx?ID=249) pg. 83 **Perception** +9; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69), [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=74) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 30 feet **Languages** **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +10, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +8 **Str** +4 **Dex** +3 **Con** +4 **Int** -4 **Wis** +2 **Cha** -2 --- **AC** 19 **Fort** +12 **Ref** +6 **Will** +9 **HP** 45 **Bristle Spines** When an adjacent creature hits the bristle boar with a melee attack, that creature takes 1d6 piercing damage unless it succeeds at a DC 17 Reflex save.
**[Ferocity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=63)** --- **Speed** 40 feet **Melee** tusk +11, **Damage** 2d6+6 piercing **Melee** spine +11 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)), **Damage** 1d8+6 piercing **Boar Charge** The bristle boar Strides twice and then makes a tusk Strike. As long as it moved at least 20 feet, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its attack roll. **Dustup** ([Earth](/Traits.aspx?ID=55), [Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) **Requirements** The bristle boar is standing in an area with soil, dust, sand, or similar debris; **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The bristle boar spins and kicks up dirt, knocking it into foes' faces. Each adjacent creature must attempt a DC 17 Fortitude save.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected and immune to the bristle boar's Dustup for 24 hours.
**Success** The creature unaffected.
**Failure** The creature [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=65) for 1 round.
**Critical Failure** The creature is [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91) and dazzled for 1 round.
Stuck Treasure Although they don't seek out shiny objects like some animals, bristle boars who evade hunters often escape with weapons embedded in their thick hides. The Empty Hand orcs tell of a famous bristle boar dubbed “Silverspear” after the silvery spear stuck in its hide. Stories claim the boar's spear is imbued with powerful magic, and while many warriors have hunted Silverspear to claim its weapon, so far none have succeeded.
name: Bristle Boar

Fueled by bloodlust in battle, orc rampagers are fearsome combatants. They often serve as the elite shock troops of an orc hold. They train to move quickly through enemy ranks, striking all around them to disrupt their foe's defenses. The speed and fury of a group of orc rampagers working together is terrifying to behold. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 19 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 14 [Orc Rampager](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3757) **Source** [Pathfinder #207: Resurrection Flood](/Sources.aspx?ID=249) pg. 86 **Perception** +12; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Orcish](/Languages.aspx?ID=9) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +12, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +11, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +10 **Str** +5 **Dex** +2 **Con** +4 **Int** +1 **Wis** +2 **Cha** +2 **Items** [Hide Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=7), [Longbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=76) (20 arrows), [Orc Necksplitter](/Weapons.aspx?ID=64) --- **AC** 19 **Fort** +14 **Ref** +11 **Will** +8 **HP** 75 **[Ferocity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=63)**
**[Reactive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=48)** --- **Speed** 30 feet **Melee** orc necksplitter +14 ([Forceful](/Traits.aspx?ID=180), [Sweep](/Traits.aspx?ID=194)), **Damage** 1d8+9 slashing **Melee** fist +14 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Shove](/Traits.aspx?ID=193)), **Damage** 1d4+9 bludgeoning **Ranged** longbow +12 ([deadly d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [range increment 100 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 0](/Traits.aspx?ID=254), [volley 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=201)), **Damage** 1d8+4 piercing **Rampaging Strikes** The orc rampager Strides and makes two melee Strikes at any point during that movement. Each Strike must target a different creature. The attacks count toward the rampager's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after Rampaging Strikes is complete.

Driven by fervor bordering on zealotry, doomsayers spread the word of their destructive deities. Many are faithful followers of recently fallen gods. Though their deity has been cast down, an orc doomsayer's unwavering faith allows them to hold onto a sliver of their god's essence to power their abilities. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 20 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 18 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 15 [Orc Doomsayer](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3758) **Source** [Pathfinder #207: Resurrection Flood](/Sources.aspx?ID=249) pg. 87 **Perception** +14; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Orcish](/Languages.aspx?ID=9) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +11, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +12, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +12, [Medicine](/Skills.aspx?ID=42) +12, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46) +13 **Str** +3 **Dex** +2 **Con** +4 **Int** +1 **Wis** +5 **Cha** +4 **Items** [Breastplate](/Armor.aspx?ID=10), [Flail](/Weapons.aspx?ID=19) --- **AC** 21 **Fort** +12 **Ref** +9 **Will** +15 **HP** 78 **[Ferocity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=63)** --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** flail +13 ([Disarm](/Traits.aspx?ID=175), [Sweep](/Traits.aspx?ID=194), [Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196)), **Damage** 1d6+3 piercing plus 1d8 void **Melee** fist +13 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Shove](/Traits.aspx?ID=193)), **Damage** 1d4+3 bludgeoning plus 1d8 void **Divine Prepared Spells** DC 21, attack +14 - **Cantrips (3rd)** [Daze](/Spells.aspx?ID=61), [Detect Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=66), [Guidance](/Spells.aspx?ID=142), [Shield](/Spells.aspx?ID=280), [Void Warp](/Spells.aspx?ID=1745) - **1st** [Enfeeble](/Spells.aspx?ID=1513), [Fear](/Spells.aspx?ID=110), [Heal](/Spells.aspx?ID=148) - **2nd** [Augury](/Spells.aspx?ID=15), [Heal](/Spells.aspx?ID=148), [Silence](/Spells.aspx?ID=287) - **3rd** [Chilling Darkness](/Spells.aspx?ID=36), [Harm](/Spells.aspx?ID=146) **Dooming Proclamation** ([Auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) The orc doomsayer shouts pronouncements that presage the unstoppable approach of a cataclysmic event. Each enemy within 30 feet attempts a DC 21 Will save.
**Critical Success** No effect and temporarily immune for 1 minute.
**Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Failure** The creature is [frightened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=76).
**Critical Failure** The creature's mind fills with images of the end times. The creature takes 3d6 mental damage and is frightened 2.
**Infused Strikes** The orc doomsayer's melee Strikes deal an extra 1d8 void damage.
name: Orc Doomsayer
