markdown:
A skinslough looks like a humanoid whose skin moves like an ill-fitting coat, independent of the underlying muscle and connective tissue. Nightmarish to behold, their touch spreads their terrible disease to others. Skinsloughs are often mistaken for floodslain, a type of undead also brought about by water. Unlike [floodslain](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=557), however, not all skinsloughs arise after drowning in a flood. Sailors cast overboard, lone explorers of remote lakes, and even people who tumble down abandoned wells can all become one of these foul creatures. Certainly, many skinsloughs arise from the Deluge, but their existence is far more widespread. Unlike most other intelligent undead, skinsloughs aren't exclusively cruel and merciless, though many are. They retain a flicker of memory from their past lives and often actively avoid contact with anyone. Skinsloughs who have experienced the screaming terror that's so often a reaction to their appearance, however, give in to anger and work to spread their pain to others. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 19 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 14 [Skinslough](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3759) **Source** [Pathfinder #207: Resurrection Flood](/Sources.aspx?ID=249) pg. 88 **Perception** +12; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +12 **Str** +5 **Dex** +2 **Con** +4 **Int** +2 **Wis** +2 **Cha** -4 --- **AC** 20 **Fort** +14 **Ref** +8 **Will** +11 **HP** 72 (hard to target, [void healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=83)) **Immunities** bleed, [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95) **Resistances** bludgeoning and piercing 6 **Hard to Target** With their loose, shifting skin, a skinslough's vital organs are difficult to locate. Each time a skinslough would take precision damage or extra damage from a critical hit, it attempts a DC 5 flat check. On a success, the additional damage is negated.
**Slough** **Trigger** The skinslough gains a [persistent damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) condition or becomes [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=77), [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=81), or [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=90); **Effect** The skinslough sheds part of its skin and attempts a DC 5 flat check to end the condition. --- **Speed** 25 feet, swim 20 feet **Melee** fist +13 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Disarm](/Traits.aspx?ID=175)), **Damage** 2d8+5 bludgeoning plus Sloughing Sickness **Skin Net** ([Attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15), [Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46)) The skinslough interacts to pull off part of its skin and throw it at a creature within 30 feet, making a ranged attack with a +12 modifier. If it hits, the target takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 round and must make a DC 18 Fortitude save. If the skinslough critically hits, the target gets a result one degree of success worse than the outcome of its Fortitude save.
**Critical Success** As success, and the creature automatically succeeds at saving throws against the skinslough's Skin Net for 24 hours.
**Success** The target is unaffected except for the penalty to Speed.
**Failure** The target is also [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91).
**Critical Failure** The target is also sickened 2. **Sloughing Sickness** ([Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [Void](/Traits.aspx?ID=510)) This horrifying disease can make a target's skin slough away. **Saving Throw** DC 18 Fortitude; **Stage 1** carrier with no ill effect (1 hour); **Stage 2** 2d4+4 void damage and [clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=61) (1 day); **Stage 3** 4d4+4 void damage, clumsy 1, and [stupefied 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=94) (1 day).
The Wax Man In the many taverns around the Inner Sea, there are tales of a creature called the Wax Man, a mysterious figure whose features are kept hidden by a deep, dark hood. If these stories are to be believed, beneath his voluminous robes, the Wax Man's skin shifts of its own volition. Whether the Wax Man is a skinslough, suffers from another condition, or is even real remains a subject of nervous debate.
name: Skinslough

<title level="1" pfs="">[Stormblood Tiger](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3760)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Whereas most werecreatures follow the monthly rhythms of the full moon, the stormblood tiger's change is connected to the floods brought by annual rainfall. In parts of the world where flooding or heavy rains are both regular and predictable, such as during the Deluge in Belkzen, these lycanthropes stalk the land hunting for prey. Every night after the floods begin, a stormblood tiger is forced into its hybrid form until sun rises or the waters recede, usually 2–3 months later. The remainder of the year, stormblood tigers walk undetected among the population, often mistaken for hunters or scouts.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Beast](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35), [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 28

**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 28

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 26

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 23
</column>

</column>

</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

</row>

**Weaknesses**
[silver](/Equipment.aspx?ID=379) 7

**[Reactive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=48)** <actions string="Reaction" /> 

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet, swim 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
_battle axe_ +17 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Sweep](/Traits.aspx?ID=194)),
**Damage** 1d8+12 slashing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
claw +16 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)),
**Damage** 2d8+12 slashing plus [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=45)

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
jaws +16,
**Damage** 2d6+12 piercing plus curse of the flood tiger

**[Change Shape](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=55)** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) Orc with fist +16 for 1d4+12 bludgeoning, or tiger with Speed 30 feet and [Wrestle](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2867).

**Curse of the Stormblood Tiger**  ([Curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=38), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) This curse only affects [humanoids](/Traits.aspx?ID=628). **Saving Throw** DC 22 Fortitude. Each night of flood season, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or transform into a stormblood tiger until dawn. The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.

**Flood Frenzy**  ([Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) As the night falls in flood season, the stormblood tiger must enter hybrid form, can't Change Shape thereafter, becomes one size larger, increases its reach by 5 feet, and increases the damage of its jaws Strike by 2. When the sun rises or the lands dry again, the stormblood tiger returns to humanoid form and is [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=73) for 24 hours.

**[Rend](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=73)** <actions string="Single Action" />  claw

**Sudden Pounce** <actions string="Two Actions" />  Imbued with an insatiable predatory instinct, stormblood tiger [Leaps](/Actions.aspx?ID=2298) up to 15 feet and makes a claw Strike at the end of that movement. If the attack hits, the stormblood tiger can immediately Rend.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Sought Out</title>

Because of the stormblood tiger's fearsome reputation and powerful abilities, some foolhardy orc warriors view becoming a stormblood tiger as a path to greatness—a blessing instead of a curse. In their minds, it's more important to have this power at hand during times of conflict than worry about disrupting peace during the Flood Truce. Wiser voices argue that too many stormblood tigers roaming about during the Flood Truce risks ending the accord altogether.
</aside>
name: Stormblood Tiger

Massive aurochs herds roam the badlands of Belkzen, grazing upon the limited grass and plant life dispersed throughout the wasteland's valleys. Having adapted to the arid mountain terrain, aurochs herds eat a much more diverse diet of scrub and brush than their domesticated counterparts as they steadily migrate down the Flood Road. The herds show little patience for predators and demonstrate a preference for charging threats with their razor-sharp horns. Bull aurochs display natural instincts to strategically protect other, weaker members of the herd, often surprising intruders with their coordinated tactics and defensive maneuvers. **[Recall Knowledge - Animal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 23 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 21 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 18 [Aurochs Herd](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3761) **Source** [Pathfinder #208: Hoof, Cinder, and Storm](/Sources.aspx?ID=250) pg. 82 **Perception** +12; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69), [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=74) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 60 feet **Languages** **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +18, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +14 **Str** +6 **Dex** +2 **Con** +6 **Int** -5 **Wis** +2 **Cha** +2 --- **AC** 24 **Fort** +18 **Ref** +12 **Will** +12 **HP** 150 (16 squares) **Weaknesses** area damage 10, [splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=699) damage 5 **Stampede** **Trigger** The aurochs herd's Hit Points drops below a threshold; **Effect** The aurochs herd uses [Trample](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=81) but moves in a direction directly opposite of the threat; the DC increases to 27 and the bludgeoning damage increases to 4d6+6 ([prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=88) creatures take 5d6+6 bludgeoning damage instead).
**[Troop Defenses](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=86)** --- **Speed** 25 feet; troop movement **[Form Up](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=43)** **Circle of Horns** The largest males in the herd form a ring of protection around the more vulnerable members. The herd gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of its next turn. **Horn** **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The aurochs herd makes a melee attack against each enemy within 5 feet (DC 22 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). The damage depends on the number of actions.
2d8+8 piercing damage
2d8+10 piercing damage
2d10+9 piercing damage **Puncturing Charge** **Requirements** The aurochs herd has formed a Circle of Horns; **Effect** The aurochs herd Strides to an enemy and makes a Horn Strike, dealing 3d8+8 piercing damage plus [Improved Knockdown](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=66). **[Trample](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=81)** Huge or smaller, hoof (3d6+6 bludgeoning damage; [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=88) creatures take an additional 1d6 damage), DC 25 (any creature that fails its save is knocked prone) **[Troop Movement](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=85)** Whenever the aurochs herd Strides, it first [Forms Up](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=43) as a free action to condense into a 20-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares,) and then moves up to its Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any of the herd's squares enter difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to the whole troop.
Unlikely War Beasts Followers of Zagresh have a history of capturing wild aurochs for use in magical experiments, taking the strongest of a herd to make the beasts even larger and more aggressive. Once the aurochs have been transformed into monstrous goliaths, their captors bard them with armored plates and magical weapons that complement their horns. In battle, these aurochs are utilized to pull siege weapons, break through enemy defenses, and trample frontline forces.
name: Aurochs Herd

markdown:
Most undead are reanimated without consent, but those known as oathrisen arise willingly—at least at first. These loyal subordinates swear themselves to a cause or leader, vowing to assist even in death. Within days of their death, their oath reanimates them and restores most of their memories. In theory, an oathrisen's existence lasts no more than a year. In practice, the cause's leader might demand their service indefinitely. If denied their afterlife too long, some oathrisen turn on their former masters, afterward either becoming independent or destroying themselves. The oathrisen presented here is a variant that frequents Blisterwell during the events of this Adventure Path. Other regions and traditions might create oathrisen with different abilities. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 25 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 23 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 20 [Blisterwell Oathrisen](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3762) **Source** [Pathfinder #208: Hoof, Cinder, and Storm](/Sources.aspx?ID=250) pg. 83 **Perception** +15; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20), [Orcish](/Languages.aspx?ID=9) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +17, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +15, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +15, [Warfare Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +11 **Str** +6 **Dex** +1 **Con** +5 **Int** +0 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +4 **Items** _+1 [falchion](/Weapons.aspx?ID=373)_, [Full Plate](/Armor.aspx?ID=13) --- **AC** 26 **Fort** +18 **Ref** +14 **Will** +15 **HP** 110 ([void healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=83)) **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95) **Armored Disguise** A Blisterwell oathrisen's undead nature is not obvious. While wearing armor, an oathrisen gains a +4 circumstance bonus to its [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) checks to [Impersonate](/Actions.aspx?ID=2388) a living [orc](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=454) and does not require a [disguise kit](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2720) to do so. Creatures that don't notice the disguise are not subject to the oathrisen's Frightful Presence. An oathrisen can abandon its disguise as a free action with the [manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=645) trait when it attempts to [Demoralize](/Actions.aspx?ID=2395) a creature.
**Drop the Mask** Once a Blisterwell oathrisen is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, portions of its armor break off. This reduces its AC by 2, increases its Speed by 5 feet, and gives it weakness 5 to [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509) damage. This also immediately exposes nearby creatures to the oathrisen's frightful presence.
**[Frightful Presence](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=64)** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=590), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=598), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647)) 30 feet, DC 25
**[Reactive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=48)** --- **Speed** 20 feet **Melee** _falchion_ +18 ([Forceful](/Traits.aspx?ID=180), [Sweep](/Traits.aspx?ID=194)), **Damage** 1d10+9 slashing plus 1d6 [persistent bleed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) plus wound ripper **Melee** fist +17 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Free-Hand](/Traits.aspx?ID=181)), **Damage** 1d6+9 bludgeoning plus wound ripper **Ranged** whisper +15 ([range 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [Sonic](/Traits.aspx?ID=147)), **Damage** 4d6 sonic plus curse of whispers **Curse of Whispers** ([Curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=38), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48)) A creature muffled by this curse cannot speak above a whisper. The creature must succeed at a DC 25 Fortitude save to use actions with the [auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=541) trait; **Saving Throw** DC 25 Will; **Stage 1** muffled for 1 minute (1 minute); **Stage 2** muffled for 1 minute (1 minute); **Stage 3** muffled for 1 day (1 day) **Wound Ripper** A Blisterwell oathrisen's Strikes against creatures with the [wounded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=99) condition or taking [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) deal 1d6 additional precision damage.
Knight by Another Name An oathrisen resembles a [graveknight](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=423)— both being heavily armored, corporeal, undead warriors. Yet a graveknight arises through its own unholy ambitions and is inextricably bound to its armor. By comparison, an oathrisen reanimates out of loyalty and is not intrinsically malicious. Some oathrisen even resent graveknights, taking special joy in destroying these unholy copycats.
name: Blisterwell Oathrisen

When the One Eye Hold betrayed Diskah Night Watcher, the dying shaman's anguish rippled out and bound the spirits of the traitors to the [Ethereal Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=34). **[Recall Knowledge - Ethereal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44)): DC 27 **[Recall Knowledge - Spirit](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44)): DC 27 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 25 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 22 [One Eye Phantom](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3763) **Source** [Pathfinder #208: Hoof, Cinder, and Storm](/Sources.aspx?ID=250) pg. 84 **Perception** +13; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Orcish](/Languages.aspx?ID=9) **Skills** [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +14 **Str** -5 **Dex** +5 **Con** +0 **Int** +2 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +4 **Walk the Ethereal Line** The One Eye phantom walks the thin line between the [Ethereal Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=34) and [the Universe](/Planes.aspx?ID=26) in order to exist on both planes simultaneously. They can shift back to solely on the Ethereal Plane by using this ability again. --- **AC** 24 **Fort** +11 **Ref** +18 **Will** +14 **HP** 70 **Immunities** bleed, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), precision **Resistances** all damage 5 (except [force](/Traits.aspx?ID=610), [_ghost touch_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2840), or [spirit](/Traits.aspx?ID=737); double resistance vs. non-[magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=644)) **Ectoplasmic Bleed** If a creature hits the phantom with a melee Strike, the creature is splashed with ectoplasm, taking 2d4+7 spirit damage (DC 21 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). On a failure, the creature is also [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=92).
**Susceptible to Death** Though phantoms aren't alive, neither are they [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=722), and they are uniquely vulnerable to the effects of death. A phantom whose Hit Points are reduced to 0 as a result of a [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effect (such as from a spell like execute) is immediately whisked away to the River of Souls, where their soul resumes the usual path to afterlife. --- **Speed** fly 25 feet **Melee** phantom greatclub +17 ([Backswing](/Traits.aspx?ID=173), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Shove](/Traits.aspx?ID=193)), **Damage** 2d8+9 bludgeoning **Melee** phantom fist +17 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Shove](/Traits.aspx?ID=193)), **Damage** 2d6+8 bludgeoning **Ranged** phantom javelin +17 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [thrown 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)), **Damage** 2d8+8 piercing **Phantom Touch** ([Spirit](/Traits.aspx?ID=149)) Each time they make a Strike, the One Eye phantom can choose to deal spirit damage instead of the normal physical damage type. **Skullcracker** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [Spirit](/Traits.aspx?ID=149)) The One Eye phantom grabs the head of a creature as a jagged, spectral stone seeped with blood manifests before it. The One Eye phantom smashes the head of the creature against the stone with supernatural force, dealing 2d12+7 spirit damage with a DC 19 Will save.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature takes half damage.
**Failure** The creature hallucinates that their skull has been fractured. They take full damage and are [stupefied 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=94).
**Critical Failure** As failure, but double damage and [stunned 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=93).
Atonement for the Damned PCs might try to calm the phantoms instead of destroying them. At the GM's discretion, the PCs may attempt skill checks to talk down the spirits. On a success, the phantom's AC lowers by 2 as they become more willing to move on from their shame and dishonor, and they might even waver in attacking the PCs. Spells or rituals like [_atone_](/Rituals.aspx?ID=108) that require penitent creatures have no effect on these phantoms.
name: One Eye Phantom
resistance_markdown: all damage 5 (except [force](/Traits.aspx?ID=610), [_ghost touch_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2840), or [spirit](/Traits.aspx?ID=737); double resistance vs. non-[magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=644))

markdown:
The most tenacious hunters of the Lyrune-Quah track and kill nocturnal beasts under the light of the moon. When such a warrior perishes during the hunt, sometimes their spirit lingers and transforms into a specter of the night, refusing to move on until their prey is slain. **[Recall Knowledge - Spirit](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44)): DC 28 **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 28 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 26 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 23 [Moonstalker](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3764) **Source** [Pathfinder #208: Hoof, Cinder, and Storm](/Sources.aspx?ID=250) pg. 85 **Perception** +18; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Orcish](/Languages.aspx?ID=9), [Shoanti](/Languages.aspx?ID=41) **Skills** [Medicine](/Skills.aspx?ID=42) +15, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +15, [Shadefields Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +13, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +17, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +17 **Str** -5 **Dex** +6 **Con** +0 **Int** +2 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +2 **Site Bound** The moonstalker can stray no more than 120 feet from the hunting grounds where it was slain. --- **AC** 25 (27 in moonlight) **Fort** +10 **Ref** +18 **Will** +16 **HP** 90 (rejuvenation, [void healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=83)) **Immunities** bleed, [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), precision, [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95) **Resistances** all damage 9 (except [force](/Traits.aspx?ID=610), [ghost touch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2840), [spirit](/Traits.aspx?ID=737), or [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509); double resistance vs. non-[magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=644)) **Cover of Night** A moonstalker in an area illuminated by moonlight gains a +2 status bonus to AC and [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) checks. In the light of a full moon, they are [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=62).
**Lunar Shift** **Trigger** The moonstalker is hit by a Strike; **Requirements** The moonstalker is in an area illuminated by moonlight; **Effect** The moonstalker teleports through a beam of moonlight to another moonlit space within 120 feet. This does not trigger reactions.
**Rejuvenation** ([divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=579)) Slaying the moonstalker's prey from their final hunt allows them to move on to the afterlife. --- **Speed** fly 25 feet **Melee** ghostly shortsword +18 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 2d6+6 void **Ranged** ghostly composite longbow +18 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [deadly d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Propulsive](/Traits.aspx?ID=191), [range increment 100 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 0](/Traits.aspx?ID=254), [volley 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=201)), **Damage** 2d8+11 void **Primal Innate Spells** DC 25 - **1st** [Alarm](/Spells.aspx?ID=7), [Fear](/Spells.aspx?ID=110) - **2nd** [Mist](/Spells.aspx?ID=1606) **Corrupting Gaze** The moonstalker stares at a creature it can see within 30 feet. The target takes 4d6 void damage (DC 25 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Will save). A creature that fails its save is also [stupefied](/Conditions.aspx?ID=94) 1 for 1 minute. **Hunt Prey** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32)) The moonstalker designates a single creature they can see and hear, or one they're [Tracking](/Actions.aspx?ID=2408), as their prey. The moonstalker gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=2301) the prey and to [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) checks to Track the prey. The first time the moonstalker hits the designated prey in a round, they deal an additional 1d8 precision damage. The moonstalker also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within their second range increment. These effects last until the moonstalker uses Hunt Prey again. **Soul Pierce** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Void](/Traits.aspx?ID=510)) The moonstalker infuses soul-rending energy into a spectral arrow, making a ghostly composite longbow Strike with a –2 circumstance penalty against each creature in a 100-foot line.
Loyal in Death Though moonstalkers retain few memories of life, their connections to their quah resonate with them even after their demise. Moonstalkers have been seen protecting living Shoanti warriors who make camp within their hunting grounds, especially warbands that show reverence for the hunt. Outsiders are rarely, if ever, extended the same courtesy.
name: Moonstalker

markdown:
Despite the name given by orcs of the Dirt Sea, the trighoul is not a ghoul at all, but a mutagenic abomination. Its three tentacles bristle with hundreds of neural spines that let it “glide” across the sands at high speed and manipulate the nervous system of a corpse through the spinal column. Trighouls were originally created over a thousand years ago by fleshwarpers aligned with the Whispering Tyrant, giving them to raiders as weapons. While the use of trighouls is now regarded with shame and disgust, some still take advantage of the creatures to lure enemies to their deaths using the corpses of their slain comrades. **[Recall Knowledge - Aberration](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44)): DC 29 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 27 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 24 [Trighoul](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3765) **Source** [Pathfinder #208: Hoof, Cinder, and Storm](/Sources.aspx?ID=250) pg. 86 **Perception** +12; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20), [Orcish](/Languages.aspx?ID=9) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +18, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +16, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +17, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +18 **Str** +4 **Dex** +6 **Con** +3 **Int** +4 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +3 --- **AC** 27 **Fort** +13 **Ref** +19 **Will** +16 **HP** 100 (body)
HP 20 (tentacle), (tentacle regrowth) **Resistances** [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 10 **Weaknesses** pain sensitivity **Pain Sensitivity** When a trighoul's tentacle is severed, it becomes [stunned 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=93). Its Speed is reduced by 15 feet until the tentacle is regrown.
**Tentacle Regrowth** A trighoul ordinarily has three tentacles. A creature can attempt to sever a tentacle by specifically targeting it and dealing damage equal to the tentacle's Hit Points. A tentacle that isn't severed completely returns to full Hit Points at the end of any creature's turn. A severed trighoul tentacles regrows, restored to full Hit Points, after 1d4 rounds. --- **Speed** 45 feet **Melee** tentacle +20 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d6+6 bludgeoning plus 1d6 piercing and [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=66) **Melee** jaws +20 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179)), **Damage** 2d6+6 piercing **Ranged** spit +20 ([Acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=3), [range increment 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [Splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=150)), **Damage** 2d8+9 acid plus 3 acid splash damage **Puppeteer Corpse** ([Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) **Requirements** The trighoul is [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=79), and there's at least one corpse within 10 feet; **Effect** The trighoul attaches a tentacle to the corpse of a Large to Small creature. That tentacle replaces its Strike with a melee corpse Strike that deals bludgeoning damage equal to the total damage dealt by its tentacle. A controlled corpse is destroyed when it takes 20 Hit Points of damage. The trighoul can detach from a corpse as a single action with the [manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=645) trait. **Puppet Show** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) **Requirements** The trighoul is using Puppeteer Corpse; **Effect** The trighoul manipulates up to three corpses to silently [Impersonate](/Actions.aspx?ID=2388) the living. A creature that fails to detect the deception is [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) to the trighoul's corpse Strike. The deception ends immediately after the trighoul attacks.
Puppetmaster Serum Orc alchemists familiar with fleshwarping techniques have synthesized an elixir called [puppetmaster extract](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3663). The elixir transforms the drinker's limb into a tentacle that can temporarily animate the dead. One must take great care when crafting the serum, as incorrectly mixed batches have been known to dissolve organs from within, cause permanent paralysis, and grow tentacles in unwanted places.
name: Trighoul

markdown:
While not native to Belkzen, these swine instead descended from livestock raided and re-homed millennia ago during orc raids. Generations of selective breeding favored larger animals suited to Belkzen's harsh environment and fearsome predators, resulting in the modern war pig. During the flood season, these pigs gorge and grow fat, gradually consuming their reserves to become leaner and meaner during the rest of the year. Arguably domesticated, war pigs rarely remain in captivity for more than a few generations. Most orcs loathe the notion of their swine becoming too tame, instead releasing part of their herd every year to grow fierce before recapturing them seasons later. The downside is that these feral swine associate humanoids with food. Rogue war pigs sometimes form roving gangs that uproot fields, run amok, and even knock over trade caravans to eat rations (and the occasional merchant). The “war” in war pigs comes from their use as mounts. With the right motivation, a war pig is a porcine juggernaut able to carry a fully armored orc into combat. Without discipline, care, and treats, that same pig can become 600 pounds of willful chaos that's as likely to trample foes as it is to flee combat, find a mud puddle, and crush its rider after flopping down to vigorously wallow. **[Recall Knowledge - Animal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 22 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 20 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17 [War Pig](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3766) **Source** [Pathfinder #208: Hoof, Cinder, and Storm](/Sources.aspx?ID=250) pg. 87 **Perception** +14; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69), [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=74) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 30 feet **Languages** **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +14, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +12, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +13 **Str** +4 **Dex** +2 **Con** +5 **Int** -4 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +0 --- **AC** 23 **Fort** +17 **Ref** +12 **Will** +13 **HP** 110 **Squealed Outrage** **Trigger** The war pig is damaged by an adjacent creature; **Effect** The war pig makes a hoof Strike at the triggering creature. --- **Speed** 35 feet **Melee** hoof +17 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)), **Damage** 2d6+8 bludgeoning **Melee** tusk +17, **Damage** 2d8+8 piercing **Bulldoze** **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The war pig [Shoves](/Actions.aspx?ID=2380) an adjacent creature, after which it can either Stride or Step. **Wallow** **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The war pig rapidly rolls over. If it has a rider, the war pig [Bucks](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=54) as a free action. The war pig gains 1d8 temporary Hit Points for 1 minute and can then attempt an immediate flat check to recover from a single source of [persistent acid, fire, or mental damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29). If the war pig Wallows in an area with ample mud, water, loose soil, or similar material, the war pig instead gains 2d8 temporary Hit Points, for 1 minute and reduces the flat check DC to recover from persistent damage by 1.
Packing on the Pounds The statistics here depict a typical war pig. However, these swine grow 100 pounds heavier during times of plenty. To depict a fattened war pig, apply the following changes.
  • Decrease its Speed by 5 feet, and decrease its Reflex save modifier to +10.
  • Increase its AC by 1, its Fortitude save modifier to +18, and its Hit Points by 10.
  • The war pig gains a +2 status bonus to [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) checks to [Shove](/Actions.aspx?ID=2380) creatures.
name: War Pig

markdown:
Deathless zealots are powerful variants of deathless acolyte. They're as ambitious as deathless hierophants but more martially oriented, seeking out and slaying alleged heretics and enemies of their faith in pursuit of completing their divine missions. This zealot is dedicated to Zagresh, but any deity of warfare could create a deathless zealot. Due to their focus on battle and conflict, orc deities are especially likely to create deathless zealots in preference to other forms of deathless acolytes. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 28 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 26 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 23 [Deathless Zealot of Zagresh](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3767) **Source** [Pathfinder #209: Destroyer's Doom](/Sources.aspx?ID=251) pg. 84 **Perception** +21; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20), [Orcish](/Languages.aspx?ID=9) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +22, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +17, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44) +14, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46) +20 **Str** +7 **Dex** +3 **Con** +3 **Int** +1 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +2 **Items** _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2829) [greatclub](/Weapons.aspx?ID=377)_, [religious symbol](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2745) of Zagresh --- **AC** 26 **Fort** +16 **Ref** +16 **Will** +21 **HP** 120 ([void healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=83)) **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95) **Field of Slaughter** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=579)) 40 feet. Allies within the aura treat their weapons and unarmed attacks as [_keen_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2843), even if the weapons don't meet the requirements. Critical hits within the aura deal 3d6 [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29), in addition to any other critical hit effects. If the critical hit would already deal persistent bleed damage, increase the damage to 3d6+3.
**Ravage Heretic** ([divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=579)) **Trigger** A creature within 60 feet who the deathless zealot can see and who doesn't worship Zagresh casts a [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=579) spell; **Effect** The deathless zealot attempts to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) the triggering spell using their spell attack modifier and a counteract rank of 5. If the spell is counteracted, the caster is [stunned 3](/Conditions.aspx?ID=93) from the pain of the backlash. If the deathless zealot fails to counteract the spell, the caster is temporarily immune to further uses of this ability for 24 hours. --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** _greatclub_ +21 ([Backswing](/Traits.aspx?ID=173), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Shove](/Traits.aspx?ID=193)), **Damage** 2d10+11 bludgeoning **Divine Prepared Spells** DC 28, attack +20 - **Cantrips (5th)** [Detect Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=66), [Divine Lance](/Spells.aspx?ID=84), [Void Warp](/Spells.aspx?ID=1745) - **1st** [Bane](/Spells.aspx?ID=18), [Fear](/Spells.aspx?ID=110), [Grim Tendrils](/Spells.aspx?ID=141) - **2nd** [Blood Vendetta](/Spells.aspx?ID=675) (×2), [Spiritual Armament](/Spells.aspx?ID=1687) - **3rd** [Chilling Darkness](/Spells.aspx?ID=36), [Crisis of Faith](/Spells.aspx?ID=55), [Vampiric Feast](/Spells.aspx?ID=1736) - **4th** [Divine Wrath](/Spells.aspx?ID=86) (×2), [Implement of Destruction](/Spells.aspx?ID=1155) - **5th** [Chilling Darkness](/Spells.aspx?ID=36), [Divine Immolation](/Spells.aspx?ID=1496), [Harm](/Spells.aspx?ID=146) (×5) **Cleric Domain Spells** DC 28, 2 Focus Points - **5th** [Cry of Destruction](/Spells.aspx?ID=410), [Destructive Aura](/Spells.aspx?ID=415) **Spellsmash** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48)) The zealot Casts a Spell that requires a spell attack roll or has a range of touch, channeling it into their greatclub, then makes a melee Strike. This attack roll determines the effects of both the Strike and the spell. This counts as two attacks for their multiple attack penalty, but the penalty isn't applied until after the Spellsmash. The zealot can't use Spellsmash again until they recharge it with a single action, which has the [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561) trait.
name: Deathless Zealot of Zagresh

markdown:
Ancient dwarves paid little attention to the Sea of Dirt, seeing little worth harvesting from its muck. Orcs were considerably braver, yet even they're wary of monsters swimming through the silt. To an outsider, palpares might seem like a cautionary tale to keep children from sinking into the quicksand, and the large pits found dotting the Sea of Dirt's shores are just geological phenomena that appear in the wet season. Those who have stumbled across these traps know the dangerous reality. Few know much about palpares, an enormous insect whose plated, hulking abdomen takes up most of its size. They seem to be solitary ambush hunters that hibernate during the dry season, then awaken during the Flood to create their enormous pit traps. These traps capture prey of all sizes, even the occasional herd of migrating aurochs, as they wait buried in the center. Though usually very patient, when disturbed, a palpares can move through its native sandy soil surprisingly quick, greeting intruders who enter its domain with its shovellike head and vicious pincers. **[Recall Knowledge - Animal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 30 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 28 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 25 [Palpares](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3768) **Source** [Pathfinder #209: Destroyer's Doom](/Sources.aspx?ID=251) pg. 85 **Perception** +19; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=82) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 90 feet **Languages** **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +23, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +26, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +22, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +19 **Str** +8 **Dex** +7 **Con** +5 **Int** -4 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +2 --- **AC** 31 **Fort** +21 **Ref** +24 **Will** +18 **HP** 195 **Dig In** **Trigger** The palpares is aboveground and would take damage; **Effect** The palpares [Burrows](/Actions.aspx?ID=2310) up to its Speed, throwing up a shield of dirt that reduces the damage by 11. --- **Speed** 25 feet, burrow 35 feet **Melee** pincers +24 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d8+10 piercing plus [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=45) and palpares venom **Melee** body +24 ([reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d8+12 bludgeoning **Breaching Ambush** **Requirements** The palpares is underground; **Effect** The palpares [Burrows](/Actions.aspx?ID=2310) up to twice its Speed underneath a creature, then Strikes upward with its pincers, ending aboveground. **Palpares Venom** ([Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Saving Throw** DC 30 Fortitude; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** 3d6 poison damage and [stunned 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=93) (1 round); **Stage 2** 3d8 poison damage and stunned 2 (1 round); **Stage 3** 3d10 poison damage and [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85) (1 minute) **Pit Trap** The palpares [Burrows](/Actions.aspx?ID=2310) to create a 30-foot radius sloping pit centered on itself that's 10 feet deep at the center. All creatures in the area must attempt a DC 30 Reflex save.
**Critical Success** The creature is [moved](/Rules.aspx?ID=451) by tremors to a square outside the edge of the pit.
**Success** As critical success, but the creature is also [clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=61) for 1 round.
**Failure** The creature falls 10 feet into the pit and is knocked [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=88).
**Critical Failure** As failure, and the creature is [stunned 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=93). **Venomous Bite** **Requirements** The palpares has a creature [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=77); **Effect** The palpares uses its mandibles to inject venom, dealing 3d8 acid damage and exposes the creature to palpares venom.
Life Stages Research suggests palpares aren't yet in its final form of life, as large caverns on the shores have been discovered to hold traces of chitin and the rotting remains of palpares partially transformed. Though nobody has encountered an adult and lived to tell the tale, rumors abound that the fully fledged insect form resembles [Rovagug](/Deities.aspx?ID=291). Communities are quick to locate and dispose of any pupae they find in large, sand-encrusted mounds in the dirt. Some towns hold large barbecues to harvest tons of “mud bacon.”
name: Palpares

**Clatter** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The ironbill snaps its beak together. Creatures within 30 feet take 2d10 sonic damage (DC 22 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Will save). On a failure, the creature is also [frightened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=76) (frightened 2 on a critical failure).

**Flyby Attack** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The ironbill [Flies](/Actions.aspx?ID=2312) and makes a talon Strike at any point along the way.

The fierce bull of Zagresh is an enormous, easily riled bovine with sharp horns like a stag's. The bulls are bred and raised for sport as well as war. **[Recall Knowledge - Animal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 23 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 21 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 18 [Bull of Zagresh](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3770) **Source** [Pathfinder #209: Destroyer's Doom](/Sources.aspx?ID=251) pg. 86 **Perception** +15; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69) **Languages** **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +20, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +13, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +15 **Str** +7 **Dex** +2 **Con** +6 **Int** -5 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +2 **Running of the Bulls** When a bull of Zagresh starts its turn adjacent to another bull of Zagresh, it gains a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed. --- **AC** 23 **Fort** +18 **Ref** +12 **Will** +15 **HP** 140 **Berserk** If the bull has 40 or fewer HP at the start of its turn, it must succeed at a DC 5 flat check or go berserk. A berserk bull of Zagresh wildly attacks the nearest living creature, or the nearest object if no creatures are nearby.
**[Buck](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=54)** DC 25 --- **Speed** 30 feet **Melee** hoof +18, **Damage** 2d8+8 bludgeoning **Melee** horn +18, **Damage** 2d10+9 piercing **Berserk Stampede** **Requirements** The bull of Zagresh is berserk; **Effect** The bull of Zagresh Strides up to double its Speed and makes a horn Strike against up to three creatures with a –1 circumstance penalty. If it hits, it deals 1d6 extra damage and knocks the target [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=88).
name: Bull of Zagresh

Orc spinecrackers are skilled in the art of hand-to-hand combat, forgoing weapons in favor of gauntlets or bare knuckles. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 23 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 21 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 18 [Orc Spinecracker](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3773) **Source** [Pathfinder #209: Destroyer's Doom](/Sources.aspx?ID=251) pg. 88 **Perception** +12; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Orcish](/Languages.aspx?ID=9) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +14, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +20, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +14, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +14 **Str** +7 **Dex** +3 **Con** +4 **Int** +0 **Wis** +0 **Cha** +3 **Items** [Hide Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=7), [Shortbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=77) (20 arrows), _+1 [spiked gauntlet](/Weapons.aspx?ID=366)_ --- **AC** 23 **Fort** +15 **Ref** +12 **Will** +10 **HP** 130 **[Ferocity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=63)**
**[Reactive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=48)** --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** _spiked gauntlet_ +20 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Free-Hand](/Traits.aspx?ID=181), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 2d8+8 piercing **Ranged** shortbow +15 ([deadly d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=174)), **Damage** 2d6+6 piercing **Brawler Critical Specialization** When the orc spinecracker gets a critical hit with a [brawling](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=1) weapon, the target must succeed at a DC 22 Fortitude save or be [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=92) until the end of the spinecracker's next turn. **Combat Grab** ([Press](/Traits.aspx?ID=133)) **Requirements** The spinecracker has one hand free, and their target is within reach of that hand; **Effect** Using their prior attack to shift their opponent's guard, the spinecracker makes a melee Strike with one hand. If it hits, they [grab](/Conditions.aspx?ID=77) the target using their other hand. The creature remains grabbed until the end of the spinecracker's next turn or until it [Escapes](/Actions.aspx?ID=2296), whichever comes first. **Crushing Pin** ([Attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15)) **Requirements** The spinecracker has a creature [Grappled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=77); **Effect** The spinecracker crushes the creature in their grip, dealing 2d6+6 bludgeoning damage and giving the target the [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=90) condition until the end of the spinecracker's next turn.
name: Orc Spinecracker

Highly trained and dangerous, orc raiders are masters of channeling their rage in battle. This orc raider draws upon the powers of the elements for their rage, but other raiders could gain strength from different instincts. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 24 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 22 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 19 [Orc Raider](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3774) **Source** [Pathfinder #209: Destroyer's Doom](/Sources.aspx?ID=251) pg. 88 **Perception** +14; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Orcish](/Languages.aspx?ID=9) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +21, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +13, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +16, [Warfare Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +11 **Str** +7 **Dex** +5 **Con** +6 **Int** -1 **Wis** +2 **Cha** +1 **Items** [bolas](/Weapons.aspx?ID=331) (3), _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2829) [greatsword](/Weapons.aspx?ID=379)_, [Leather Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=4) --- **AC** 26 **Fort** +18 **Ref** +15 **Will** +13 **HP** 165 **Deny Advantage** An orc raider isn't [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) to flanking, [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=79), or [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=96) creatures of 8th level or lower, or creatures of 8th level or lower using surprise attack. However, they can still help their allies flank.
**Elemental Rage** While raging, an orc raider is cloaked in a vortex of fire, granting their weapons the [versatile fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=724) trait and granting them [concealment](/Conditions.aspx?ID=62) from ranged attacks. They can't use this concealment to [Hide](/Actions.aspx?ID=2404) or [Sneak](/Actions.aspx?ID=2405).
**[Ferocity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=63)** --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** _greatsword_ +20 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [versatile P](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 2d10+11 slashing **Ranged** bola +18 ([Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Ranged Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=251), [Thrown](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)), **Damage** 2d8+9 bludgeoning **Destructive Inferno** While raging, an orc raider can channel their destructive energy into an explosion of flame. Creatures in a 10-foot radius around the raider take 9d6 fire damage (DC 23 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). The raider can't use Destructive Inferno again for 1d4 rounds. **[Rage](/Actions.aspx?ID=2802)**
name: Orc Raider

<title level="1" pfs="">[Orc Hunter](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3775)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

The elite hunters of an orc hold often operate alone, venturing into the wilderness of Belkzen for weeks at a time to track and bring down dangerous wildlife. They don't necessarily limit themselves to hunting animals, making them excellent bounty hunters, as their skills are just as useful against humanoids.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 26

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 24

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 21
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 9">[Orc Hunter](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3775)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=628" />
<trait label="Orc" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=666" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Pathfinder #209: Destroyer's Doom](/Sources.aspx?ID=251) pg. 89

**Perception** +19; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Fey](/Languages.aspx?ID=119), [Orcish](/Languages.aspx?ID=9)

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +18, [Hunting Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +17, [Medicine](/Skills.aspx?ID=42) +18, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +19, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +22, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +21

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +4

**Dex** +7

**Con** +4

**Int** +3

**Wis** +6

**Cha** +0
</row>

**Experienced Tracker** An orc hunter can [Track](/Actions.aspx?ID=2408) while moving at full Speed.

**Items**
[Chain Shirt](/Armor.aspx?ID=6), [Composite Longbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=74), [Net](/Equipment.aspx?ID=681), _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2829) [shortsword](/Weapons.aspx?ID=398)_, _+1 [whip](/Weapons.aspx?ID=404)_

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 29 

**Fort** +18 

**Ref** +23 

**Will** +21 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 155

</row>

**[Ferocity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=63)** <actions string="Reaction" /> 

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
_shortsword_ +21 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)),
**Damage** 2d10+13 piercing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
_whip_ +22 ([Disarm](/Traits.aspx?ID=175), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Reach](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196)),
**Damage** 2d6+9 slashing

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
composite longbow +21 ([deadly d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [Propulsive](/Traits.aspx?ID=191), [volley 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=201)),
**Damage** 2d8+11 piercing

**Ranger Warden Spells** DC 27, 2 Focus Points
- **3rd**
[Ephemeral Tracking](/Spells.aspx?ID=769), [Gravity Weapon](/Spells.aspx?ID=770)

**Hunt Prey** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32)) The orc hunter designates a single creature as their prey. They must be able to see or hear the prey, or must be tracking the prey during exploration. They gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=2301) their prey and a +2 circumstance bonus to [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) checks to [Track](/Actions.aspx?ID=2408) their prey. They also ignore the penalty for making ranged attacks within their second range increment against the prey. They can only have one creature designated as their prey at a time. If they use Hunt Prey against another creature, the prior creature loses the designation and the new prey gains the designation.

**Hunter's Edge**   The orc hunter deals an additional 1d8 precision damage the first time they hit their hunted prey in a round.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Hunting Trophies</title>

Orc hunters frequently take bone fragments from megafauna or powerful opponents they slay as trophies. To show off their combat skill, they display these bones by inlaying them in armor or weapons, forming intricate patterns that provide an account of that orc's triumphs in battle for those who know how to read them.
</aside>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-560" />
name: Orc Hunter

Degholaus form from wretched souls who betrayed their societies to evil ends or for personal gain. These fiends resemble bloated, bestial humanoids with eyeless mole-like faces. They have five tails, all of which feature blood-red eyes. **[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 33 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 31 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 28 [Degholau](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3776) **Source** [Pathfinder #210: Whispers in the Dirt](/Sources.aspx?ID=253) pg. 82 **Perception** +22; [greater darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Chthonian](/Languages.aspx?ID=114), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Empyrean](/Languages.aspx?ID=115); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=79) 100 feet, [_truespeech_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1728) **Skills** [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +27, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +25, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46) +22, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47) +22, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +26 **Str** +2 **Dex** +7 **Con** +6 **Int** +3 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +8 --- **AC** 33 [all-around vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=49) **Fort** +23 **Ref** +26 **Will** +20 +1 status to saves vs. [magic](/Traits.aspx?ID=644) **HP** 290 **Weaknesses** [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=379) 10, [holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517) 10 **Exposure Vulnerability** The first time each round that a creature critically succeeds at a save against a degholau's Veil of Lies or that a creature confronts the fiend on a falsehood immediately after the demon fails to Lie, the degholau takes 3d6 mental damage and becomes [frightened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=76).
**Veil of Lies** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647), [olfactory](/Traits.aspx?ID=664)) 15 feet. A degholau exudes a faint scent of rotting wildflowers in its aura—an odor that dulls the mind. A creature that ends its turn in the aura must attempt a DC 30 Will save.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Veil of Lies for 1 minute.
**Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Failure** The creature is [stupefied 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=94) while it remains in the aura and for 10 minutes after leaving the aura.
**Critical Failure** As failure, except stupefied 2. --- **Speed** 35 feet, burrow 15 feet **Melee** claw +26 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)), **Damage** 3d12+8 slashing **Melee** tail +26 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)), **Damage** 3d6+8 bludgeoning plus 2d6 mental and conspiratorial thoughts **Ranged** spit +26 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [range increment 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)), **Damage** 3d8+6 mental plus twisted loyalties **Divine Innate Spells** DC 33 - **4th** [Honeyed Words](/Spells.aspx?ID=1558), [Translocate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1724) (at will) - **5th** [Shadow Blast](/Spells.aspx?ID=273), [Subconscious Suggestion](/Spells.aspx?ID=314), [Translocate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1724) - **6th** [Dominate](/Spells.aspx?ID=87), [Rewrite Memory](/Spells.aspx?ID=1655) - **Constant (6th)** [Truespeech](/Spells.aspx?ID=1728) **Rituals** DC 33 - **1st** [Demonic Pact](/Rituals.aspx?ID=142) **Conspiratorial Thoughts** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Saving Throw** DC 33 Will; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=92) (1 round); **Stage 2** slowed 2 (1 round); **Stage 3** [controlled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=64) by the degholau (1 round) **Twisted Loyalties** ([Curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=38)) **Saving Throw** DC 33 Will; **Onset** 1 day; **Stage 1** +1 status bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls, must succeed at a DC 10 flat check to use the [Aid](/Actions.aspx?ID=2292) reaction (3 days); **Stage 2** as stage 1, and +1 status bonus to skill checks, plus must succeed at a DC 10 flat check to heal an ally (1 week); **Stage 3** as stage 2, plus lose [sanctification](/Traits.aspx?ID=519) traits (1 week); **Stage 4** anathemas are now edicts, and former edicts are now anathemas—acting upon these new edicts causes loss of abilities and sanctification granted by classes and deities who consider them anathema (1 week)
High Crimes Those whose souls become degholaus abused positions of authority in their nation for personal gain or simply out of a need for cruelty. They might have sold secrets, weakened institutions, or initiated military action against their own people. Some initially deluded themselves into believing their actions were righteous or victimless, but eventually embraced their destructive role, damaging their soul so completely they transform into these demons after their judgment.
name: Degholau

<title level="1" pfs="">[Eshmok (Wasp Demon)](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3777)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Eshmoks are proof that anger consumes a creature. Formed from wrathful souls, these demons resemble giant humanoid wasps who have fallen victim to parasitic fungi. The fungi's foul-looking fibrous material is a physical manifestation of wrath. Tendrils of it burst from eshmok bodies, emitting rage-inducing spores, while lattices of nest-like growths from their torsos shelter wasplike infestations.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 28

**[Recall Knowledge - Fungus](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 28

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 26

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 23
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 9">[Eshmok](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3777)</title>

<traits>

<trait label="Large" />
<trait label="Demon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=573" />

<column gap="tiny">

**Perception** +18; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59)

**Languages**
[Chthonian](/Languages.aspx?ID=114), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Empyrean](/Languages.aspx?ID=115); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=79) 100 feet

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +17, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +19, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +20, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46) +18, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +19

<row gap="medium">

**Dex** +4

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

+1 status to all saves vs. [magic](/Traits.aspx?ID=644)

</row>

**Resistances**

**Weaknesses**
[cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=379) 10, [holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517) 10

**Harmony Vulnerability** An eshmok's wrathful infestations defines them, and forcing peace upon them wrenches at their soul. If they fail a save against [_calm_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1458) or a similar effect forcing them to be peaceful, an eshmok takes 4d6 mental damage.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet, fly 35 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
stinger +21 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)),
**Damage** 2d8+9 piercing plus 2d6 poison

**Divine Innate Spells** DC 28
- **3rd**
[Fear](/Spells.aspx?ID=110)
- **4th**
[Translocate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1724) (at will)
- **5th**
[Translocate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1724), [Wall of Thorns](/Spells.aspx?ID=366)

**Rituals** DC 28

- **1st**
[Demonic Pact](/Rituals.aspx?ID=142)

**[Change Shape](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=55)** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127)) The eshmok turns into their fungus form or back into their normal humanoid wasp form. In fungus form, they lose their fly Speed and can't make stinger Strikes. In wasp form, they gain a tendril melee Strike (+21 for 2d8+9 slashing plus eshmok infection); the tendril strike has the [agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=526), [magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=644), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=684), and [unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521) traits.

**Eshmok Infection**  ([Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) A creature that's [quickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=89) by eshmok infection can use the extra action each round for only Strike actions. A creature that's [confused](/Conditions.aspx?ID=63) by eshmok infection never considers an eshmok in fungal form as a target; **Saving Throw** DC 28 Will; Maximum Duration 6 rounds; **Stage 1** confused (1 round); **Stage 2** confused and quickened (1 round); **Stage 3** confused, [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58), and quickened (1 round)

**Infesting Exhalation** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Olfactory](/Traits.aspx?ID=246), [Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) The eshmok exhales a wave of stinging fiendish wasps out in a 30-foot cone, dealing 4d8 poison damage to every creature within the cone (DC 28 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). The swarming fiend wasps linger in the area for 6 rounds or until the eshmok is able to use Infesting Exhalation again, whichever comes first. Each creature damaged by Infesting Exhalation or that enters the area must succeed at a DC 28 Fortitude save or take 2d8 [persistent poison damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) and become [clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=61) as the poison renders them dizzy and nauseous. At the end of each of their turns, they can attempt a new Fortitude save to end the effects. The eshmok can't use Infesting Exhalation again for 1d6 rounds.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Wrathful Parasites</title>

The swarms that infest an eshmok aren't its allies, but incarnations of anger that serve to constantly harry and agonize the creature. Some maintain that these wasps are manifestations of [Calistria's](/Deities.aspx?ID=279) vengeance, but her faithful believe something closer to the truth—that these wasps represent a mockery of vengeance and a corruption of the directed rage their goddess teaches and epitomizes. Eshmoks are particularly reviled by worshipers of Calistria as a result.
</aside>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-387" />
name: Eshmok

markdown:
These gangly fey lizards are known for two traits. First, they look ridiculous when they run, dashing on hind legs while waving their front legs wildly in the air. Second, they're inveterate thieves with the ability to store an extraordinary amount of goods in their stomach. Many grizzers appeared in the River Kingdoms a little over 10 years ago, but several coordinated hunts drove them further southwest, where they've begun to thrive in the forests of Razmiran. **[Recall Knowledge - Fey](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 32 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 30 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 27 [Grizzer](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3778) **Source** [Pathfinder #210: Whispers in the Dirt](/Sources.aspx?ID=253) pg. 84 **Perception** +20; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=74) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 30 feet **Languages** [Fey](/Languages.aspx?ID=119); (can't speak any language) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +21, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +21, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=50) +21 **Str** +7 **Dex** +5 **Con** +4 **Int** -3 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +2 --- **AC** 29 **Fort** +18 **Ref** +17 **Will** +22 **HP** 180 **Weaknesses** [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=375) 10 **Cold Iron Indigestion** If the grizzer swallows a [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2916) item or a creature holding or wearing a cold iron item, the grizzer becomes [sickened 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91) until they regurgitate it.
**Extradimensional Stomach** The grizzer's stomach is an [extradimensional](/Traits.aspx?ID=596) space (that appears to be an immense elongated leathery chamber) capable of holding up to 24 Bulk. Unless the grizzer uses Digest, the space has the same environment as the grizzer's surroundings, and creatures inside don't take damage from being swallowed, nor do they face the threat of [suffocation](/Rules.aspx?ID=2436). --- **Speed** 40 feet, climb 40 feet, swim 20 feet **Melee** jaws +23, **Damage** 2d12+13 piercing and [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=45) **Melee** claw ([null](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)), **Damage** 2d8+13 slashing **Digest** ([Acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=3), [Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=89)) The grizzer fills their stomach with acid for 1 round to digest its contents. Creatures inside the stomach must hold their breath or start suffocating, and they take 4d8 acid damage (DC 29 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). The grizzer can Sustain this activity, in which case the stomach remains filled with acid; creatures inside take acid damage at the end of their turn and can't catch their breath. The grizzer regains 10 Hit Points if at least one creature takes acid damage as a result of Digest. **Limber** A grizzer ignores [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) from narrow confines and can move at full Speed when [Squeezing](/Actions.aspx?ID=2372). **Regurgitate** The grizzer regurgitates a creature or unattended item from their stomach into an adjacent unoccupied space. **Snatch Object** ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15)) The grizzer unfurls their sticky tongue at a creature within 15 feet and attempts to either pull the target closer or [Disarm](/Actions.aspx?ID=2383) it. If they choose to pull the target, they attempt an [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) check against the target's Fortitude DC and [pull](/Rules.aspx?ID=451) it into an adjacent space on a success. If the grizzer attempts to Disarm the target, they gain a +1 circumstance bonus to the Athletics check if the item is made of shiny material or magically illuminated, such as by [_revealing light_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1653). If the Disarm attempt critically succeeds, the grizzer also grabs the item with their tongue and swallows it. **[Swallow Whole](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=77)** ([Attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15)) Huge, no damage, Rupture 20
Strange Fey Appetites A grizzer's strange appetite isn't unique among fey. [Azarpals](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3738), for example, can store food in their bellies and infuse them with poisons that wreak havoc on feasts and banquets. Stories of whales swimming in otherworldly seas that have swallowed entire villages, or of duplicitous serpentine fey who can assume the forms of those they consume, suggest that fey with strange appetites aren't so unusual on the [First World](/Planes.aspx?ID=35).
name: Grizzer

markdown:
Root rotters are all that remain of the unfortunate elven residents of Greengold. Some died in the initial bursts of Jeharlu spores, while others succumbed to infestation by sinmolds. Fungus now riddles their bodies, wrapping around their brains and nerves to reanimate them. **[Recall Knowledge - Fungus](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 31 **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 31 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 29 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 26 [Root Rotter](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3779) **Source** [Pathfinder #210: Whispers in the Dirt](/Sources.aspx?ID=253) pg. 85 **Perception** +18; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), fungus sense 120 feet **Languages** [Chthonian](/Languages.aspx?ID=114), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Elven](/Languages.aspx?ID=4); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=79) 30 feet ([fungi](/Traits.aspx?ID=614) only) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +20, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +17, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +15, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +18 **Str** +6 **Dex** +5 **Con** +4 **Int** +0 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +2 **Fungus Sense** A root rotter has imprecise tremorsense to detect the vibrations of creatures who are within a region of fungal terrain shared by the root rotter. --- **AC** 26 **Fort** +17 **Ref** +20 **Will** +16 **HP** 195 ([void healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=83)) **Immunities** bleed, [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95) **Weaknesses** [holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517) 10, slashing 10 **Fungal Empowerment** If the root rotter is touching fungal terrain at the start of its turn, they regain 10 Hit Points and are [quickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=89) that turn; they can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike.
**Fungal Mind** ([primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676)) Root rotters communicate telepathically with each other. While within telepathic range of at least one other root rotter, they gain a +2 circumstance bonus to initiative rolls, Perception checks, and saving throws against [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647) effects. If one root rotter is aware of a combatant, all members of the fungal mind within range are aware of it. --- **Speed** 30 feet **Melee** jaws +21 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)), **Damage** 2d8+9 piercing plus 1d8 poison and rotter infestation **Melee** fist +21 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)), **Damage** 2d8+9 bludgeoning **Disperse** ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)) **Requirements** The root rotter has 25 Hit Points or fewer; **Effect** The root rotter destroys themself. Thorny fungal roots explode from their body, dealing 10d6 piercing damage in a 10-foot emanation (DC 25 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). Any creature who fails the save is exposed to rotter infestation. **Fungal Root** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)) Requirements The root rotter is standing in fungal terrain; Effect Fungal roots reach out to snag a nearby foe. An enemy within 30 feet of the root rotter takes 4d6 piercing damage and must attempt a DC 27 Reflex saving throw.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature takes half damage and becomes clumsy 1 until the end of its next turn.
**Failure** The creature takes full damage and becomes clumsy 1 with an unlimited duration. In addition, the creature is restrained (Escape DC 27) for 1 minute.
**Critical Failure** As failure but double damage. In addition, the creature is exposed to rotter infestation. **Rotter Infestation** ([Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48)) **Saving Throw** DC 27 Fortitude; **Onset** 1 day; **Stage 1** [drained 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=68) (1 day); **Stage 2** drained 2 and can sense the presence of root rotters within 30 feet as an [imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412) sense (1 round); **Stage 3** as stage 2, but transformation into a root rotter upon death (1 day)
Corruption Spreaders A root rotter that remains in place for 24 hours causes a 5-foot emanation to become overgrown with foulsmelling unpleasant fungus. This spread increases by 5 feet for each additional 24 hours the root rotter remains motionless, to a maximum area of a 60-foot emanation after 12 days of motionless lurking. This fungus is permanent as long as it has a source of nourishment but can be destroyed as easily as any patch of mundane fungus.
name: Root Rotter

Sinmolds arise from the corruption wrought by [Treerazer](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3218) machinations. As the land transforms, it attracts souls bound for the Outer Realms. These souls coalesce bodies out of fungal slime, birthing amorphous fiends that ravenously hunt for more biological matter using club-like pseudopods or whiplike tendrils that can slice with ease through meat and bone alike. **[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 35 **[Recall Knowledge - Fungus](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 35 **[Recall Knowledge - Ooze](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44)): DC 35 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 33 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 30 [Sinmold](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3780) **Source** [Pathfinder #210: Whispers in the Dirt](/Sources.aspx?ID=253) pg. 86 **Perception** +22; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [lifesense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=67) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 60 feet **Languages** [Chthonian](/Languages.aspx?ID=114), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Empyrean](/Languages.aspx?ID=115); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=79) 100 feet **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +24, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46) +22, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +13 **Str** +6 **Dex** -5 **Con** +7 **Int** +0 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +2 --- **AC** 23 **Fort** +25 **Ref** +11 **Will** +22 **HP** 300 **Immunities** [acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=524), bleed, critical hits, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), precision **Weaknesses** [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2916) 10, [holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517) 10 **Desperation Vulnerability** Sinmolds are aware that they're in a vulnerable state as formless “newborn fiends” and are desperate to become stronger before they become prey to more powerful demons. Whenever the sinmold is in a combat encounter and ends its turn without dealing damage to another creature, the sinmold takes 3d6 mental damage and becomes [frightened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=76).
**Digestion** ([healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=623)) The first time in a round when the sinmold damages a creature with Engulf, the sinmold immediately restores Hit Points equal to the damage dealt, gaining Hit Points in excess of its maximum as temporary Hit Points that last for 1 hour. As long as the sinmold possesses these temporary Hit Points, its surface hardens, and its AC increases to 30. --- **Speed** 30 feet, climb 30 feet, swim 30 feet **Melee** pseudopod +24 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)), **Damage** 3d6+12 bludgeoning plus 2d6 acid **Melee** tendril +24 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)), **Damage** 3d8+12 slashing plus sinmold infestation **[Engulf](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=61)** DC 32, 3d10 acid plus digestion, [Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=2296) DC 32, Rupture 18 **Sinmold Infestation** ([Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Saving Throw** DC 32 Fortitude; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** 2d8 poison damage (1 round); **Stage 2** 3d8 poison damage and can hear the thoughts of [root rotters](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3779) within 30 feet as an [imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412) sense (1 round); **Stage 3** as stage 2, but 4d8 poison damage and [doomed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=67) (1 round); **Stage 4** as stage 3, and arise as a root rotter upon death (1 round) **Spore Purge** ([Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Requirements** The sinmold has temporary Hit Points from digestion; **Effect** The sinmold loses all temporary Hit Points and releases any creatures it currently has engulfed, [pushing](/Rules.aspx?ID=451) them into the nearest unoccupied spaces. It releases a cloud of spores from its body, dealing 5d8 poison damage (DC 29 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save) in a 20-foot emanation. Any creature that fails this save also must attempt a save against sinmold infestation.
Demonic Transformation A sinmold who has devoured many creatures over a period of 1 to 2 weeks hardens their exterior into a cocoon and metamorphosizes into a [demon](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=387). This transformation takes 3 days, during which time the sinmold is [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95), increases their AC to 37 and maximum Hit Points to 400, and gains Hardness 10. Sinmolds look for a safe place to transform, such as an underground shelter or a dense treetop canopy, though some simply eat until they cocoon. The sins the soul committed in life determine the demon that a sinmold becomes, so the resulting form can become higher or lower level, as determined by the GM.
name: Sinmold
