markdown:
Razmir's most powerful priests deploy tithekeepers to ensure his followers don't develop sticky fingers. These ziggurat-like constructs have over two dozen legs and a trap-like mouth. At its top, a mask with a colored ribbon attached denotes its symbolic rank in the Church of Razmir. **[Recall Knowledge - Construct](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35), [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=37)): DC 32 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 30 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 27 [Tithekeeper](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3781) **Source** [Pathfinder #210: Whispers in the Dirt](/Sources.aspx?ID=253) pg. 87 **Perception** +16; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +23 **Str** +7 **Dex** +3 **Con** +6 **Int** -5 **Wis** +0 **Cha** -5 **Eyes Behind the Mask** ([scrying](/Traits.aspx?ID=689)) A creature wearing the mask and garb of a priest of [Razmir](/Deities.aspx?ID=357) that outranks the tithekeeper's mask and ribbon rank can spend an hour Interacting with the tithekeeper's mask to connect with it. The creature's mask becomes an [invested](/Traits.aspx?ID=637) item that allows them to see and hear as though peering through the tithekeeper's mask. The creature must use a 3-action activity envisioning the tithekeeper to activate the [scrying](/Traits.aspx?ID=689) effect, and the effect can be Dismissed. Multiple creatures can create connections to the tithekeeper's mask simultaneously, and a creature can have connections to multiple tithekeepers with just one mask. Each connection ends after a week but can be renewed at any time.
**Locked Vault** The tithekeeper's body is a locked vault containing any tithes given to it. The vault's [_Pick Lock_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1589) DC is 29 and [Force Open](/Actions.aspx?ID=2375) DC is 33. --- **AC** 29 **Fort** +22 **Ref** +17 **Will** +14 **HP** 220 **Immunities** bleed, [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [doomed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=67), [drained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=68), [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=73), [healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=623), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647), [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=661) attacks, [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), [sickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91), [spirit](/Traits.aspx?ID=737), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95), [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509), [void](/Traits.aspx?ID=510) **Accept Tithe** **Trigger** A creature drops or offers at least 750 gp in valuables within 15 feet of the tithekeeper; **Effect** The tithekeeper quickly uses its feet to scoop the valuables into its vault and is now indifferent toward the triggering creature unless that creature uses [hostile actions](/Rules.aspx?ID=300) against it or its allies. --- **Speed** 30 feet, climb 30 feet **Melee** body +23, **Damage** 2d12+13 bludgeoning **Melee** foot +23 ([reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d8+13 piercing plus [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=66) **Capacity for Punishment** The tithekeeper can have up to six creatures impaled and [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=77) with its feet at once. **Impale** **Requirements** The tithekeeper has grabbed a creature; **Effect** The tithekeeper stabs the target with a spike for 2d8+13 piercing damage (DC 29 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). It no longer has to spend an action to extend the duration for the target it has grabbed. The target moves with the tithekeeper and takes 1d8 [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) until it [Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=2296) (DC 29). **Rip Off** **Requirements** The tithekeeper has Impaled a creature; **Effect** The tithekeeper tears the creature loose from its spiky feet, releasing it. The creature takes 4d10 slashing damage (DC 29 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save) and is no longer [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=77). On a failed save, the creature also takes 2d8 [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29). **[Trample](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=81)** Medium or smaller, body, DC 29
Instruments of Terror Though the tithekeeper's primary function is to collect coins, they're capable of great violence. Priests who determine a village is too far behind on payments might have their tithekeeper skewer multiple residents and wave its victims' bodies in the air as it parades through the streets. Those who survive the ordeal are highly motivated to avoid a repeat experience.
name: Tithekeeper

markdown:
A swamp blight appears as a quivering blob of rancid brown and green mud from which dozens of hateful red eyes peer. **[Recall Knowledge - Ooze](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44)): DC 41 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 39 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 36 [Swamp Blight](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3782) **Source** [Pathfinder #211: The Secret of Deathstalk Tower](/Sources.aspx?ID=254) pg. 84 **Perception** +29; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Fey](/Languages.aspx?ID=119); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=79) (within cursed domain) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +32, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +33, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +30, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +30, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +29, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +32, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +27, [Swamp Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +29 **Str** +8 **Dex** +7 **Con** +8 **Int** +4 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +5 --- **AC** 38 **Fort** +33 **Ref** +26 **Will** +29 **HP** 300 ([fast healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=62) 30, rejuvenation) **Immunities** [acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=524), bleed, critical hits, precision **Mosquito Aura** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676)) 30 feet. Mosquitoes surround the blight. The mosquitoes ignore creatures the blight designates as allies as well as any who are at full HP. All other creatures who enter the aura or begin their turn within it take 2d6 persistent bleed damage with a DC 35 Fortitude save.
**Critical Success** The creature takes no damage.
**Success** The creature takes half damage.
**Failure** The creature takes full damage and is [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91).
**Critical Failure** The creature takes double damage and is sickened 2.
**Putrefied Expulsion** **Trigger** A creature within 20 feet of the swamp blight deals damage to the blight; **Effect** The swamp blight violently expels putrefied organic matter at their attacker, making a decaying flesh Strike against them. --- **Speed** 25 feet, swim 30 feet **Melee** stinger +33 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 3d8+12 piercing plus 2d6 [persistent acid](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) **Ranged** decaying flesh +32 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 3d8+12 bludgeoning plus splatter viscera **Primal Innate Spells** DC 38, attack +30 - **5th** [Command](/Spells.aspx?ID=45) (at will; plants only), [Nature's Pathway](/Spells.aspx?ID=1613) (at will; within cursed domain only) - **6th** [Dominate](/Spells.aspx?ID=87) (at will) - **7th** [Vomit Swarm](/Spells.aspx?ID=726) (×3) - **8th** [Dominate](/Spells.aspx?ID=87) - **9th** [Mirage](/Spells.aspx?ID=1604) **Rituals** DC 38 - **4th** [Blight](/Rituals.aspx?ID=4) **Blight Domination** A swamp blight adds [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=722) to the type of creatures it can target with [_dominate_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1501). **Call of the Mire** ([Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** An aura of glittering lights surrounds the swamp blight, compelling a target the swamp blight can see that's within 60 feet to move toward it. This is not forced movement and can compel creatures to move through dangerous terrain. The target must attempt a DC 38 Will save.
**Critical Success** The creature is temporarily immune to Call of the Mire for 1 hour.
**Success** The target immediately Strides or otherwise uses their fastest Speed to approach the swamp blight. This movement does not cost the target their actions. On the target's next turn, they cannot willingly move farther away from the blight, but they can otherwise act normally.
**Failure** As success, except that the target spends all of their actions on their next turn also approaching the blight if they are not already adjacent, and they cannot take any other actions for 1 round. Additionally, the target cannot willingly move farther away from the blight for 1 minute.
**Critical Failure** As failure, except that the creature's only actions are to approach the blight for 1 minute. **Cursed Domain** ([Curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=38), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [Void](/Traits.aspx?ID=510)) [Humanoid](/Traits.aspx?ID=628) creatures that die in a swamp blight's cursed domain are infused with void energy. After 24 hours, they rise as [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=722) creatures of their level of lower. Creatures whose bodies were intact typically become [zombies](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=487) or [mummies](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=445), while those whose bodies were severely damaged typically rise as [shadows](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=469) or [bhutas](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1842). These undead are not automatically under the swamp blight's direct control, but they can potentially be [_dominated_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1501) by the swamp blight. **Oversee Domain** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) **Splatter Viscera** Targets hit by a decaying flesh Strike must succeed at a DC 40 Fortitude save or be [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91) (sickened 2 on a critical failure). This condition is cumulative with itself and with the sickened condition from the mosquito aura, up to a maximum value of sickened 4. If the Strike critically hits, the target also takes 2d6 [persistent acid damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29).
Swampy Undead While a swamp blight can dominate undead in its cursed domain, it prefers to use this power to gather and control undead that would prosper in a swampy environment. When building an encounter with a swamp blight, consider adjusting existing undead to match more thematically with the swampland environment, and avoid using undead that wouldn't make sense in such a region. Adjusting an undead creature's innate spells to be primal spells associated with swampy regions is a great way to achieve this customization.
name: Swamp Blight

markdown:
Briargeists are verdorites unique to Tanglebriar. Millennia spent steeping in [Treerazer's](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3218) corruptive influence has granted them far greater strength while distorting their forms away from the vaguely humanoid to an animate tangle of thorny vines, roots, and fungal growths. **[Recall Knowledge - Spirit](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44)): DC 39 **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 39 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 37 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 34 [Briargeist](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3783) **Source** [Pathfinder #211: The Secret of Deathstalk Tower](/Sources.aspx?ID=254) pg. 86 **Perception** +27; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Arboreal](/Languages.aspx?ID=26), [Chthonian](/Languages.aspx?ID=114), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Fey](/Languages.aspx?ID=119); [_speak with plants_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1681) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +29, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +27, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +27, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +29, [Tanglebriar Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +27 **Str** -5 **Dex** +6 **Con** +3 **Int** +4 **Wis** +8 **Cha** +6 --- **AC** 35 **Fort** +22 **Ref** +27 **Will** +29 **HP** 240 ([void healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=83)) **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), precision, [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95) **Resistances** all damage 15 (except [force](/Traits.aspx?ID=610), [_ghost touch_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2840), or [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509); double resistance vs. non-[magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=644)) **Tanglebriar Dependent** A briargeist is bonded to Tanglebriar and must remain within it. If the briargeist moves outside of Tanglebriar, they are immediately destroyed. --- **Speed** fly 30 feet **Melee** vine +29 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d12+8 void plus bewildering toxin **Ranged** infesting seed +29 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [range increment 40 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 3d10+8 void plus briarvine **Primal Innate Spells** DC 36, attack +28 - **Cantrips (8th)** [Tangle Vine](/Spells.aspx?ID=1713) - **6th** [Tangling Creepers](/Spells.aspx?ID=331) (at will) - **7th** [Nature's Pathway](/Spells.aspx?ID=1613) (at will; within Tanglebriar only), [Sudden Blight](/Spells.aspx?ID=720) - **8th** [Fungal Infestation](/Spells.aspx?ID=691), [Wall of Thorns](/Spells.aspx?ID=366) - **Constant (8th)** [Speak with Plants](/Spells.aspx?ID=294) **Bewildering Toxin** ([Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [occult poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) **Saving Throw** DC 36 Will; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=65) and [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) (1 round); **Stage 2** [confused](/Conditions.aspx?ID=63) and [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) (1 round); **Stage 3** 3d10 mental damage, confused, and off-guard (1 round) **Briarvine** ([Curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=38), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [Void](/Traits.aspx?ID=510)) The incorporeal seeds ejected from a briargeist grow rapidly when they damage living creatures. Living creatures hit by a briargeist's infesting seed must attempt a DC 36 Fortitude save with the following effects. A living creature can only host one briarvine at a time; a creature that currently has a briarvine growing out of them after failing a previous saving throw does not need to attempt additional Fortitude saves.
**Critical Success** The seed fails to take root.
**Success** The seed fails to take root, but the target still takes 2d10 void damage as the seed dies out.
**Failure** The seed takes root within the target and inflicts 2d10 void damage. At the start of the creature's next turn, a long ghostly thorny vine grows out of their body. This ghostly growth makes a vine Strike (as if the briargeist were making the attack) against a randomly determined ally of the host creature within reach at the start of the host creature's turn. If there's no viable target, the vine inflicts 2d10 void damage (DC 36 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save) on the host. The host can attempt a new Fortitude save at the end of each of its turns; otherwise, this effect ends automatically after 1 minute.
**Critical Failure** As failure, except the host can't attempt new Fortitude saves to end the Briarvine early
name: Briargeist

markdown:
An invidiak has no physical body and is born out of a deep sense of envy over this lack. An invidiak only feels properly “alive” when they're possessing a host. In many cases, an invidiak remains dormant in such a host, spending months, even years, observing from within and building up its influence over the host slowly, so as to cause as much long-lasting despair and emotional trauma to the host's friends and family as possible. **[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 25 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 23 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 20 [Invidiak](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3784) **Source** [Pathfinder #211: The Secret of Deathstalk Tower](/Sources.aspx?ID=254) pg. 87 **Perception** +15; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Chthonian](/Languages.aspx?ID=114), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=79) 100 feet **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +15, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +18, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46) +13, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47) +15, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +17 **Str** -5 **Dex** +4 **Con** +3 **Int** +2 **Wis** +2 **Cha** +5 --- **AC** 23 **Fort** +14 **Ref** +17 **Will** +13 +1 to all saves vs. [magic](/Traits.aspx?ID=644) **HP** 90 **Immunities** [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), precision **Resistances** all 5 (except [force](/Traits.aspx?ID=610), [ghost touch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2840), or [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509); double resistance vs. non-[magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=644)) **Weaknesses** [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=375) 5, [holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517) 5 **Exorcism Vulnerability** If an invidiak attempts to possess a creature, and the creature rolls a critical success on their saving throw to resist, or if an invidiak's possession of a creature is ended prematurely, such as via a successful [_dispel magic_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1493), the invidiak takes 6d6 mental damage and cannot cast [_possession_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1638) for 24 hours.
**Share Pain** ([illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=629), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647), [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=661)) **Trigger** A creature within 30 feet of the invidiak deals damage to the invidiak; **Effect** An echo of the invidiak's pain lashes out at the triggering creature, dealing an amount of nonlethal mental damage equal to half the damage the invidiak took from the triggering attack (DC 25 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Will save). On a critical failure, the target is [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91). --- **Speed** fly 30 feet **Melee** claw +13 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)), **Damage** 2d8 cold plus 2d6 spirit **Divine Innate Spells** DC 25, attack +17 - **Cantrips (4th)** [Telekinetic Projectile](/Spells.aspx?ID=334) - **3rd** [Fear](/Spells.aspx?ID=110), [Illusory Disguise](/Spells.aspx?ID=159) (×3) - **4th** [Illusory Creature](/Spells.aspx?ID=158), [Translocate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1724) (at will) - **5th** [Translocate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1724) - **7th** [Possession](/Spells.aspx?ID=225) (range touch) **Rituals** DC 25 - **1st** [Demonic Pact](/Rituals.aspx?ID=142) **Favored Host** Each invidiak has a type of creature they prefer possessing, chosen from [aberration](/Traits.aspx?ID=523), [animal](/Traits.aspx?ID=531), [beast](/Traits.aspx?ID=547), or any [humanoid](/Traits.aspx?ID=628) (such as [dwarf](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=1), [elf](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=2), or [human](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=6))—in most cases, the favored type of target is human. When an invidiak casts possession on a favored host, the duration of [_possession_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1638) increases to unlimited, and the effect lasts until dispelled or until the invidiak dismisses it. **Unbodied Possession** An invidiak leaves no body behind when using [_possession_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1638).
Lengthy Possessions An invidiak can possess a favored host for an unlimited amount of time, and over the course of years their influence can result in their host gaining strange new and unique supernatural powers that grow from this spiritual corruption. Such powers only function as long as the possession lasts; if the invidiak is forced out of the body, these powers vanish and don't return, even if the invidiak later re-possesses the same host. These unique invidiaks are generally much more powerful than the typical one presented here.
name: Invidiak

markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="">[Miastrilek (Spider Demon)](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3785)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

When in their true form, miastrileks have a spider-like appearance. However, they prefer humanoid forms when interacting with mortals, posing as rich or influential figures such as nobles, merchants, or leaders of criminal organizations.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 30

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 28

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 25
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 11">[Miastrilek](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3785)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=721" />
<trait label="Large" />
<trait label="Demon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=573" />
<trait label="Fiend" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=600" />
<trait label="Unholy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=521" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Pathfinder #211: The Secret of Deathstalk Tower](/Sources.aspx?ID=254) pg. 88

**Perception** +20; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59)

**Languages**
[Chthonian](/Languages.aspx?ID=114), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1); plus one additional regional language; [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=79) 100 feet

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +22, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +20, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=37) +20, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +22, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47) +20, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +22, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=50) +22

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +5

**Dex** +7

**Con** +3

**Int** +3

**Wis** +5

**Cha** +5
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 30 

**Fort** +18 

**Ref** +24 

**Will** +22 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 245

</row>

**Immunities**
[acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=524), [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669)

**Weaknesses**
[cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2916) 10, [holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517) 10

**Clarity Vulnerability** The first time in a round that a creature within 30 feet of the miastrilek critically succeeds on a saving throw against a [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669) or [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578) or fully recovers from either such affliction via magic or another effect, the demon takes 6d6 mental damage.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 40 feet, fly 40 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fangs +24 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)),
**Damage** 2d10+11 piercing plus 2d6 acid and tremortoxin

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
caustic slurry +24 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)),
**Damage** 2d8+6 acid

**Divine Innate Spells** DC 27
- **3rd**
[Hypnotize](/Spells.aspx?ID=1564) (at will)
- **4th**
[Translocate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1724) (at will)
- **5th**
[Subconscious Suggestion](/Spells.aspx?ID=314), [Translocate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1724)
- **6th**
[Hallucination](/Spells.aspx?ID=144), [Toxic Cloud](/Spells.aspx?ID=1722)
- **Constant (6th)**
[Water Walk](/Spells.aspx?ID=371)

**Rituals** DC 27

- **1st**
[Demonic Pact](/Rituals.aspx?ID=142)

**[Change Shape](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=55)** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127)) The miastrilek can take on the appearance of any Small or Medium [humanoid](/Traits.aspx?ID=628). This doesn't change their Speed but does prevent them from making fangs Strikes.

**Spew Pollution** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48)) The miastrilek disgorges a spray of acid and rubble in a 30-foot-cone, dealing 6d6 piercing and 6d6 acid damage (DC 30 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). The area becomes [hazardous terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=454) for 1 minute (2d6 acid damage). A creature can take this damage only once per turn. The miastrilek must wait 1d4 rounds before Spewing Pollution again.

**Tremortoxin**  ([Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Saving Throw** DC 30 Fortitude; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** –10-foot status penalty to all Speeds (1 round); **Stage 2** –10-foot status penalty to all Speeds and a –1 circumstance penalty to attack rolls and checks requiring a firm grasp on held items (1 round); **Stage 3** as Stage 2, but increase the circumstance penalty to checks to –2 (1 round)

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Polluters of Flesh</title>

Miastrileks are demons associated with pollution and corruption, but unlike the omox (a demon that rises from souls who routinely befouled and polluted their environmental surroundings in life), the miastrilek's sin is more focused on the pollution and corruption of the flesh—such as those who in life ran complex webs of corruption in society that manufactured and distributed drugs that ruined communities, or used pollution and toxins to torture and transform their victims.
</aside>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-387" />
name: Miastrilek

Mugrisants are manifestations of the [Outer Rifts'](/Planes.aspx?ID=45) capacity for destructive transformation. This qlippoth's cycle of never-ending transformation gives them an insatiable appetite. While a mugrisant can derive nourishment from any flesh, they need not eat to survive, and favor prey that are strong enough to put up a bit of a fight before being devoured, almost turning their bodies inside out to gulp down creatures nearly as large as they are. **[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 39 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 37 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 34 [Mugrisant](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3786) **Source** [Pathfinder #211: The Secret of Deathstalk Tower](/Sources.aspx?ID=254) pg. 89 **Perception** +27; [greater darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=74) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 30 feet **Languages** [Chthonian](/Languages.aspx?ID=114); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=79) 100 feet **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +27, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +30, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +27, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44) +25, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46) +27 **Str** +8 **Dex** +6 **Con** +6 **Int** +2 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +4 --- **AC** 37 **Fort** +29 **Ref** +25 **Will** +23 **HP** 245 **Immunities** [controlled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=64), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=598) **Resistances** [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647) 15, physical 15 (except [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=375)) **[Frightful Presence](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=64)** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=590), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=598), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647)) 100 feet, DC 33 --- **Speed** 40 feet, fly 40 feet **Melee** jaws +30 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)), **Damage** 3d8+15 piercing plus 2d6 acid and [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=66) **Melee** wing +30 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)), **Damage** 3d8+15 slashing **Ranged** tooth +28 ([Concussive](/Traits.aspx?ID=401), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)), **Damage** 3d10+14 piercing plus imbed tooth **Occult Innate Spells** DC 36 - **5th** [Translocate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1724) (×3) - **7th** [Warp Mind](/Spells.aspx?ID=369) - **8th** [Duplicate Foe](/Spells.aspx?ID=93) - **Constant (8th)** [Truesight](/Spells.aspx?ID=1727) **Imbed Tooth** On a critical hit, a mugrisant's fired tooth embeds itself and begins to burrow, inflicting 3d6 [persistent piercing damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) for the next 3 rounds. **[Swallow Whole](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=77)** ([Attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15)) Large, 3d6+14 bludgeoning plus 2d6 acid, Rupture 25 **Teratomatous Display** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [Visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163)) The mugrisant opens their central maw to display a roiling mass of teratomas. The bodies of those who view this revolting sight change of their own accord, sprouting teratomas of their own. Creatures in a 30-foot emanation must attempt a DC 36 Will save, after which they are temporarily immune to further Teratomatous Displays for 1 minute. Tumors created from this ability vanish when the creature isn't [sickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91).
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature takes 3d6 piercing damage and is sickened 1.
**Failure** The creature takes 6d6 piercing damage, is sickened 2, and is [drained 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=68).
**Critical Failure** The creature takes 12d6 piercing damage, is sickened 2, and is drained 2.
Constant, Horrific Change A mugrisant's body is always consuming itself and generating new organs. While a few of these new body parts appear in functional locations, the rest are drawn toward the mugrisant's central growth sac, a composite organ that lies within their largest maw and is used to warp the bodies of those exposed to it. A rare few who are consumed by a mugrisant don't actually die, but are instead transformed body, mind, and soul into a new qlippoth.
name: Mugrisant

<title level="1" pfs="">[Crowded Veil](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3787)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Only one crowded veil exists, but it does so as separate entities in many different bodies. As each “individual” member shares a core extraplanar essence with the others, communication between them moves without regard to planar boundaries or the limitations of distance, allowing for swift transmission of information throughout Tanglebriar and beyond.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 37

**[Recall Knowledge - Fungus](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 37

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 35

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 32
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 14">[Crowded Veil](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3787)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=683" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Fiend" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=600" />
<trait label="Fungus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=614" />
<trait label="Unholy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=521" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Pathfinder #212: A Voice in the Blight](/Sources.aspx?ID=255) pg. 80

**Perception** +28; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=82) ([precise](/Rules.aspx?ID=411)) 120 feet

**Languages**
[Chthonian](/Languages.aspx?ID=114), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Elven](/Languages.aspx?ID=4), [Fey](/Languages.aspx?ID=119); (cannot speak); spore telepathy

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +26, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +28, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44) +25

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +6

**Dex** +5

**Con** +5

**Int** +5

**Wis** +8

**Cha** +4
</row>

**Spore Telepathy** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647)) 60 feet. A crowded veil communicates telepathically via spores. It can communicate telepathically with any creatures who are within its aura.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 33 

**Fort** +25 

**Ref** +22 

**Will** +28 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 300
(one mind)

</row>

**Immunities**
[blind](/Conditions.aspx?ID=59), [controlled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=64), [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95)

**Resistances**
[mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647) 15

**Weaknesses**
[fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 15, [holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517) 15, slashing 15

**One Mind** A crowded veil is an individual creature that shares one mind with all other crowded veils. What one crowded veil experiences, all experience. If a crowded veil gains any conditions, all other crowded veils know this; they also know the direction to every other crowded veil and the distances between them. A crowded veil can communicate instantly and telepathically with any other crowded veil on the same planet. To crowded veils located on other planets, messages can take up to an hour or more to transmit. A message to a crowded veil on another plane takes 24 hours to transmit. A crowded veil is immune to [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647) effects that target only a specific number of creatures. If a mental effect targets all creatures in an area, only the crowded veils in that area are affected, although all other crowded veils sense all damage or conditions endured by those crowded veils.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 20 feet; fly 30 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
tentacle +28 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)),
**Damage** 3d8+14 bludgeoning

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
spore pod +28 ([Brutal](/Traits.aspx?ID=249), [Propulsive](/Traits.aspx?ID=191), [range 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)),
**Damage** 3d6+11 bludgeoning plus crowded veil spores

**Primal Innate Spells** DC 31
- **Constant (7th)**
[Truesight](/Spells.aspx?ID=1727)

**Crowded Veil Spores**  ([Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Saving Throw** DC 34; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** [stupefied 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=94) (1 round); **Stage 2** 4d8 poison damage and stupefied 2 (1 round); **Stage 3** 4d8 poison damage and stupefied 3 (1 round); **Stage 4** 4d8 poison damage and [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95) (1 round)

**Spore Trail** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) A crowded veil shudders, releasing toxic spores. Until the end of their turn, when the clouded veil moves, all spaces they leave are filled with spores. These spore trails persist until the start of the clouded veil's next turn, and can be dispersed immediately by wind in the area. The first time in a round when a creature enters this spore trail, that creature is exposed to crowded veil spores.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">The Many Are One</title>

A colony of crowded veil hosts appears unlinked to a casual observer. As intelligent, moving fungi, they can stray far from their clonal siblings, yet cannot move beyond regions that support their growth. On Golarion, this limits the crowded veil to Tanglebriar alone.
</aside>
name: Crowded Veil

markdown:
Some demons embody subtle methods in their pursuit of tempting mortals to fall into sin so that their souls will be damned to the [Outer Rifts](/Planes.aspx?ID=45). Others embrace brutality and devastation and seek instead to ruin mortal lives and accomplishments. The imvath is both, for their whispers encourage mortals to seek not only their own destruction, but also the destruction of their worlds, so the imvath can enjoy the spectacle of extinction. Thankfully rare, imvaths arise from the souls of mortals whose acts came close to, or actually ended, worlds. An imvath appears as an androgynous, towering, pale humanoid with four red eyes, an oversized mouth filled with fangs, and dozens of blood-red spurs. One arm is muscular, while the other is gaunt. Its legs end in burning hooves, while a lion's tail and bat wings complete its frame. **[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 44 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 42 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 39 [Imvath](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3788) **Source** [Pathfinder #212: A Voice in the Blight](/Sources.aspx?ID=255) pg. 81 **Perception** +33; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [_truesight_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1727) **Languages** [Chthonian](/Languages.aspx?ID=114), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Empyrean](/Languages.aspx?ID=115); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=79) 100 feet, [_truespeech_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1728) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +31, [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35) +33, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +37, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +35, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) +33, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +35, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46) +35, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47) +32, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +33 **Str** +10 **Dex** +6 **Con** +6 **Int** +5 **Wis** +8 **Cha** +6 --- **AC** 43 **Fort** +33 **Ref** +31 **Will** +35 +1 to all saves vs. [magic](/Traits.aspx?ID=644) **HP** 400 **Weaknesses** [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=375) 15, [holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517) 15 **[Frightful Presence](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=64)** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=590), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=598), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647)) 30 feet, DC 38.
**Restoration Vulnerability** The first time each round that a creature avoids death via an effect like breath of life or spends all their Hero Points to avoid death (but not if a dead creature is restored to life), or the first time each round a broken object is repaired to full Hit Points (such as via a mending or remake spell) within 120 feet of the imvath, the demon takes 6d6 mental damage.
**[Reactive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=48)** Fist or claw only. --- **Speed** 30 feet, fly 30 feet **Melee** jaws +37 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)), **Damage** 4d8+18 piercing plus 2d6 spirit and doom soul **Melee** fist +37 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)), **Damage** 4d10+18 bludgeoning plus [Improved Knockdown](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=66) **Melee** claw +37 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)), **Damage** 4d4+18 slashing plus 2d6 [persistent bleed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) **Divine Innate Spells** DC 41, attack +33 - **Cantrips (9th)** [Divine Lance](/Spells.aspx?ID=84) - **4th** [Translocate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1724) (at will) - **5th** [Humanoid Form](/Spells.aspx?ID=153), [Translocate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1724) - **8th** [Charm](/Spells.aspx?ID=34), [Divine Decree](/Spells.aspx?ID=82), [Suggestion](/Spells.aspx?ID=315) - **9th** [Nightmare](/Spells.aspx?ID=208) (at will), [Phantasmagoria](/Spells.aspx?ID=1629), [Phantasmal Calamity](/Spells.aspx?ID=218) (×3) - **10th** [Cataclysm](/Spells.aspx?ID=32) - **Constant (9th)** [Truespeech](/Spells.aspx?ID=1728), [Truesight](/Spells.aspx?ID=1727) **Rituals** DC 41 - **1st** [Demonic Pact](/Rituals.aspx?ID=142) - **3rd** [Geas](/Rituals.aspx?ID=12) - **8th** [Control Weather](/Rituals.aspx?ID=9) **Doom Soul** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48)) An imvath's fangs rip and tear souls as easily as they do flesh and bone. The first time in a round that a creature takes any spirit damage from an imvath's bite, it must succeed at a DC 41 Will save or its [doomed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=67) condition value increases by 1. **Lasting Form** When an imvath casts [_humanoid form_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1560), the spell's duration lasts until their next daily preparations.
Imvath Goals Whether as generals among demonic armies or as assassins and saboteurs of nations, imvaths know that a world's destruction requires time and dedication. When not actively enjoying planetary devastation, they lend their talents at ruination to those whose work can set a world on just such a path to doom.
name: Imvath

Vansidieths rise from the souls of politicians or generals whose pride resulted in great social suffering and tragedy. **[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 40 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 38 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 35 [Vansidieth](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3789) **Source** [Pathfinder #212: A Voice in the Blight](/Sources.aspx?ID=255) pg. 82 **Perception** +32; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [_truesight_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1727) **Languages** [Chthonian](/Languages.aspx?ID=114), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Empyrean](/Languages.aspx?ID=115); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=79) 100 feet **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +33, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +35, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +35, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46) +30, [Warfare Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +31 **Str** +7 **Dex** +5 **Con** +6 **Int** +5 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +9 **Items** _+2 [greater striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2829) [greater flaming](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2838) [bastard sword](/Weapons.aspx?ID=370)_, _+2 [greater resilient](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2786) [breastplate](/Armor.aspx?ID=47)_ --- **AC** 41 **Fort** +31 **Ref** +29 **Will** +32 **HP** 410 **Weaknesses** [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=375) 15, [holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517) 15 **Failure Vulnerability** If the vansidieth uses a damaging spell or makes a Strike on their turn but doesn't deal any damage that turn, they take 4d6+6 mental damage at the end of their turn and their imperious gaze aura deactivates until the end of their next turn.
**Imperious Gaze** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=579), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=590), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647), [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=727)) 30 feet. A non-[demon](/Traits.aspx?ID=573) creature that ends their turn in the aura must attempt a DC 37 Will save. If it fails, the demon's dismissive glance incurs overwhelming feelings of inferiority, causing the creature to become [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=92) for 1 round as it doubts itself and hesitates.
**[Reactive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=48)** --- **Speed** 35 feet, fly 35 feet **Melee** _bastard sword_ +35 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)), **Damage** 3d8+15 slashing plus 1d6 fire **Melee** jaws +33 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)), **Damage** 3d10+15 piercing plus 2d6 spirit **Melee** claw +33 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)), **Damage** 3d10+15 slashing **Divine Innate Spells** DC 40, attack +32 - **Cantrips (9th)** [Daze](/Spells.aspx?ID=61), [Shield](/Spells.aspx?ID=280), [Telekinetic Projectile](/Spells.aspx?ID=334) - **5th** [Translocate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1724), [Translocate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1724) (at will) - **7th** [Illusory Disguise](/Spells.aspx?ID=159), [Regenerate](/Spells.aspx?ID=248) - **8th** [Divine Decree](/Spells.aspx?ID=82), [Heal](/Spells.aspx?ID=148) (×3), [Spiritual Armament](/Spells.aspx?ID=1687) - **9th** [Dominate](/Spells.aspx?ID=87), [Overwhelming Presence](/Spells.aspx?ID=212) - **Constant (9th)** [Truesight](/Spells.aspx?ID=1727) **Rituals** DC 40 - **1st** [Demonic Pact](/Rituals.aspx?ID=142) **Battle Roar** ([Auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) **Frequency** once per minute; **Effect** The vansidieth attempts to [Demoralize](/Actions.aspx?ID=2395) all foes within 30 feet (rolling one attempt against all enemies' Will DCs). If the vansidieth critically succeeds against at least one enemy, the demon becomes [quickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=89) for 1 round on their next turn and can use the extra action each round to [Demoralize](/Actions.aspx?ID=2395) or [Feint](/Actions.aspx?ID=2390). **Leader of the Pack** ([Auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48)) **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The vansidieth orders allied creatures within 15 feet that are level 17 or lower to Step, Stride, or Strike; affected creatures can take the commanded action immediately as a free action.
Demonic Generals While some consider demons to be bickering monsters known more for infighting than uniting in a single army, the story of the Worldwound teaches an important lesson. A powerful demon can organize demonic hordes into an incredibly destructive war machine, and vansidieths often lead those armies as generals, coaxing cooperation from the fiendish rabble.
name: Vansidieth

Devasances are typically felt before they're seen, as they constantly sap vitality from creatures around them. On [the Void](/Planes.aspx?ID=28), a devasance's aura can be easily confused for a pocket of particularly potent planar energy, especially as they meld into the darkness around them. Legless and incorporeal with glowing red eyes, these vaguely humanoid creatures are commonly confused for [shadows](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3186), [wraiths](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3243), or other forms of [incorporeal](/Traits.aspx?ID=632) [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=722). **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 38 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 35 [Devasance](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3790) **Source** [Pathfinder #212: A Voice in the Blight](/Sources.aspx?ID=255) pg. 83 **Perception** +30; [greater darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [lifesense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=67) 60 feet **Languages** [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20), [Shadowtongue](/Languages.aspx?ID=21) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +31, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +33, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +30 **Str** -5 **Dex** +6 **Con** +0 **Int** +5 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +9 --- **AC** 38 **Fort** +25 **Ref** +30 **Will** +28 **HP** 225 ([void healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=83)) **Immunities** bleed, [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=70), precision, [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95) **Resistances** all 15 (except [force](/Traits.aspx?ID=610), [_ghost touch_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2840), [spirit](/Traits.aspx?ID=737), or [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509); double resistance vs. non-[magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=644)) **Weaknesses** [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509) 15 **Aura of Malaise** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [void](/Traits.aspx?ID=510)) 30 feet. A living creature that starts its turn in the devasance's aura must succeed at a DC 34 Will save or become slowed 1 (or slowed 2 on a critical failure).
**Void Shadow** While on a plane with the void trait or in the area of an effect with the void trait, the devasance's form disappears. It is naturally invisible in this area, but becomes visible for 1 minute after it takes vitality damage.
**Drink Life** Trigger A living creature takes void damage from the devasance; Effect The devasance gains 25 temporary HP for 1 minute and becomes quickened until the end of its next turn. It can use the extra action to Strike or Fly. --- **Speed** fly 30 feet **Melee** void hand +30 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 3d6+8 void plus 2d6 spirit and living death **Occult Innate Spells** DC 37, attack +29 - **Cantrips (8th)** [Telekinetic Projectile](/Spells.aspx?ID=334), [Void Warp](/Spells.aspx?ID=1745) - **6th** [Vision of Death](/Spells.aspx?ID=1742) - **7th** [Paralyze](/Spells.aspx?ID=213), [Warp Mind](/Spells.aspx?ID=369) - **8th** [Spirit Blast](/Spells.aspx?ID=301) **Living Death** ([Curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=38), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) A creature hit by the devasance's void hand strike must attempt a DC 37 Fortitude save.
**Critical Success** The target is unaffected.
**Success** The target takes on the appearance of a rotted or nearly skeletal undead version of itself and becomes [drained 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=68) for 1 round. If the target assumes another shape through a [polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=670) effect, it continues to look undead in its new shape. This change in appearance persists for 10 minutes.
**Failure** As success, but with an unlimited duration. [Healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=623) effects on the target restore only half the Hit Points they normally would.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but drained 2. If a living creature dies while under the effects of this curse, their soul is transformed into a devasance upon death. The creature cannot be restored to life, nor can its soul move on to the afterlife, until it is slain again as a devasance. **Void Ray** ([Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [Void](/Traits.aspx?ID=510)) The devasance emits a ray of void energy from its chest in a 60-foot line. Living creatures in this area take 7d6 void damage (DC 37 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save, plus [enfeebled 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=71) on a failure, or enfeebled 2 on a critical failure; the condition has an unlimited duration in either case).
Summoned to the Netherworld Devasances can be found in [the Netherworld](/Planes.aspx?ID=36), where they are sometimes summoned to serve. Their ability to sap light makes them powerful allies between the planes. However, the Netherworld is not always prepared to control their void essence, and devasances rarely understand the concept of planar diplomacy.
name: Devasance

The rift pulper chews away at the planar structure of reality, eating quintessence to build their hideous hives. These bulbous structures look like partially melted wasp hives with the appearance of distorted faces, arms, and legs pressing against the walls from within. **[Recall Knowledge - Elemental](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35), [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 41 **[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 41 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 39 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 36 [Rift Pulper](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3791) **Source** [Pathfinder #212: A Voice in the Blight](/Sources.aspx?ID=255) pg. 84 **Perception** +29; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=82) 30 feet **Languages** [Chthonian](/Languages.aspx?ID=114), [Muan](/Languages.aspx?ID=108); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=79) 100 feet **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +31, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +33, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +29, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +31 **Str** +8 **Dex** +5 **Con** +6 **Int** +0 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +4 --- **AC** 40 **Fort** +32 **Ref** +29 **Will** +26 **HP** 390 **Immunities** [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), [sleep](/Traits.aspx?ID=696) **Weaknesses** [axes](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=1) 15, [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 15, [holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517) 15 **Burst Cyst** **Requirements** Initiative has not yet been rolled; **Trigger** A Small or larger creature comes within 10 feet of a rift pulper in its cyst; **Effect** The rift pulper's cyst explodes, inflicting 8d6 piercing damage to all non–rift pulper creatures within 20 feet (DC 35 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). The rift pulper emerges from the burst cyst and Strides, [Climb](/Actions.aspx?ID=2374), or [Flies](/Actions.aspx?ID=2312) once before it rolls [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) for initiative. --- **Speed** 25 feet, burrow 10 feet, fly 40 feet **Melee** mandibles +33 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 3d10+16 slashing plus 2d6 spirit plus [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=45) **Melee** stinger +32 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 3d6+15 piercing plus 2d6 [persistent bleed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) and pulper venom **Pulp Quintessence** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Teleportation](/Traits.aspx?ID=156)) The rift pulper rapidly chews on reality itself, gnawing open a short-lived rift into the liminal space between planes in any adjacent square. The rift pulper becomes [quickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=89) for 1 round, and can use the extra action to Stride, [Fly](/Actions.aspx?ID=2312), or Strike. If another creature occupies the square in which the rift pulper Pulps Quintessence, it takes 18d6 bludgeoning damage as portions of its body are stretched and distorted painfully by the tear in reality (DC 38 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save). The rift pulper can't Pulp Quintessence again for 1 minute.
This ability is more effective in the Outer Sphere, and when used on any of these planes, the rift pulper becomes quickened for 2 rounds, the DC to resist being damaged by the rift increases to DC 40, and the rift pulper can't use Pulp Quintessence again for 1d4 rounds. **Pulp Soul** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48)) The rift pulper chews on the flesh of a creature [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=77) or [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=90) by it, pulping the quintessence that makes up their soul. The creature takes 3d10+10 spirit damage (DC 38 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Will save). If the creature is a native to the outer sphere (such as a [celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16) or [fiend](/Traits.aspx?ID=600)) the damage increases to 3d12+12 spirit damage. **Pulper Venom** ([Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Saving Throw** DC 38 Fortitude; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** [enfeebled 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=71) (1 round); **Stage 2** enfeebled 2 (1 round), **Stage 3** enfeebled 2 and [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=92) (1 round) **Wood Cyst** The rift pulper spends 1 minute digging into a Huge or larger tree or wooden object, then forms a cyst around itself. While inside the cyst, the rift pulper can only sense its surroundings via [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=82) and is [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=81) until the cyst is broken open. The cyst has AC 40, 50 HP, and shares the rift pulper's weaknesses. If the cyst is broken open by any means other than Burst Cyst, the rift pulper must succeed at a DC 40 Fortitude save or become [stunned 3](/Conditions.aspx?ID=93). While inside its cyst, the rift pulper has an automatic result of 49 on [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) checks and DCs to pass as nothing more than a large bulge on the wooden surface.
name: Rift Pulper

The timber body of a second spawn cracks with each movement, as if its very frame protests its abominable mobility. Grown from [arboreals](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=364) native to the [Plane of Wood](/Planes.aspx?ID=25), the greatest of the second spawn—in effect, the “First Spawn”—is [Treerazer's](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3218) mobile fortress, the Witchbole. **[Recall Knowledge - Elemental](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35), [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 47 **[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 47 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 45 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 42 [Second Spawn](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3792) **Source** [Pathfinder #212: A Voice in the Blight](/Sources.aspx?ID=255) pg. 85 **Perception** +36; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Chthonian](/Languages.aspx?ID=114), [Muan](/Languages.aspx?ID=108); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=79) 100 feet **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +39, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +35, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +36, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +35 **Str** +10 **Dex** +6 **Con** +10 **Int** +0 **Wis** +7 **Cha** +6 --- **AC** 45 **Fort** +39 **Ref** +33 **Will** +36 **HP** 500 **Immunities** [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), [sleep](/Traits.aspx?ID=696) **Resistances** bludgeoning 20, piercing 20 **Weaknesses** [axes](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=1) 20, [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 20, [holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517) 20 **Spray Sap** **Trigger** The second spawn takes damage; **Effect** A spray of bloody sap spurts from the second spawn's wound, targeting a creature within 30 feet of the second spawn's choice. That creature takes 10d6 poison damage (DC 41 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save) and is exposed to corrupting sap. --- **Speed** 20 feet **Melee** branch +39 ([reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 4d12+18 bludgeoning plus [Improved Knockdown](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=66) **Ranged** spirit splinter +39 ([Brutal](/Traits.aspx?ID=249), [Propulsive](/Traits.aspx?ID=191), [range increment 120 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)), **Damage** 4d4+13 piercing plus 2d6 spirit and corrupting sap **Corrupting Sap** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) The first time in a round a creature is exposed to the second spawn's corrupting sap, the creature must attempt a DC 44 Will save.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected, and is temporarily immune to corrupting sap for 1 minute.
**Success** Intrusive fiendish thoughts and cruel urges well up in the creature's mind, causing the creature to become [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) until the end of its next turn.
**Failure** The creature is [confused](/Conditions.aspx?ID=63) for 1 minute.
**Critical Failure** The creature is [controlled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=64) by the second spawn for 1 minute.
name: Second Spawn

markdown:
In places where the dead are discarded in such great volumes that the remains begin to feel more like terrain than bodies, in realms where void energy flows strong and seeks any fragment of once-life to infuse, in areas so suffused with negative emotions and agony like the Amaranthine Oubliette, it comes as no surprise that the cast-off remnants of prisoners over the eons have become monsters. Over the eons, past wardens of the Oubliette have allowed some of these deadly swarms to escape into other planes for their own inscrutable reasons. Once stranded elsewhere in the Great Beyond, the pain of being cut off from [the Void](/Planes.aspx?ID=28) drives the klacktel into a relentless rampage that stops only when it is destroyed. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 45 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 43 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 40 [Klacktel](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3793) **Source** [Pathfinder #212: A Voice in the Blight](/Sources.aspx?ID=255) pg. 86 **Perception** +34; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [lifesense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=67) 120 feet **Languages** **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +37, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +36 **Str** +7 **Dex** +6 **Con** +10 **Int** -5 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +5 --- **AC** 46 **Fort** +39 **Ref** +30 **Will** +32 **HP** 360 ([void healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=83)) **Immunities** bleed, [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), precision, [swarm mind](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=78), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95) **Resistances** bludgeoning 10, piercing 20, slashing 20 **Weaknesses** area damage 20, [holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517) 20, [splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=699) damage 20 **Consumption Aura** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=579), [void](/Traits.aspx?ID=510)) 30 feet. The klacktel's void-infused mass draws living creatures toward it, as iron filings to a lodestone. Living creatures that begin their turn in the aura must attempt a DC 39 Fortitude save.
**Critical Success** The target is unaffected.
**Success** The target is [pulled](/Rules.aspx?ID=451) 5 feet toward the klacktel.
**Failure** The target is pulled 5 feet toward the klacktel and is [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) until the end of their turn.
**Critical Failure** The target is pulled 10 feet toward the klacktel, is off-guard until the end of their turn, and is knocked [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=88).
**Consume Vitality** ([divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=579), [void](/Traits.aspx?ID=510)) **Trigger** The klacktel would take vitality damage; **Effect** The klacktel absorbs the vitality damage and takes no damage from the effect. It loses its [void healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=83) ability until the end of its next turn. --- **Speed** 50 feet, climb 30 feet, swim 20 feet **Extract Bones** **Requirements** A Small or larger dead body is in the klacktel's space; **Effect** The klacktel destroys the corpse and adds its bones to its body, gaining 50 temporary HP for 1 hour and becoming [quickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=89) for 1 round. It can use the extra action to Stride. **Hungry Bones** Each enemy in the klacktel's space takes 4d8 bludgeoning damage and 4d8 void damage with a DC 42 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. **Void Beam** The klacktel fires a beam of void energy in a 120- foot line. All creatures in the area take 16d8 void damage (DC 42 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save).
Cursed Treasure As a klacktel rolls over anything that comes within its path, rubble and discarded items inevitably become swept up into its mass, adding to the tangle of bones. When a klacktel is slain, the bones quickly rot away into foul-smelling tar, but those items still remaining in its mass that haven't been ground to powder clatter to the ground. Magical items that have lingered overlong within a klacktel can become corrupted and cursed.
name: Klacktel

Riftweasels have long, thin tendrils along their snouts that function like whiskers in sensing movement; these grant riftweasels the precise tremorsense to pinpoint delicious grubs and other scavengers while they hide inside of larger corpses. **[Recall Knowledge - Beast](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35), [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 44 **[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 44 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 42 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 39 [Riftweasel](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3794) **Source** [Pathfinder #212: A Voice in the Blight](/Sources.aspx?ID=255) pg. 87 **Perception** +34; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=74) ([precise](/Rules.aspx?ID=411)) 120 feet, [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=82) ([precise](/Rules.aspx?ID=411)) 60 feet **Languages** [Chthonian](/Languages.aspx?ID=114) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +34, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +37, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +34, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +34, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +36 **Str** +10 **Dex** +7 **Con** +5 **Int** +3 **Wis** +7 **Cha** +5 --- **AC** 44 **Fort** +30 **Ref** +34 **Will** +32 **HP** 355 **Immunities** [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669) **Lithe** A riftweasel can fit through tight spaces as if it were a Tiny creature. When [Squeezing](/Actions.aspx?ID=2372), it moves at its full speed.
**Tenacious Grip** **Trigger** A creature [Escapes](/Actions.aspx?ID=2296) from the riftweasel's grapple; **Effect** The riftweasel twists its body to maintain its grasp, and attempts to [Grapple](/Actions.aspx?ID=2376) the target before they can actually escape. It takes a –5 circumstance penalty to this attempt. --- **Speed** 30 feet, burrow 20 feet, fly 30 feet **Melee** jaws +35, **Damage** 4d10+15 piercing plus 2d6 [persistent bleed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) and [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=66) **Occult Innate Spells** DC 38, attack +30 - **Cantrips (9th)** [Daze](/Spells.aspx?ID=61) - **8th** [Synaptic Pulse](/Spells.aspx?ID=327), [Talking Corpse](/Spells.aspx?ID=329), [Vision of Death](/Spells.aspx?ID=1742) - **9th** [Paralyze](/Spells.aspx?ID=213) - **Constant (9th)** [Fly](/Spells.aspx?ID=125) **Burst from the Dead** ([Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Move](/Traits.aspx?ID=114)) **Requirements** The riftweasel is inside of a carcass; **Effect** The riftweasel emerges in a gory burst from the carcass, appearing in any space adjacent to the remains. As it bursts out, it shrieks and splatters decay all about it; the riftweasel attempts to [Demoralize](/Actions.aspx?ID=2395) an observed creature. The riftweasel doesn't take any penalty to this check for not speaking during the attempt, and if it critically succeeds, the target is also [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91) by fragments of gore and putrescence splattered onto it by the unsettling display. **Carrion Eater** ([Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) The riftweasel consumes flesh from an adjacent dead creature and regains 10d6 Hit Points. It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once. **Hide in Carcass** The riftweasel [Burrows](/Actions.aspx?ID=2310) into the carcass of a Large or larger adjacent creature, then [Hides](/Actions.aspx?ID=2404). As long as it remains inside a carcass, it can sense the surrounding area via [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=82), and gains [greater cover](/Rules.aspx?ID=459). A riftweasel doesn't need to hold its breath while burrowed into a carcass. **Snap Neck** ([Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) The riftweasel wrenches at the head of a Medium or smaller creature it has [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=77) or [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=90); the creature must attempt a DC 41 Fortitude save.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature takes 2d10 bludgeoning damage.
**Failure** The creature takes 4d10 bludgeoning damage and is [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85) for 1 minute.
**Critical Failure** The creature takes 8d10 bludgeoning damage and is permanently paralyzed.
Sadistic Scavengers As a scavenger, the riftweasel is rather intelligent, though it also finds great delight in tormenting creatures. It won't hesitate to arrange victims in unpleasant tableaus, and particularly enjoys feeding on paralyzed creatures, eating parts of the body that won't quickly kill. Once a victim dies, they enjoy using talking corpse to mock and interrogate their meals as they finish them. Those subjected to a vision of death by a rift weasel typically see themselves eaten and mocked after death by the cruel creature.
name: Riftweasel

Shroud mosses are often confused for [ghosts](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=418), as they appear as a shimmering, insubstantial imprint of a deceased creature. In truth, nothing of the deceased remains within a shroud moss. Rather, what appears to be a ghost is an image created by clouds of shimmering spores surrounding the wispy tendrils of the moss itself. When not disguised by a stolen shape, a shroud moss appears as a mass of gray-green tendrils of moss capable of shifting its shape into the basic framework of a creature, looking not unlike a free-standing humanoid nervous system with a mass of tangles where a brain would be. **[Recall Knowledge - Fungus](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 43 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 41 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 38 [Shroud Moss](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3795) **Source** [Pathfinder #212: A Voice in the Blight](/Sources.aspx?ID=255) pg. 88 **Perception** +31; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Chthonian](/Languages.aspx?ID=114); spore telepathy 100 feet **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +32, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +35, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +35, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48) +32 **Str** -5 **Dex** +6 **Con** +9 **Int** +5 **Wis** +5 **Cha** +9 **Spore Telepathy** A shroud moss can communicate via telepathy with any creature within its sporecloud aura, doing so in that creature's native language. --- **AC** 42 **Fort** +36 **Ref** +30 **Will** +27 **HP** 400 **Resistances** bludgeoning 15, piercing 20 **Weaknesses** [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 15, slashing 15 **[Frightful Presence](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=64)** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=590), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=598), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647)) 60 feet, DC 37; **Requirements** Assume Shape is active.
**Filament Body** A shroud moss's body is physical, but much lighter and flexible than normal. They can move through openings down to 1 inch in diameter with ease and are treated as Tiny creatures for all effects affected by a creature's size. A shroud moss adjusts its saving throws against wind-based effects down by one degree of success.
**Sporecloud** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676)) 60 feet. The shroud moss constantly exudes a transparent cloud of spores; creatures in the aura can communicate with the shroud moss via telepathy. A creature that ends its turn in the aura is exposed to grayshroud. The sporecloud's range is reduced to 5 feet until the end of the shroud moss's next turn whenever the shroud moss is exposed to winds stronger than a gentle breeze. --- **Speed** 25 feet, fly 40 feet **Melee** tendril +32 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)), **Damage** 3d8+8 slashing plus 1d6 poison **Ranged** spore pod +32 ([range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 6d8 poison plus grayshroud **Assume Shape** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) The shroud moss assumes the ghostly (and often unsettlingly distorted) shape of the creature from whose physical remains it grew from, or from a creature it damaged this round, for 1 minute. While in this form, the shroud moss's frightful presence aura is active, and its tendril attacks inflict an additional 3d6 mental damage as feelings of betrayal and imminent death wrack the target's mind. This increases to 5d6 mental damage if the shroud moss attacks the creature it stole this shape from. **Grayshroud** ([Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46)) **Saving Throw** DC 40 Fortitude; **Stage 1** [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=73) (1 day); **Stage 2** [drained 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=68) and fatigued (1 day); **Stage 3** drained 2 and fatigued (1 day); **Stage 4** drained 3, fatigued, and can't speak (1 day); **Stage 5** death
Grayshroud Sufferers Those who become infected with grayshroud may at first assume they're just suffering from overexertion or lack of sleep, but once they become drained by the disease, their flesh turns increasingly gray and is riddled with flaky sheets as their skin takes on the appearance of peeling bark. Those who die from grayshroud move on to the afterlife as normal, but their remains spawn a new shroud moss who adds their form to its stolen shapes.
name: Shroud Moss

Spawns of Jeharlu typically drift in the skies above the realm of Jeharlu, content to enjoy blasphemous and horrific dreams and fancies while they watch the fungal world below for intruders. It isn't that far off the mark to equate a spawn of Jeharlu to a white blood cell, except in this case the body they defend is Jeharlu. Encountered beyond this realm, a spawn's role reverses—now they play the part of infective agents, seeking to spread corruption through soil, vegetation, and fleshy life wherever they go. **[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 49 **[Recall Knowledge - Fungus](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 49 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 47 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 44 [Spawn Of Jeharlu](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3796) **Source** [Pathfinder #212: A Voice in the Blight](/Sources.aspx?ID=255) pg. 89 **Perception** +40; [greater darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), scent purity ([precise](/Rules.aspx?ID=411)) 120 feet, [_truesight_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1727) **Languages** [Chthonian](/Languages.aspx?ID=114) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +36, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +43, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +40, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46) +42 **Str** +11 **Dex** +6 **Con** +8 **Int** +4 **Wis** +10 **Cha** +6 **Scent Purity** A spawn of Jeharlu can detect [holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517) creatures with [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=74) as a precise sense to 120 feet. --- **AC** 46 [all-around vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=49) **Fort** +34 **Ref** +38 **Will** +40 **HP** 540 **Immunities** [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669) **Weaknesses** [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=375) 20, [holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517) 20 **Hallucinatory Spores** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=579), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=590), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647)) 60 feet. The spawn is surrounded by spores that manipulate the thoughts of those exposed. When a creature ends its turn in the aura and isn't [holding its breath](/Rules.aspx?ID=2436), it must attempt a DC 42 Will save. If it fails, it becomes [confused](/Conditions.aspx?ID=63) until the end of its next turn (or for 1 minute on a critical failure).
**Grasping Strands** **Trigger** A creature within 60 feet of the spawn of Jeharlu uses a [move](/Traits.aspx?ID=658) action or leaves a square during a move action it's using; **Effect** A flurry of tendrils whips out, allowing the spawn of Jeharlu to attempt an [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) check to [Grapple](/Actions.aspx?ID=2376) the triggering creature. The spawn can [Pull](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=71) the creature if it remains grappled on its next turn. --- **Speed** 20 feet, fly 40 feet **Melee** tentacle +39 ([Forceful](/Traits.aspx?ID=180), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521), [versatile P](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 4d12+19 bludgeoning plus [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=66) **Primal Innate Spells** DC 42, attack +34 - **Cantrips (9th)** [Caustic Blast](/Spells.aspx?ID=1461), [Tangle Vine](/Spells.aspx?ID=1713) - **4th** [Translocate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1724) (at will) - **5th** [Translocate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1724) - **8th** [Regenerate](/Spells.aspx?ID=248), [Teleport](/Spells.aspx?ID=338) (at will) - **9th** [Execute](/Spells.aspx?ID=1519), [Toxic Cloud](/Spells.aspx?ID=1722) (×3) - **10th** [Massacre](/Spells.aspx?ID=186) - **Constant (10th)** [Truesight](/Spells.aspx?ID=1727) **Soul** ([Death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48)) The spawn extends feeding stalks to drain the spirit and life from an adjacent [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=90) or helpless creature. The target takes 10d6 spirit damage and must attempt a DC 45 Will save. If the damage from Drain Soul reduces a creature to 0 Hit Points, that creature dies instantly.
**Critical Success** The target takes no damage.
**Success** The target takes half damage and becomes [drained 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=68).
**Failure** The target takes full damage and is drained 2. If it was already drained, its drained condition value increases by 1 to a maximum of drained 4.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but double damage and the target becomes [doomed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=67). **[Pull](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=71)** 30 feet.
From Jeharlu Spores [Treerazer](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3218) uses Jeharlu Spores as his opening gambit against Kyonin in an attempt to spread fungal blights in a sudden and explosive manner. Those same spores, left to germinate in the [Outer Rifts](/Planes.aspx?ID=45), instead develop into spawns of Jeharlu.
name: Spawn Of Jeharlu
